arabicText: 2063 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْهَمَذَانِيِّ وَ كَانَ مَعَنَا حَاجّاً قَالَ: كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَى يَدِ أَبِي جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ أَنَّ أَصْحَابَنَا اِخْتَلَفُوا فِي اَلصَّاعِ بَعْضُهُمْ يَقُولُ اَلْفِطْرَةُ بِصَاعِ اَلْمَدَنِيِّ وَ بَعْضُهُمْ يَقُولُ بِصَاعِ اَلْعِرَاقِيِّ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِلَيَّ «اَلصَّاعُ سِتَّةُ أَرْطَالٍ بِالْمَدَنِيِّ وَ تِسْعَةُ أَرْطَالٍ بِالْعِرَاقِيِّ» قَالَ وَ أَخْبَرَنِي «أَنَّهُ يَكُونُ بِالْوَزْنِ أَلْفاً وَ مِائَةً وَ سَبْعِينَ وَزْنَةً».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2063 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya, from Ja'far ibn Ibrahim ibn Muhammad Al-Hamadhani, who was with us during Hajj. He said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I wrote to Abu Al-Hasan (as) through Abu (a messenger), saying: 'May I be your ransom, our companions have differed regarding the measure of the sa': some say Zakat al-Fitr is based on the Madani sa', while others say it is based on the Iraqi sa'.'
Imam (as) wrote back to me: 'The sa' is six ritls (weights) by the Madani measure and nine ritls by the Iraqi measure.'
Imam (as) further informed me: 'By weight, it is 1,170 weights (units).'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2064 - Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"Whoever cannot find wheat or barley, it is sufficient for him to give in place of it wheat flour, spelt, emmer, or corn."
arabicText: 2064 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «مَنْ لَمْ يَجِدِ اَلْحِنْطَةَ وَ اَلشَّعِيرَ أَجْزَأَ عَنْهُ اَلْقَمْحُ وَ اَلسُّلْتُ وَ اَلْعَلَسُ وَ اَلذُّرَةُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2064 - Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever cannot find wheat or barley, it is sufficient for him to give in place of it wheat flour, spelt, emmer, or corn."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2065 - Muhammad ibn Al-Qasim ibn Al-Fudhayl Al-Basri wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Al-Ridha (as), asking about whether a guardian should pay Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of orphans if they have wealth.
Imam (as) replied: "There is no Zakat upon an orphan."
arabicText: 2065 - كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْقَاسِمِ بْنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ اَلْبَصْرِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : يَسْأَلُهُ عَنِ اَلْوَصِيِّ يُزَكِّي زَكَاةَ اَلْفِطْرَةِ عَنِ اَلْيَتَامَى إِذَا كَانَ لَهُمْ مَالٌ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «لاَ زَكَاةَ عَلَى يَتِيمٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2065 - Muhammad ibn Al-Qasim ibn Al-Fudhayl Al-Basri wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Al-Ridha (as), asking about whether a guardian should pay Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of orphans if they have wealth.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no Zakat upon an orphan."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2066 - It is narrated from Saif ibn Amirah, from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as): 'A man has nothing for Zakat al-Fitr except enough to pay for himself alone. Should he give it for himself, or should he use it for himself and his family?'
Imam (as) replied: 'He should give it to some of his family, and then that person gives it on behalf of another, passing it among themselves, so that it counts as Zakat al-Fitr for all of them collectively.'"
arabicText: 2066 - وَ رَوَى سَيْفُ بْنُ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ لاَ يَكُونُ عِنْدَهُ شَيْءٌ مِنَ اَلْفِطْرَةِ إِلاَّ مَا يُؤَدِّي عَنْ نَفْسِهِ وَحْدَهَا أَ يُعْطِيهِ عَنْهَا أَوْ يَأْكُلُ هُوَ وَ عِيَالُهُ قَالَ «يُعْطِي بَعْضَ عِيَالِهِ ثُمَّ يُعْطِي اَلْآخَرُ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ يُرَدِّدُونَهَا بَيْنَهُمْ فَتَكُونُ عَنْهُمْ جَمِيعاً فِطْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2066 - It is narrated from Saif ibn Amirah, from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as): 'A man has nothing for Zakat al-Fitr except enough to pay for himself alone. Should he give it for himself, or should he use it for himself and his family?'
Imam (as) replied: 'He should give it to some of his family, and then that person gives it on behalf of another, passing it among themselves, so that it counts as Zakat al-Fitr for all of them collectively.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2067 - It is narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Umar ibn Yazid, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who has a guest from among his brethren staying with him when the Day of Eid al-Fitr arrives. Should he pay Zakat al-Fitr on his behalf?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, Zakat al-Fitr is obligatory for everyone he supports, whether male or female, young or old, free or enslaved."
arabicText: 2067 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ عِنْدَهُ اَلضَّيْفُ مِنْ إِخْوَانِهِ فَيَحْضُرُ يَوْمُ اَلْفِطْرِ يُؤَدِّي عَنْهُ اَلْفِطْرَةَ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ اَلْفِطْرَةُ وَاجِبَةٌ عَلَى كُلِّ مَنْ يَعُولُ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنْثَى صَغِيرٍ أَوْ كَبِيرٍ حُرٍّ أَوْ مَمْلُوكٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2067 - It is narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Umar ibn Yazid, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who has a guest from among his brethren staying with him when the Day of Eid al-Fitr arrives. Should he pay Zakat al-Fitr on his behalf?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, Zakat al-Fitr is obligatory for everyone he supports, whether male or female, young or old, free or enslaved."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2068 - It is narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm if a man gives Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of two, three, or even four individuals."
arabicText: 2068 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُعْطِيَ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلرَّجُلَ عَنْ رَأْسَيْنِ وَ ثَلاَثَةٍ وَ أَرْبَعَةٍ يَعْنِي اَلْفِطْرَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2068 - It is narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a man gives Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of two, three, or even four individuals."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2069 - In another narration, it is said:
"There is no harm in giving Zakat al-Fitr for yourself and those you support to a single recipient."
arabicText: 2069 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تَدْفَعَ عَنْ نَفْسِكَ وَ عَنْ مَنْ تَعُولُ إِلَى وَاحِدٍ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2069 - In another narration, it is said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in giving Zakat al-Fitr for yourself and those you support to a single recipient."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2070 - It is narrated by Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a child born on the night of Eid al-Fitr or a Jew or Christian who converts to Islam on the night of Eid al-Fitr.
Imam (as) said: "There is no Zakat al-Fitr upon them. Zakat al-Fitr is only obligatory on those who have completed the month (i.e., were present during Month of Ramadan)."
arabicText: 2070 - رَوَى ذَلِكَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمَوْلُودِ يُولَدُ لَيْلَةَ اَلْفِطْرِ وَ اَلْيَهُودِيِّ وَ اَلنَّصْرَانِيِّ يُسْلِمُ لَيْلَةَ اَلْفِطْرِ قَالَ «لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِمْ فِطْرَةٌ لَيْسَ اَلْفِطْرَةُ إِلاَّ عَلَى مَنْ أَدْرَكَ اَلشَّهْرَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2070 - It is narrated by Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a child born on the night of Eid al-Fitr or a Jew or Christian who converts to Islam on the night of Eid al-Fitr.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no Zakat al-Fitr upon them. Zakat al-Fitr is only obligatory on those who have completed the month (i.e., were present during Month of Ramadan)."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2071 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Isa, from Ali ibn Bilal, who said:
"I wrote to Al-Tayyib Al-Askari (as), asking: 'Is it permissible to give the Zakat al-Fitr for a man's dependents, whether they are ten or fewer or more, to one needy and deserving person?'
Imam (as) wrote in reply: 'Yes, do that.'"
arabicText: 2071 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ بِلاَلٍ قَالَ: كَتَبْتُ إِلَى اَلطَّيِّبِ اَلْعَسْكَرِيِّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ هَلْ يَجُوزُ أَنْ يُعْطَى اَلْفِطْرَةُ عَنْ عِيَالِ اَلرَّجُلِ وَ هُمْ عَشَرَةٌ أَقَلُّ أَوْ أَكْثَرُ رَجُلاً مُحْتَاجاً مُوَافِقاً فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «نَعَمِ اِفْعَلْ ذَلِكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2071 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Isa, from Ali ibn Bilal, who said:
"I wrote to Al-Tayyib Al-Askari (as), asking: 'Is it permissible to give the Zakat al-Fitr for a man's dependents, whether they are ten or fewer or more, to one needy and deserving person?'
Imam (as) wrote in reply:
thaqalaynMatn: 'Yes, do that.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2072 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a mukatab (a slave who has a contract to earn their freedom):
"Is Zakat al-Fitr obligatory upon the mukatab or upon the one who wrote the contract of emancipation for him? And is his testimony valid?"
Imam (as) replied: "Zakat al-Fitr is obligatory upon him (the mukatab), but his testimony is not valid."
arabicText: 2072 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُكَاتَبِ هَلْ عَلَيْهِ فِطْرَةُ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ أَوْ عَلَى مَنْ كَاتَبَهُ وَ تَجُوزُ شَهَادَتُهُ قَالَ «اَلْفِطْرَةُ عَلَيْهِ وَ لاَ تَجُوزُ شَهَادَتُهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2072 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a mukatab (a slave who has a contract to earn their freedom):
"Is Zakat al-Fitr obligatory upon the mukatab or upon the one who wrote the contract of emancipation for him? And is his testimony valid?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Zakat al-Fitr is obligatory upon him (the mukatab), but his testimony is not valid."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2073 - Muhammad ibn Al-Qasim ibn Al-Fudhayl wrote to Abu Al-Hasan Al-Ridha (as), asking:
"A slave’s master dies while the slave is away in another town, and the slave has money belonging to his deceased master. When Eid al-Fitr arrives, should the slave pay Zakat al-Fitr for himself from the money of his master, which has now passed to the orphans?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes."
arabicText: 2073 - وَ كَتَبَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْقَاسِمِ بْنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : يَسْأَلُهُ عَنِ اَلْمَمْلُوكِ يَمُوتُ عَنْهُ مَوْلاَهُ وَ هُوَ عَنْهُ غَائِبٌ فِي بَلْدَةٍ أُخْرَى وَ فِي يَدِهِ مَالٌ لِمَوْلاَهُ وَ يَحْضُرُ اَلْفِطْرُ أَ يُزَكِّي عَنْ نَفْسِهِ مِنْ مَالِ مَوْلاَهُ وَ قَدْ صَارَ لِلْيَتَامَى فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ ».

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2074 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"To give one sa' (measure) of dates for Zakat al-Fitr is more beloved to me than giving one sa' of gold."
arabicText: 2074 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لَأَنْ أُعْطِيَ فِي اَلْفِطْرَةِ صَاعاً مِنْ تَمْرٍ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ أَنْ أُعْطِيَ صَاعاً مِنْ تِبْرٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2074 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "To give one sa' (measure) of dates for Zakat al-Fitr is more beloved to me than giving one sa' of gold."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2075 - It is narrated from Hisham ibn Al-Hakam, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
"Dates are preferred for Zakat al-Fitr over other items because they are of quicker benefit. When they reach the hands of the recipient, they can immediately eat from them."
Imam (as) added: "Zakat was revealed at a time when people did not have much wealth; thus, Zakat al-Fitr was established."
arabicText: 2075 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ هِشَامُ بْنُ اَلْحَكَمِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «اَلتَّمْرُ فِي اَلْفِطْرَةِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ غَيْرِهِ لِأَنَّهُ أَسْرَعُ مَنْفَعَةً وَ ذَلِكَ أَنَّهُ إِذَا وَقَعَ فِي يَدِ صَاحِبِهِ أَكَلَ مِنْهُ» قَالَ «وَ نَزَلَتِ اَلزَّكَاةُ وَ لَيْسَ لِلنَّاسِ أَمْوَالٌ وَ إِنَّمَا كَانَتِ اَلْفِطْرَةُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2075 - It is narrated from Hisham ibn Al-Hakam, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Dates are preferred for Zakat al-Fitr over other items because they are of quicker benefit. When they reach the hands of the recipient, they can immediately eat from them."
Imam (as) added: "Zakat was revealed at a time when people did not have much wealth; thus, Zakat al-Fitr was established."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2076 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about Zakat al-Fitr.
Imam (as) said: "Neighbors have the greatest right to it, and there is no harm in giving its equivalent value in silver."
arabicText: 2076 - وَ سَأَلَ إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْفِطْرَةِ فَقَالَ «الْجِيرَانُ أَحَقُّ بِهَا وَ لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُعْطَى قِيمَةُ ذَلِكَ فِضَّةً.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2076 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about Zakat al-Fitr.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Neighbors have the greatest right to it, and there is no harm in giving its equivalent value in silver."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2077 - Ali ibn Yaqtin asked Imam Abu Al-Hasan Al-Awwal (as) about Zakat al-Fitr:
"Is it permissible to give it to neighbors or close acquaintances who do not share the same beliefs or who do not acknowledge (the Imamate)?"
Imam (as) replied: "There is no harm in that if they are in need."
arabicText: 2077 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ يَقْطِينٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ زَكَاةِ اَلْفِطْرَةِ أَ يَصْلُحُ أَنْ يُعْطَى اَلْجِيرَانُ وَ اَلظُّئُورَةُ مِمَّنْ لاَ يَعْرِفُ وَ لاَ يَنْصِبُ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ إِذَا كَانَ مُحْتَاجاً ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2077 - Ali ibn Yaqtin asked Imam Abu Al-Hasan Al-Awwal (as) about Zakat al-Fitr:
"Is it permissible to give it to neighbors or close acquaintances who do not share the same beliefs or who do not acknowledge (the Imamate)?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in that if they are in need."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2078 - It is narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, from Mu’attib, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"Go and give Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of our household and for the servants. Include all of them and do not leave anyone out. If you leave out even one person, I fear for them the 'fawt' (loss)."
I asked: "What is 'fawt'?"
Imam (as) replied: "Death."
arabicText: 2078 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ مُعَتِّبٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «اِذْهَبْ فَأَعْطِ عَنْ عِيَالِنَا اَلْفِطْرَةَ وَ عَنِ اَلرَّقِيقِ وَ اِجْمَعْهُمْ وَ لاَ تَدَعْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَداً فَإِنَّكَ إِنْ تَرَكْتَ مِنْهُمْ إِنْسَاناً تَخَوَّفْتُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْفَوْتَ» قُلْتُ وَ مَا اَلْفَوْتُ قَالَ «اَلْمَوْتُ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2078 - It is narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, from Mu’attib, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Go and give Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of our household and for the servants. Include all of them and do not leave anyone out. If you leave out even one person, I fear for them the 'fawt' (loss)."
I asked: "What is 'fawt'?"
Imam (as) replied: "Death."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2079 - It is narrated from Safwan, from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, who said:
"I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who spends on another man who is not part of his household but for whom he voluntarily provides sustenance and clothing. Is Zakat al-Fitr obligatory on him for that person?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, Zakat al-Fitr is only obligatory for one’s dependents, not for such a person."
Imam (as) further said: "Dependents include children, servants, a wife, and an umm al-walad (a bondwoman who bore a child for her master)."
arabicText: 2079 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ اَلْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يُنْفِقُ عَلَى رَجُلٍ لَيْسَ مِنْ عِيَالِهِ إِلاَّ أَنَّهُ يَتَكَلَّفُ لَهُ نَفَقَتَهُ وَ كِسْوَتَهُ أَ يَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ فِطْرَتُهُ قَالَ «لاَ إِنَّمَا يَكُونُ فِطْرَتُهُ عَلَى عِيَالِهِ صَدَقَةً دُونَهُ» وَ قَالَ «اَلْعِيَالُ اَلْوَلَدُ وَ اَلْمَمْلُوكُ وَ اَلزَّوْجَةُ وَ أُمُّ اَلْوَلَدِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2079 - It is narrated from Safwan, from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about a man who spends on another man who is not part of his household but for whom he voluntarily provides sustenance and clothing. Is Zakat al-Fitr obligatory on him for that person?"
Imam (as) replied: "No, Zakat al-Fitr is only obligatory for one’s dependents, not for such a person."
Imam (as) further said: "Dependents include children, servants, a wife, and an umm al-walad (a bondwoman who bore a child for her master)."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2080 - It is narrated from Safwan ibn Yahya, from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about Zakat al-Fitr.
Imam (as) said: 'Once you have set it aside, it does not harm you when you give it, whether before or after the prayer.'
Imam (as) also said: 'It is obligatory for you to give Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of yourself, your father, your mother, your children, your wife, and your servant.'"
arabicText: 2080 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْفِطْرَةِ قَالَ «إِذَا عَزَلْتَهَا فَلاَ يَضُرُّكَ مَتَى مَا أَعْطَيْتَهَا قَبْلَ اَلصَّلاَةِ أَوْ بَعْدَهَا » وَ قَالَ «اَلْوَاجِبُ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ تُعْطِيَ عَنْ نَفْسِكَ وَ أَبِيكَ وَ أُمِّكَ وَ وَلَدِكَ وَ اِمْرَأَتِكَ وَ خَادِمِكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2080 - It is narrated from Safwan ibn Yahya, from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about Zakat al-Fitr.
Imam (as) said: 'Once you have set it aside, it does not harm you when you give it, whether before or after the prayer.'
Imam (as) also said: 'It is obligatory for you to give Zakat al-Fitr on behalf of yourself, your father, your mother, your children, your wife, and your servant.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2081 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"I asked him about what is obligatory upon a man regarding Zakat al-Fitr for his household.
Imam (as) said: 'Give Zakat al-Fitr for everyone you support, whether free or enslaved, young or old, as long as they have reached the time of the prayer (Eid prayer).'"
arabicText: 2081 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَمَّا يَجِبُ عَلَى اَلرَّجُلِ فِي أَهْلِهِ مِنْ صَدَقَةِ اَلْفِطْرَةِ قَالَ «تَصَدَّقْ عَنْ جَمِيعِ مَنْ تَعُولُ مِنْ حُرٍّ أَوْ عَبْدٍ أَوْ صَغِيرٍ أَوْ كَبِيرٍ مَنْ أَدْرَكَ مِنْهُمُ اَلصَّلاَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2081 - It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"I asked him about what is obligatory upon a man regarding Zakat al-Fitr for his household.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: 'Give Zakat al-Fitr for everyone you support, whether free or enslaved, young or old, as long as they have reached the time of the prayer (Eid prayer).'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2082 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Mas'ud Al-Ayyashi, who said: Muhammad ibn Nusair narrated to us, saying: Sahl ibn Ziyad narrated to us, saying: Mansur ibn Al-Abbas narrated to us, saying: Isma'il ibn Sahl narrated from Hammad ibn Isa, from Hariz, from Zurara, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about slaves shared among a group of people, whether Zakat al-Fitr is obligatory on them.
Imam (as) said: "If each person owns a full share (equivalent to one head), then he must pay Zakat al-Fitr for that share. However, if the number of slaves and owners are equal and they are collectively owned, then they are equal in responsibility, and each must pay Zakat al-Fitr proportionate to their share. But if each person's share is less than a full head, then there is no obligation upon them."
arabicText: 2082 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مَسْعُودٍ اَلْعَيَّاشِيُّ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ نُصَيْرٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي مَنْصُورُ بْنُ اَلْعَبَّاسِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ سَهْلٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: قُلْتُ رَقِيقٌ بَيْنَ قَوْمٍ عَلَيْهِمْ فِيهِ زَكَاةُ اَلْفِطْرَةِ قَالَ «إِذَا كَانَ لِكُلِّ إِنْسَانٍ رَأْسٌ فَعَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُؤَدِّيَ عَنْهُ فِطْرَتَهُ وَ إِذَا كَانَ عِدَّةُ اَلْعَبِيدِ وَ عِدَّةُ اَلْمَوَالِي سَوَاءً وَ كَانُوا جَمِيعاً فَهُمْ سَوَاءٌ أَدَّوْا زَكَاتَهُمْ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمْ عَلَى قَدْرِ حِصَّتِهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ لِكُلِّ إِنْسَانٍ مِنْهُمْ أَقَلُّ مِنْ رَأْسٍ فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِمْ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2082 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Mas'ud Al-Ayyashi, who said: Muhammad ibn Nusair narrated to us, saying: Sahl ibn Ziyad narrated to us, saying: Mansur ibn Al-Abbas narrated to us, saying: Isma'il ibn Sahl narrated from Hammad ibn Isa, from Hariz, from Zurara, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about slaves shared among a group of people, whether Zakat al-Fitr is obligatory on them.
Imam (as) said: "If each person owns a full share (equivalent to one head), then he must pay Zakat al-Fitr for that share. However, if the number of slaves and owners are equal and they are collectively owned, then they are equal in responsibility, and each must pay Zakat al-Fitr proportionate to their share. But if each person's share is less than a full head, then there is no obligation upon them."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2083 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Bazi', who said:
"I sent some dirhams to Abu Al-Hasan Al-Ridha (as) on behalf of myself and others, and I wrote to him informing him that it was for the Zakat al-Fitr of the dependents.
Imam (as) wrote back in his own handwriting: 'I have received it.'"
arabicText: 2083 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ قَالَ: بَعَثْتُ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِدَرَاهِمَ لِي وَ لِغَيْرِي وَ كَتَبْتُ إِلَيْهِ أُخْبِرُهُ أَنَّهَا مِنْ فِطْرَةِ اَلْعِيَالِ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِخَطِّهِ «قَبَضْتُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2083 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Bazi', who said:
"I sent some dirhams to Abu Al-Hasan Al-Ridha (as) on behalf of myself and others, and I wrote to him informing him that it was for the Zakat al-Fitr of the dependents.
Imam (as) wrote back in his own handwriting:
thaqalaynMatn: 'I have received it.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2084 - In a narration from Al-Sakuni, with his chain of transmission, it is reported that Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever pays Zakat al-Fitr, Allah (swt) will complete with it whatever is lacking in the Zakat of his wealth."
arabicText: 2084 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ بِإِسْنَادِهِ أَنَّ أَمِيرَ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «مَنْ أَدَّى زَكَاةَ اَلْفِطْرَةِ تَمَّمَ اَللَّهُ لَهُ بِهَا مَا نَقَصَ مِنْ زَكَاةِ مَالِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2084 - In a narration from Al-Sakuni, with his chain of transmission, it is reported that Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever pays Zakat al-Fitr, Allah (swt) will complete with it whatever is lacking in the Zakat of his wealth."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on Zakat Al-Fitrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2085 - It is narrated by Hammad ibn Isa, from Hariz, from Abu Basir and Zurara, who both said that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"Indeed, completing the fast includes giving Zakat, meaning Zakat al-Fitr, just as sending blessings upon the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) is part of completing the prayer. For whoever fasts but does not pay the Zakat (al-Fitr), their fast is not accepted if they intentionally neglect it. Similarly, whoever prays but does not send blessings upon the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), their prayer is not complete.
Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, has mentioned it (Zakat) before prayer, saying:
'He indeed is successful who purifies himself and remembers the name of his Lord (azj) and prays.' (Surah Al-A'la 87:14-15)
arabicText:
2085 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ وَ زُرَارَةَ قَالاَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «إِنَّ مِنْ تَمَامِ اَلصَّوْمِ إِعْطَاءُ اَلزَّكَاةِ يَعْنِي اَلْفِطْرَةَ كَمَا أَنَّ اَلصَّلاَةَ عَلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ مِنْ تَمَامِ اَلصَّلاَةِ لِأَنَّهُ مَنْ صَامَ وَ لَمْ يُؤَدِّ اَلزَّكَاةَ فَلاَ صَوْمَ لَهُ إِذَا تَرَكَهَا مُتَعَمِّداً وَ لاَ صَلاَةَ لَهُ إِذَا تَرَكَ اَلصَّلاَةَ عَلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَدْ بَدَأَ بِهَا قَبْلَ اَلصَّلاَةِ قَالَ
«۝ قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ تَزَكّٰى. `وَ ذَكَرَ اِسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلّٰى ۝»
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2085 - It is narrated by Hammad ibn Isa, from Hariz, from Abu Basir and Zurara, who both said that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Indeed, completing the fast includes giving Zakat, meaning Zakat al-Fitr, just as sending blessings upon the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) is part of completing the prayer. For whoever fasts but does not pay the Zakat (al-Fitr), their fast is not accepted if they intentionally neglect it. Similarly, whoever prays but does not send blessings upon the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), their prayer is not complete.
Allah (swt), the Almighty and Majestic, has mentioned it (Zakat) before prayer, saying:
'He indeed is successful who purifies himself and remembers the name of his Lord (azj) and prays.' (Surah Al-A'la 87:14-15)

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2086 - It is narrated by Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
"There is no valid i'tikaf (spiritual retreat) except with fasting and in a congregational mosque."
arabicText: 2086 - رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ اِعْتِكَافَ إِلاَّ بِصَوْمٍ فِي مَسْجِدِ اَلْجَامِعِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2086 - It is narrated by Al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no valid i'tikaf (spiritual retreat) except with fasting and in a congregational mosque."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2087 - It is narrated:
"When the last ten nights of Month of Ramadan arrived, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) would perform i'tikaf in the mosque. A tent made of hair would be set up for him, he would tighten his waist wrap, and he would fold up his bedding."
Some people said he would also avoid the company of women.
Regarding this, Abu Abdullah (as) said: "As for avoiding women, no."
arabicText: 2087 - قَالَ: «وَ كَانَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ إِذَا كَانَ اَلْعَشْرُ اَلْأَوَاخِرُ اِعْتَكَفَ فِي اَلْمَسْجِدِ وَ ضُرِبَتْ لَهُ قُبَّةٌ مِنْ شَعْرٍ وَ شَمَّرَ اَلْمِئْزَرَ وَ طَوَى فِرَاشَهُ » وَ قَالَ بَعْضُهُمْ وَ اِعْتَزَلَ اَلنِّسَاءَ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «أَمَّا اِعْتِزَالُ اَلنِّسَاءِ فَلاَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2087 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When the last ten nights of Month of Ramadan arrived, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) would perform i'tikaf in the mosque. A tent made of hair would be set up for him, he would tighten his waist wrap, and he would fold up his bedding."
Some people said he would also avoid the company of women.
Regarding this, Abu Abdullah (as) said: "As for avoiding women, no."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2088 - Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"The Battle of Badr occurred in the Month of Ramadan, so the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) did not perform i'tikaf that year. However, in the following year, he performed i'tikaf for twenty days: ten days for that year's obligation and ten days as compensation for what he had missed."
arabicText: 2088 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «كَانَتْ بَدْرٌ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ فَلَمْ يَعْتَكِفْ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَلَمَّا أَنْ كَانَ مِنْ قَابِلٍ اِعْتَكَفَ عَشْرَيْنِ عَشْراً لِعَامِهِ وَ عَشْراً قَضَاءً لِمَا فَاتَهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2088 - Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Battle of Badr occurred in the Month of Ramadan, so the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) did not perform i'tikaf that year. However, in the following year, he performed i'tikaf for twenty days: ten days for that year's obligation and ten days as compensation for what he had missed."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2089 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Umar ibn Yazid, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as): 'What do you say about performing i'tikaf in Baghdad in some of its mosques?'
Imam (as) replied: 'Do not perform i'tikaf except in a congregational mosque where a just Imam has led the congregation in prayer. There is no harm in performing i'tikaf in the mosque of Kufa, the mosque of Basra, the mosque of Medina, and the mosque of Mecca.'"
arabicText: 2089 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي اَلاِعْتِكَافِ بِبَغْدَادَ فِي بَعْضِ مَسَاجِدِهَا قَالَ «لاَ تَعْتَكِفْ إِلاَّ فِي مَسْجِدِ جَمَاعَةٍ قَدْ صَلَّى فِيهِ إِمَامٌ عَدْلٌ جَمَاعَةً وَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يُعْتَكَفَ فِي مَسْجِدِ اَلْكُوفَةِ وَ اَلْبَصْرَةِ وَ مَسْجِدِ اَلْمَدِينَةِ وَ مَسْجِدِ مَكَّةَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2089 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Umar ibn Yazid, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as): 'What do you say about performing i'tikaf in Baghdad in some of its mosques?'
Imam (as) replied: 'Do not perform i'tikaf except in a congregational mosque where a just Imam has led the congregation in prayer. There is no harm in performing i'tikaf in the mosque of Kufa, the mosque of Basra, the mosque of Medina, and the mosque of Mecca.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2090 - It has also been narrated: "I'tikaf is permissible in the mosque of Al-Mada’in."
arabicText: 2090 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ: «فِي مَسْجِدِ اَلْمَدَائِنِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2090 - It has also been narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "I'tikaf is permissible in the mosque of Al-Mada’in."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2091 - It is narrated by Al-Bazanti, from Dawud ibn Sirhan, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"I do not consider i'tikaf valid except in the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram), the Mosque of the Messenger (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), or a congregational mosque. The one performing i'tikaf should not leave the congregational mosque except for a necessity that cannot be avoided, and they should not sit until they return. The same applies to women."
arabicText: 2091 - وَ رَوَى اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ سِرْحَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «لاَ أَرَى اَلاِعْتِكَافَ إِلاَّ فِي اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلْحَرَامِ أَوْ مَسْجِدِ اَلرَّسُولِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أَوْ فِي مَسْجِدِ اَلْجَامِعِ وَ لاَ يَنْبَغِي لِلْمُعْتَكِفِ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلْجَامِعِ إِلاَّ لِحَاجَةٍ لاَ بُدَّ مِنْهَا ثُمَّ لاَ يَجْلِسُ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ وَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ مِثْلُ ذَلِكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2091 - It is narrated by Al-Bazanti, from Dawud ibn Sirhan, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I do not consider i'tikaf valid except in the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram), the Mosque of the Messenger (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), or a congregational mosque. The one performing i'tikaf should not leave the congregational mosque except for a necessity that cannot be avoided, and they should not sit until they return. The same applies to women."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2092 - In a narration from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as), it is reported:
"The one performing i'tikaf in Mecca may pray in any of its houses; it is the same whether they pray in the mosque or in its houses."
arabicText: 2092 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «اَلْمُعْتَكِفُ بِمَكَّةَ يُصَلِّي فِي أَيِّ بُيُوتِهَا شَاءَ سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِ صَلَّى فِي اَلْمَسْجِدِ أَوْ فِي بُيُوتِهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2092 - In a narration from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as), it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one performing i'tikaf in Mecca may pray in any of its houses; it is the same whether they pray in the mosque or in its houses."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2093 - In a narration from Mansur ibn Hazim, from Abu Abdullah (as), it is reported:
"The one performing i'tikaf in Mecca may pray in any of its houses as they wish. However, the one performing i'tikaf elsewhere must pray only in the specific mosque designated for their i'tikaf."
arabicText: 2093 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «اَلْمُعْتَكِفُ بِمَكَّةَ يُصَلِّي فِي أَيِّ بُيُوتِهَا شَاءَ وَ اَلْمُعْتَكِفُ فِي غَيْرِهَا لاَ يُصَلِّي إِلاَّ فِي اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلَّذِي سَمَّاهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2093 - In a narration from Mansur ibn Hazim, from Abu Abdullah (as), it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one performing i'tikaf in Mecca may pray in any of its houses as they wish. However, the one performing i'tikaf elsewhere must pray only in the specific mosque designated for their i'tikaf."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2094 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Abu Walad Al-Hannat, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman whose husband was absent. While she was performing i'tikaf with her husband's permission, he returned, and upon hearing of his arrival, she left the mosque where she was performing i'tikaf, prepared herself for him, and engaged in intimacy with him.
Imam (as) said: 'If she left the mosque before completing three days and had not stipulated any conditions for her i'tikaf, then she incurs the same penalty as that of one who has taken a vow of zihar (penalty for breaking a serious vow).'"
arabicText: 2094 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي وَلاَّدٍ اَلْحَنَّاطِ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ كَانَ زَوْجُهَا غَائِباً فَقَدِمَ وَ هِيَ مُعْتَكِفَةٌ بِإِذْنِ زَوْجِهَا فَخَرَجَتْ حِينَ بَلَغَهَا قُدُومُهُ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلَّذِي هِيَ فِيهِ فَتَهَيَّأَتْ لِزَوْجِهَا حَتَّى وَاقَعَهَا فَقَالَ إِنْ كَانَتْ خَرَجَتْ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَمْضِيَ ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَ لَمْ تَكُنِ اِشْتَرَطَتْ فِي اِعْتِكَافِهَا فَإِنَّ عَلَيْهَا مَا عَلَى اَلْمُظَاهِرِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2094 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Abu Walad Al-Hannat, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman whose husband was absent. While she was performing i'tikaf with her husband's permission, he returned, and upon hearing of his arrival, she left the mosque where she was performing i'tikaf, prepared herself for him, and engaged in intimacy with him.
Imam (as) said: 'If she left the mosque before completing three days and had not stipulated any conditions for her i'tikaf, then she incurs the same penalty as that of one who has taken a vow of zihar (penalty for breaking a serious vow).'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2095 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Abu Ayyub, from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"I'tikaf cannot be for less than three days. Whoever performs i'tikaf must fast, and it is appropriate for the one performing i'tikaf to make a stipulation, just as one who enters into ihram (for pilgrimage) makes a stipulation."
arabicText: 2095 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «لاَ يَكُونُ اَلاِعْتِكَافُ أَقَلَّ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ وَ مَنِ اِعْتَكَفَ صَامَ وَ يَنْبَغِي لِلْمُعْتَكِفِ إِذَا اِعْتَكَفَ أَنْ يَشْتَرِطَ كَمَا يَشْتَرِطُ اَلَّذِي يُحْرِمُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2095 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Abu Ayyub, from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I'tikaf cannot be for less than three days. Whoever performs i'tikaf must fast, and it is appropriate for the one performing i'tikaf to make a stipulation, just as one who enters into ihram (for pilgrimage) makes a stipulation."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2096 - It is narrated by Abu Ayyub, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"If a man begins i'tikaf for one day and has not made any stipulation, he is allowed to leave and break his i'tikaf. However, if he has completed two days without making a stipulation, he is not permitted to break his i'tikaf until three days have been completed."
arabicText: 2096 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «إِذَا اِعْتَكَفَ اَلرَّجُلُ يَوْماً وَ لَمْ يَكُنِ اِشْتَرَطَ فَلَهُ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ وَ أَنْ يَفْسَخَ اِعْتِكَافَهُ وَ إِنْ أَقَامَ يَوْمَيْنِ وَ لَمْ يَكُنِ اِشْتَرَطَ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَفْسَخَ اِعْتِكَافَهُ حَتَّى تَمْضِيَ ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2096 - It is narrated by Abu Ayyub, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man begins i'tikaf for one day and has not made any stipulation, he is allowed to leave and break his i'tikaf. However, if he has completed two days without making a stipulation, he is not permitted to break his i'tikaf until three days have been completed."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2097 - It is narrated by Abu Ayyub, from Abu Ubaydah, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"The one performing i'tikaf must not smell perfume, enjoy fragrant plants, engage in argumentation, buy, or sell."
Imam (as) further said: "Whoever performs i'tikaf for three days has the option on the fourth day: if they wish, they may continue for another three days, or if they wish, they may leave the mosque. However, if they stay for two days after the initial three, they must complete another three days and not leave the mosque until they have done so."
arabicText: 2097 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «اَلْمُعْتَكِفُ لاَ يَشَمُّ اَلطِّيبَ وَ لاَ يَتَلَذَّذُ بِالرَّيْحَانِ وَ لاَ يُمَارِي وَ لاَ يَشْتَرِي وَ لاَ يَبِيعُ» قَالَ «وَ مَنِ اِعْتَكَفَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ فَهُوَ يَوْمَ اَلرَّابِعِ بِالْخِيَارِ إِنْ شَاءَ زَادَ ثَلاَثَةً أُخْرَى وَ إِنْ شَاءَ خَرَجَ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ فَإِنْ أَقَامَ يَوْمَيْنِ بَعْدَ اَلثَّلاَثَةِ فَلاَ يَخْرُجْ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ حَتَّى يُتِمَّ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ أُخَرَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2097 - It is narrated by Abu Ayyub, from Abu Ubaydah, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The one performing i'tikaf must not smell perfume, enjoy fragrant plants, engage in argumentation, buy, or sell."
Imam (as) further said: "Whoever performs i'tikaf for three days has the option on the fourth day: if they wish, they may continue for another three days, or if they wish, they may leave the mosque. However, if they stay for two days after the initial three, they must complete another three days and not leave the mosque until they have done so."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2098 - It is narrated from Dawud ibn Sirhan, who said:
"I was in Medina during the Month of Ramadan, and I said to Abu Abdullah (as): 'I wish to perform i'tikaf. What should I say, and what should I make obligatory upon myself?'
Imam (as) said: 'Do not leave the mosque except for an unavoidable necessity, and do not sit under any shade until you return to your place in the mosque.'"
arabicText: 2098 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ سِرْحَانَ قَالَ: كُنْتُ بِالْمَدِينَةِ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ فَقُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَعْتَكِفَ فَمَا ذَا أَقُولُ وَ مَا ذَا أَفْرِضُ عَلَى نَفْسِي فَقَالَ «لاَ تَخْرُجْ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ إِلاَّ لِحَاجَةٍ لاَ بُدَّ مِنْهَا وَ لاَ تَقْعُدْ تَحْتَ ظِلاَلٍ حَتَّى تَعُودَ إِلَى مَجْلِسِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2098 - It is narrated from Dawud ibn Sirhan, who said:
"I was in Medina during the Month of Ramadan, and I said to Abu Abdullah (as): 'I wish to perform i'tikaf. What should I say, and what should I make obligatory upon myself?'
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: 'Do not leave the mosque except for an unavoidable necessity, and do not sit under any shade until you return to your place in the mosque.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2099 - It is narrated by Al-Halabi, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"It is not appropriate for the one performing i'tikaf to leave the mosque except for an unavoidable necessity, and they should not sit until they return. They should only leave for attending a funeral or visiting a sick person, and even then, they should not sit until they return to the mosque. The i'tikaf of a woman is the same as this."
arabicText: 2099 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «لاَ يَنْبَغِي لِلْمُعْتَكِفِ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ إِلاَّ لِحَاجَةٍ لاَ بُدَّ مِنْهَا ثُمَّ لاَ يَجْلِسُ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ وَ لاَ يَخْرُجُ فِي شَيْءٍ إِلاَّ لِجَنَازَةٍ أَوْ يَعُودُ مَرِيضاً وَ لاَ يَجْلِسُ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ قَالَ وَ اِعْتِكَافُ اَلْمَرْأَةِ مِثْلُ ذَلِكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2099 - It is narrated by Al-Halabi, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is not appropriate for the one performing i'tikaf to leave the mosque except for an unavoidable necessity, and they should not sit until they return. They should only leave for attending a funeral or visiting a sick person, and even then, they should not sit until they return to the mosque. The i'tikaf of a woman is the same as this."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2100 - In a narration from Safwan ibn Yahya, from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, from Abu Abdullah (as), it is reported:
"If the one performing i'tikaf falls ill, or if the woman performing i'tikaf experiences menstruation, they may return to their home. Once they recover, they should resume their i'tikaf and complete it while fasting."
arabicText: 2100 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ اَلْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «إِذَا مَرِضَ اَلْمُعْتَكِفُ أَوْ طَمِثَتِ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُعْتَكِفَةُ فَإِنَّهُ يَأْتِي بَيْتَهُ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُ إِذَا بَرَأَ وَ يَصُومُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2100 - In a narration from Safwan ibn Yahya, from Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj, from Abu Abdullah (as), it is reported:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the one performing i'tikaf falls ill, or if the woman performing i'tikaf experiences menstruation, they may return to their home. Once they recover, they should resume their i'tikaf and complete it while fasting."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2101 - In a narration from Al-Sakuni, with his chain of transmission, it is reported that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"Performing i'tikaf for ten days in the Month of Ramadan is equivalent to two Hajj and two Umrah."
arabicText: 2101 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلسَّكُونِيِّ بِإِسْنَادِهِ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : «اِعْتِكَافُ عَشْرٍ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ يَعْدِلُ حَجَّتَيْنِ وَ عُمْرَتَيْنِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2101 - In a narration from Al-Sakuni, with his chain of transmission, it is reported that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Performing i'tikaf for ten days in the Month of Ramadan is equivalent to two Hajj and two Umrah."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2102 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Zurara, who said:
"I asked Abu Ja'far (as) about the ruling on an individual performing i'tikaf who engages in sexual relations.
Imam (as) said: 'If they do so, they incur the same penalty as one who has taken a vow of zihar (atonement).'"
It has also been narrated: "If they engage in sexual relations during the night, they must pay one expiation. However, if they engage in sexual relations during the day, they must pay two expiations."
arabicText:
2102 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْمُعْتَكِفِ يُجَامِعُ قَالَ «إِذَا فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ فَعَلَيْهِ مَا عَلَى اَلْمُظَاهِرِ ».
وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ إِنْ جَامَعَ فِي اَللَّيْلِ فَعَلَيْهِ كَفَّارَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ وَ إِنْ جَامَعَ بِالنَّهَارِ فَعَلَيْهِ كَفَّارَتَانِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2102 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Zurara, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Ja'far (as) about the ruling on an individual performing i'tikaf who engages in sexual relations.
Imam (as) said: 'If they do so, they incur the same penalty as one who has taken a vow of zihar (atonement).'"
It has also been narrated: "If they engage in sexual relations during the night, they must pay one expiation. However, if they engage in sexual relations during the day, they must pay two expiations."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2103 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Sinan, from Abdul-A‘la ibn A‘yan, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who engaged in sexual relations with his wife at night while performing i'tikaf during the Month of Ramadan.
Imam (as) said: 'He must pay one expiation.'
I then asked: 'What if he engaged in sexual relations during the day?'
Imam (as) said: 'He must pay two expiations.'"
arabicText: 2103 - رَوَى ذَلِكَ ، مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْأَعْلَى بْنِ أَعْيَنَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ وَطِئَ اِمْرَأَتَهُ وَ هُوَ مُعْتَكِفٌ لَيْلاً فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ اَلْكَفَّارَةُ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ وَطِئَهَا نَهَاراً قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ كَفَّارَتَانِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2103 - It is narrated by Muhammad ibn Sinan, from Abdul-A‘la ibn A‘yan, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who engaged in sexual relations with his wife at night while performing i'tikaf during the Month of Ramadan.
Imam (as) said: 'He must pay one expiation.'
I then asked: 'What if he engaged in sexual relations during the day?'
Imam (as) said: 'He must pay two expiations.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2104 - It is narrated by Ibn Al-Mughira, from Sama'ah, who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person performing i'tikaf who engaged in sexual relations with their spouse.
Imam (as) said: 'They are like one who has broken their fast on a day of Month of Ramadan.'"
arabicText: 2104 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ اَلْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ مُعْتَكِفٍ وَاقَعَ أَهْلَهُ فَقَالَ «هُوَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ مَنْ أَفْطَرَ يَوْماً مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2104 - It is narrated by Ibn Al-Mughira, from Sama'ah, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person performing i'tikaf who engaged in sexual relations with their spouse.
Imam (as) said: 'They are like one who has broken their fast on a day of Month of Ramadan.'"

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2105 - It is narrated by Dawud ibn Al-Husayn, from Abu Al-Abbas, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) performed i'tikaf in the first ten days of Month of Ramadan, then in the second ten days (the middle ten), and then in the last ten days. After that, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) consistently performed i'tikaf in the last ten days of Month of Ramadan."
arabicText: 2105 - وَ رَوَى دَاوُدُ بْنُ اَلْحُصَيْنِ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْعَبَّاسِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «اِعْتَكَفَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ فِي اَلْعَشْرِ اَلْأُولَى ثُمَّ اِعْتَكَفَ فِي اَلثَّانِيَةِ فِي اَلْعَشْرِ اَلْوُسْطَى ثُمَّ اِعْتَكَفَ فِي اَلثَّالِثَةِ فِي اَلْعَشْرِ اَلْأَوَاخِرِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَزَلْ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ يَعْتَكِفُ فِي اَلْعَشْرِ اَلْأَوَاخِرِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2105 - It is narrated by Dawud ibn Al-Husayn, from Abu Al-Abbas, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) performed i'tikaf in the first ten days of Month of Ramadan, then in the second ten days (the middle ten), and then in the last ten days. After that, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) consistently performed i'tikaf in the last ten days of Month of Ramadan."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2106 - It is narrated by Ibn Mahbub, from Abu Ayyub, from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a woman performing i'tikaf who experiences menstruation.
Imam (as) said: "She should return to her home, and when she becomes pure, she should return and make up for what she missed."
arabicText: 2106 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمُعْتَكِفَةِ إِذَا طَمِثَتْ قَالَ «تَرْجِعُ إِلَى بَيْتِهَا فَإِذَا طَهُرَتْ رَجَعَتْ فَقَضَتْ مَا عَلَيْهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2106 - It is narrated by Ibn Mahbub, from Abu Ayyub, from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a woman performing i'tikaf who experiences menstruation.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "She should return to her home, and when she becomes pure, she should return and make up for what she missed."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2107 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Al-Jahm, from Abu Al-Hasan (as), who was asked about a person performing i'tikaf engaging in relations with their spouse.
Imam (as) said: "They must not approach their wife, neither by night nor by day, while they are in i'tikaf."
arabicText: 2107 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ اَلْجَهْمِ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُعْتَكِفِ يَأْتِي أَهْلَهُ قَالَ «لاَ يَأْتِي اِمْرَأَتَهُ لَيْلاً وَ لاَ نَهَاراً وَ هُوَ مُعْتَكِفٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2107 - It is narrated by Al-Hasan ibn Al-Jahm, from Abu Al-Hasan (as), who was asked about a person performing i'tikaf engaging in relations with their spouse.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They must not approach their wife, neither by night nor by day, while they are in i'tikaf."

category: Book of Fasting
chapter: Chapter on i'tikaf (spiritual retreat)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2108 - It is narrated from Maymun ibn Mihran, who said:
"I was sitting with Imam Al-Hasan ibn Ali (as) when a man came to him and said, 'O son of the Messenger of Allah (swt), so-and-so has a debt against me, and he intends to imprison me.'
Imam Al-Hasan (as) said: 'By Allah (swt), I have no money to repay your debt.'
The man then said: 'Could you speak to him on my behalf?'
Imam Al-Hasan (as) put on his sandals.
I said to Imam (as): 'O son of the Messenger of Allah (swt), have you forgotten your i'tikaf?'
Imam (as) replied: 'I have not forgotten. But I heard my father (as) narrating from my grandfather, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), who said: “Whoever strives to fulfill the need of his Muslim brother, it is as if he worshipped Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, for nine thousand years, fasting during the day and standing in prayer at night.”'
arabicText: 2108 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مَيْمُونِ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ: كُنْتُ جَالِساً عِنْدَ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَأَتَاهُ رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ يَا اِبْنَ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ إِنَّ فُلاَناً لَهُ عَلَيَّ مَالٌ وَ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَحْبِسَنِي فَقَالَ «وَ اَللَّهِ مَا عِنْدِي مَالٌ فَأَقْضِيَ عَنْكَ» قَالَ فَكَلِّمْهُ قَالَ فَلَبِسَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ نَعْلَهُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ يَا اِبْنَ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ أَ نَسِيتَ اِعْتِكَافَكَ فَقَالَ لَهُ «لَمْ أَنْسَ وَ لَكِنِّي سَمِعْتُ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُحَدِّثُ عَنْ جَدِّي رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ «مَنْ سَعَى فِي حَاجَةِ أَخِيهِ اَلْمُسْلِمِ فَكَأَنَّمَا عَبَدَ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ تِسْعَةَ آلاَفِ سَنَةٍ صَائِماً نَهَارَهُ قَائِماً لَيْلَهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2108 - It is narrated from Maymun ibn Mihran, who said:
"I was sitting with Imam Al-Hasan ibn Ali (as) when a man came to him and said,
thaqalaynMatn:
'O son of the Messenger of Allah (swt), so-and-so has a debt against me, and he intends to imprison me.'
Imam Al-Hasan (as) said: 'By Allah (swt), I have no money to repay your debt.'
The man then said: 'Could you speak to him on my behalf?'
Imam Al-Hasan (as) put on his sandals.
I said to Imam (as): 'O son of the Messenger of Allah (swt), have you forgotten your i'tikaf?'
Imam (as) replied: 'I have not forgotten. But I heard my father (as) narrating from my grandfather, the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family), who said: “Whoever strives to fulfill the need of his Muslim brother, it is as if he worshipped Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic, for nine thousand years, fasting during the day and standing in prayer at night.”'

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Carrying a Staff During Travel
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2409 - Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings of Allah (swt) be upon him and his family) said:
"Whoever embarks on a journey and carries with them a bitter almond stick, and recites this verse: 'When he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord (azj) will guide me to the right way."' up to the words of Allah (swt), 'And Allah (swt) is a witness over what we say.' (Surah Al-Qasas 28:22-28),
Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious, will protect them from every harmful beast, every aggressive thief, and every venomous creature until they return to their family and home. Additionally, seventy-seven angels will accompany them, seeking forgiveness for them until they return and set it (the stick) down."
arabicText:
2409 - قَالَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : «مَنْ خَرَجَ فِي سَفَرٍ وَ مَعَهُ عَصَا لَوْزٍ مُرٍّ وَ تَلاَ هَذِهِ اَلْآيَةَ «۝ وَ لَمّٰا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقٰاءَ مَدْيَنَ قٰالَ عَسىٰ رَبِّي أَنْ يَهْدِيَنِي سَوٰاءَ اَلسَّبِيلِ ۝»
إِلَى قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: «۝ وَ اَللّٰهُ عَلىٰ مٰا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌ ۝» آمَنَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ كُلِّ سَبُعٍ ضَارٍ وَ مِنْ كُلِّ لِصٍّ عَادٍ وَ كُلِّ ذَاتِ حُمَةٍ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ إِلَى أَهْلِهِ وَ مَنْزِلِهِ وَ كَانَ مَعَهُ سَبْعَةٌ وَ سَبْعُونَ مِنَ اَلْمُعَقِّبَاتِ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ لَهُ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ وَ يَضَعَهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2409 - Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings of Allah (swt) be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever embarks on a journey and carries with them a bitter almond stick, and recites this verse: 'When he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord (azj) will guide me to the right way."' up to the words of Allah (swt), 'And Allah (swt) is a witness over what we say.' (Surah Al-Qasas 28:22-28),
Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious, will protect them from every harmful beast, every aggressive thief, and every venomous creature until they return to their family and home. Additionally, seventy-seven angels will accompany them, seeking forgiveness for them until they return and set it (the stick) down."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Carrying a Staff During Travel
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2410 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings of Allah (swt) be upon him and his family) said: "Carrying a staff removes poverty, and Satan does not accompany the one who carries it."
arabicText: 2410 - وَ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : «حَمْلُ اَلْعَصَا يَنْفِي اَلْفَقْرَ وَ لاَ يُجَاوِرُهُ اَلشَّيْطَانُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2410 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings of Allah (swt) be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Carrying a staff removes poverty, and Satan does not accompany the one who carries it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Carrying a Staff During Travel
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2411 - Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Whoever desires the earth to be folded for them (making travel easier), let them use al-nuqūd from the staff, and al-nuqūd is a staff made of bitter almond wood."
arabicText: 2411 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «مَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ تُطْوَى لَهُ اَلْأَرْضُ فَلْيَتَّخِذِ اَلنُّقُدَ مِنَ اَلْعَصَا وَ اَلنُّقُدُ عَصَا لَوْزٍ مُرٍّ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2411 - Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever desires the earth to be folded for them (making travel easier), let them use al-nuqūd from the staff, and al-nuqūd is a staff made of bitter almond wood."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Carrying a Staff During Travel
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2412 - Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"Use a staff, for it is among the practices of my brothers, the Prophets. The children and the elders of Banu Israel would walk with staffs so that they would not become haughty in their walking."
arabicText: 2412 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «تَعَصَّوْا فَإِنَّهَا مِنْ سُنَنِ إِخْوَانِيَ اَلنَّبِيِّينَ وَ كَانَتْ بَنُو إِسْرَائِيلَ اَلصِّغَارُ وَ اَلْكِبَارُ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى اَلْعَصَا حَتَّى لاَ يَخْتَالُوا فِي مَشْيِهِمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2412 - Commander of the Faithful Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Use a staff, for it is among the practices of my brothers, the Prophets. The children and the elders of Banu Israel would walk with staffs so that they would not become haughty in their walking."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Recommended Prayers for the Traveler Before Departure
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2413 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings of Allah (swt) be upon him and his family) said:
"No man entrusts his family with a guardianship better than praying two units of prayer before leaving for a journey and saying:
'O Allah (swt), I entrust You with my soul, my family, my wealth, my offspring, my worldly affairs, my Hereafter, my trust, and the conclusion of my deeds.' No one says this except that Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious, grants them what they have asked for."
arabicText: 2413 - قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : «مَا اِسْتَخْلَفَ رَجُلٌ عَلَى أَهْلِهِ بِخِلاَفَةٍ أَفْضَلَ مِنْ رَكْعَتَيْنِ يَرْكَعُهُمَا إِذَا أَرَادَ اَلْخُرُوجَ إِلَى سَفَرِهِ وَ يَقُولُ: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْتَوْدِعُكَ نَفْسِي وَ أَهْلِي وَ مَالِي وَ ذُرِّيَّتِي وَ دُنْيَايَ وَ آخِرَتِي وَ أَمَانَتِي وَ خَاتِمَةَ عَمَلِي فَمَا قَالَ ذَلِكَ أَحَدٌ إِلاَّ أَعْطَاهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مَا سَأَلَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2413 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings of Allah (swt) be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"No man entrusts his family with a guardianship better than praying two units of prayer before leaving for a journey and saying:
'O Allah (swt), I entrust You with my soul, my family, my wealth, my offspring, my worldly affairs, my Hereafter, my trust, and the conclusion of my deeds.' No one says this except that Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious, grants them what they have asked for."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Obligations of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
The obligatory acts of Hajj are seven:
1.	Entering the state of Ihram.
2.	Reciting the four phrases of Talbiyah privately:
"Labbayka Allahumma Labbayk, Labbayka la sharika laka Labbayk, Inna al-hamda wa al-ni'mata laka wa al-mulk, la sharika laka."
3.	Circumambulating the Ka'bah (Tawaf).
4.	Performing two units of prayer at the Station of Ibrahim (as).
5.	Performing the Sa'i between Safa and Marwah.
6.	Standing at al-Mash'ar al-Haram.
Offering the sacrifice (Hady) for the Mutamatti'.
arabicText: فرائض الحج سبع: الاحرام، والتلبيات الأربع التي يلبى بها سرا، وهي " لبيك اللهم لبيك لبيك، لا شريك لك لبيك، إن الحمد والنعمة لك والملك لا شريك لك " والطواف بالبيت، والركعتان عند مقام إبراهيم عليه السلام، والسعي بين الصفا والمروة، والوقوف بالمشعر الحرام، والهدي للمتمتع.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Obligations of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2556 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Standing at Arafah is a Sunnah, and standing at al-Mash'ar is an obligation, and everything else from the rituals is Sunnah."
arabicText: 2556 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «وَ اَلْوُقُوفُ بِعَرَفَةَ سُنَّةٌ وَ بِالْمَشْعَرِ فَرِيضَةٌ وَ مَا سِوَى ذَلِكَ مِنَ اَلْمَنَاسِكِ سُنَّةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2556 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Standing at Arafah is a Sunnah, and standing at al-Mash'ar is an obligation, and everything else from the rituals is Sunnah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
The author of this book, Shaykh (may Allah (swt) have mercy on him), states:
"I have compiled the chains of transmission for the causes (and wisdoms) of Hajj, which I will mention here, as narrated from the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) and the Imams (as), in my book titled Jami‘ ‘Ilal al-Hajj (The Compilation of the Causes of Hajj)."
arabicText: باب علل الحج قال الشيخ مصنف هذا الكتاب - رحمه الله -: قد أخرجت أسانيد العلل التي أنا ذاكرها عن النبي صلى الله عليه وآله وعن الأئمة عليهم السلام في كتابي جامع علل الحج.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2109 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"The Ka'bah was named 'Ka'bah' because it is the center of the world."
arabicText: 2109 - قَالَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : «سُمِّيَتِ اَلْكَعْبَةُ كَعْبَةً لِأَنَّهَا وَسَطُ اَلدُّنْيَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2109 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Ka'bah was named 'Ka'bah' because it is the center of the world."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2110 - It is narrated:
"The Ka'bah was named 'Ka'bah' because it is cubical in shape. It became cubical because it is directly beneath the Bayt al-Ma‘mur, which is also cubical.
The Bayt al-Ma‘mur became cubical because it is directly beneath the Throne (‘Arsh), which is cubical as well.
The Throne is cubical because the foundational words upon which Islam is built are four: Subhan Allah (swt) (Glory be to Allah (swt)), Alhamdulillah (Praise be to Allah (swt)), La ilaha illa Allah (swt) (There is no god but Allah (swt)), and Allahu Akbar (Allah (swt) is the Greatest)."
arabicText: 2110 - وَ قَدْ رُوِيَ : أَنَّهُ «إِنَّمَا سُمِّيَتْ كَعْبَةً لِأَنَّهَا مُرَبَّعَةٌ وَ صَارَتْ مُرَبَّعَةً لِأَنَّهَا بِحِذَاءِ اَلْبَيْتِ اَلْمَعْمُورِ وَ هُوَ مُرَبَّعٌ وَ صَارَ اَلْبَيْتُ اَلْمَعْمُورُ مُرَبَّعاً لِأَنَّهُ بِحِذَاءِ اَلْعَرْشِ وَ هُوَ مُرَبَّعٌ وَ صَارَ اَلْعَرْشُ مُرَبَّعاً لِأَنَّ اَلْكَلِمَاتِ اَلَّتِي بُنِيَ عَلَيْهَا اَلْإِسْلاَمُ أَرْبَعٌ وَ هِيَ: سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ وَ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اَللَّهُ وَ اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2110 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Ka'bah was named 'Ka'bah' because it is cubical in shape. It became cubical because it is directly beneath the Bayt al-Ma‘mur, which is also cubical.
The Bayt al-Ma‘mur became cubical because it is directly beneath the Throne (‘Arsh), which is cubical as well.
The Throne is cubical because the foundational words upon which Islam is built are four: Subhan Allah (swt) (Glory be to Allah (swt)), Alhamdulillah (Praise be to Allah (swt)), La ilaha illa Allah (swt) (There is no god but Allah (swt)), and Allahu Akbar (Allah (swt) is the Greatest)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2111 - The House of Allah (swt), the Sacred (Bayt Allah (swt) al-Haram), was so named because it was made forbidden (haram) for the polytheists to enter it.
arabicText: 2111 - وَ سُمِّيَ بَيْتُ اَللَّهِ اَلْحَرَامَ لِأَنَّهُ حُرِّمَ عَلَى اَلْمُشْرِكِينَ أَنْ يَدْخُلُوهُ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2112 - The House (Ka'bah) was named al-Bayt al-Atiq (The Ancient House) because it was saved (freed) from being submerged in the flood.
arabicText: 2112 - وَ سُمِّيَ اَلْبَيْتُ اَلْعَتِيقَ لِأَنَّهُ أُعْتِقَ مِنَ اَلْغَرَقِ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2113 - It is narrated:
"It was named al-Atiq (the Ancient) because it is a house independent of people and has never been owned by anyone."
arabicText: 2113 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّهُ سُمِّيَ اَلْعَتِيقَ لِأَنَّهُ بَيْتٌ عَتِيقٌ مِنَ اَلنَّاسِ وَ لَمْ يَمْلِكْهُ أَحَدٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2113 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "It was named al-Atiq (the Ancient) because it is a house independent of people and has never been owned by anyone."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2114 - The House (Ka'bah) was placed in the center of the Earth because it is the spot from beneath which the Earth was spread out, and so that its obligation could be equal for the people of both the East and the West.
arabicText: 2114 - وَ وُضِعَ اَلْبَيْتُ فِي وَسَطِ اَلْأَرْضِ لِأَنَّهُ اَلْمَوْضِعُ اَلَّذِي مِنْ تَحْتِهِ دُحِيَتِ اَلْأَرْضُ وَ لِيَكُونَ اَلْفَرْضُ لِأَهْلِ اَلْمَشْرِقِ وَ اَلْمَغْرِبِ فِي ذَلِكَ سَوَاءً ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2115 - The area known as al-Hatim was named as such because people crowd and jostle each other there, "crushing" (yahtim) one another in that space.
arabicText: 2115 - وَ سُمِّيَ اَلْحَطِيمُ حَطِيماً لِأَنَّ اَلنَّاسَ يَحْطِمُ بَعْضُهُمْ بَعْضاً هُنَالِكَ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2116 - The station of Ibrahim (Maqam Ibrahim) is situated to the left because Ibrahim (as) has a position on the Day of Judgment, as does Muhammad (sw) (peace be upon him and his family). The position of Muhammad (sw) is to the right of the Divine Throne, while the position of Ibrahim (as) is to its left. This earthly location of the Maqam Ibrahim corresponds to Ibrahim's position in the Hereafter, while the Throne of Allah (swt) (glorified and exalted) is ever-facing and not turned away.
The Syrian Corner of the Ka'bah moves during the winter and summer, day and night, due to the winds trapped beneath it. The Ka'bah is elevated, and people ascend to it via steps because when Al-Hajjaj destroyed the Ka'bah, the people dispersed its soil. When they sought to rebuild it, a serpent emerged and prevented them from continuing. When Al-Hajjaj was informed, he consulted Ali ibn Al-Husayn (as), who instructed that everyone return the soil they had taken. After the walls were raised, the remaining soil was placed inside the Ka'bah, leading to its elevated state, requiring steps for access.
As for why people circumambulate the Hijr Ismail without entering it, it is because the grave of Ismail’s mother (peace be upon her) is located within the Hijr. Circumambulating around it was established so that her grave would not be stepped upon.
arabicText: 2116 - وَ إِنَّمَا صَارَ مَقَامُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ يَسَارِهِ لِأَنَّ لِإِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَقَاماً فِي اَلْقِيَامَةِ وَ لِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ مَقَاماً فَمَقَامُ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَنْ يَمِينِ عَرْشِ رَبِّنَا عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ مَقَامُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ شِمَالِ عَرْشِهِ ، فَمَقَامُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي مَقَامِهِ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيَامَةِ وَ عَرْشُ رَبِّنَا تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى مُقْبِلٌ غَيْرُ مُدْبِرٍ وَ صَارَ اَلرُّكْنُ اَلشَّامِيُّ مُتَحَرِّكاً فِي اَلشِّتَاءِ وَ اَلصَّيْفِ وَ اَللَّيْلِ وَ اَلنَّهَارِ لِأَنَّ اَلرِّيحَ مَسْجُونَةٌ تَحْتَهُ وَ إِنَّمَا صَارَ اَلْبَيْتُ مُرْتَفِعاً يُصْعَدُ إِلَيْهِ بِالدَّرَجِ لِأَنَّهُ لَمَّا هَدَمَ اَلْحَجَّاجُ اَلْكَعْبَةَ فَرَّقَ اَلنَّاسُ تُرَابَهَا، فَلَمَّا أَرَادُوا أَنْ يَبْنُوهَا خَرَجَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ حَيَّةٌ فَمَنَعَتِ اَلنَّاسَ اَلْبِنَاءَ فَأُتِيَ اَلْحَجَّاجُ فَأُخْبِرَ فَسَأَلَ اَلْحَجَّاجُ عَلِيَّ بْنَ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ لَهُ «مُرِ اَلنَّاسَ أَنْ لاَ يَبْقَى أَحَدٌ مِنْهُمْ أَخَذَ مِنْهُ شَيْئاً إِلاَّ رَدَّهُ» فَلَمَّا اِرْتَفَعَتْ حِيطَانُهُ أَمَرَ بِالتُّرَابِ فَأُلْقِيَ فِي جَوْفِهِ فَلِذَلِكَ صَارَ اَلْبَيْتُ مُرْتَفِعاً يُصْعَدُ إِلَيْهِ بِالدَّرَجِ وَ صَارَ اَلنَّاسُ يَطُوفُونَ حَوْلَ اَلْحِجْرِ وَ لاَ يَطُوفُونَ فِيهِ لِأَنَّ أُمَّ إِسْمَاعِيلَ دُفِنَتْ فِي اَلْحِجْرِ فَفِيهِ قَبْرُهَا فَطِيفَ كَذَلِكَ كَيْلاَ يُوطَأَ قَبْرُهَا».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2117 - It has been narrated that within the Hijr Ismail lie the graves of Prophets (as).
arabicText: 2117 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّ فِيهِ قُبُورَ اَلْأَنْبِيَاءِ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلسَّلاَمُ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2118 - It is named Bakkah because people crowd against one another there, pressing with their hands.
arabicText: 2118 - وَ سُمِّيَتْ بَكَّةَ لِأَنَّ اَلنَّاسَ يَبُكُّ بَعْضُهُمْ بَعْضاً فِيهَا بِالْأَيْدِي.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2119 - It is narrated that it was named Bakkah because of the weeping of people around and within it.
arabicText: 2119 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّهَا سُمِّيَتْ بَكَّةَ لِبُكَاءِ اَلنَّاسِ حَوْلَهَا وَ فِيهَا ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
It is narrated:
"There is an announcement made at the Hajar (stone): 'Whoever has run out of provisions should come forward, and it will be provided to them.'"
arabicText: وَ رُوِيَ: «أَنَّهُ يُنَادَى عَلَى اَلْحِجْرِ أَلاَ مَنِ اِنْقَطَعَتْ بِهِ اَلنَّفَقَةُ فَلْيَحْضُرْ فَيُدْفَعَ إِلَيْهِ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2120 - And it is narrated:
"Indeed, Quraysh demolished the Kaaba because floods would come from the higher regions of Mecca, entering it and causing it to crack."
arabicText: 2120 - وَ إِنَّمَا هَدَمَتْ قُرَيْشٌ اَلْكَعْبَةَ لِأَنَّ اَلسَّيْلَ كَانَ يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ أَعْلَى مَكَّةَ فَيَدْخُلُهَا فَانْصَدَعَتْ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2120 - And it is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, Quraysh demolished the Kaaba because floods would come from the higher regions of Mecca, entering it and causing it to crack."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2121 - And it is narrated:
Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious: “...wherein the residents and the visitors are equal...” (Surah Al-Hajj 22:25).
Imam (as) replied: "It was not appropriate to construct doors on the houses of Mecca because the pilgrims had the right to stay with the residents in their courtyards until they completed their rituals. The first to place doors on the houses of Mecca was Muawiyah."
arabicText:
2121 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: «۝ سَوٰاءً اَلْعٰاكِفُ فِيهِ وَ اَلْبٰادِ ۝»
فَقَالَ «لَمْ يَكُنْ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُصْنَعَ عَلَى دُورِ مَكَّةَ أَبْوَابٌ لِأَنَّ لِلْحَاجِّ أَنْ يَنْزِلُوا مَعَهُمْ فِي دُورِهِمْ فِي سَاحَةِ اَلدَّارِ حَتَّى يَقْضُوا مَنَاسِكَهُمْ فَإِنَّ أَوَّلَ مَنْ جَعَلَ لِدُورِ مَكَّةَ أَبْوَاباً مُعَاوِيَةُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2121 - And it is narrated:
Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the saying of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious: “...wherein the residents and the visitors are equal...” (Surah Al-Hajj 22:25).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "It was not appropriate to construct doors on the houses of Mecca because the pilgrims had the right to stay with the residents in their courtyards until they completed their rituals. The first to place doors on the houses of Mecca was Muawiyah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2122 - "The mosque was made sacred because of the Kaaba, the sanctuary was made sacred because of the mosque, and Ihram became obligatory because of the sanctuary."
arabicText: 2122 - وَ حُرِّمَ اَلْمَسْجِدُ لِعِلَّةِ اَلْكَعْبَةِ وَ حُرِّمَ اَلْحَرَمُ لِعِلَّةِ اَلْمَسْجِدِ وَ وَجَبَ اَلْإِحْرَامُ لِعِلَّةِ اَلْحَرَمِ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Reasons Behind Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2124 - In a narration from Abu Al-Husayn Al-Asadi, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, from Sahl bin Ziyad, from Ja'far bin Uthman Al-Darimi, from Sulayman bin Ja'far, he said:
"I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about the Talbiyah and its reason.
Imam (as) said: 'Indeed, when people enter Ihram, Allah (swt), Mighty and Majestic, calls out to them, saying, "My servants and handmaids, I will make you forbidden upon the Fire just as you have entered Ihram for Me." Thus, their saying, 'Labbaik Allahumma Labbaik' (Here I am, O Allah (swt), Here I am) is a response to Allah (swt), Mighty and Majestic, for His call to them.'
arabicText: 2124 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَبِي اَلْحُسَيْنِ اَلْأَسَدِيِّ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهُ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ اَلدَّارِمِيِّ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلتَّلْبِيَةِ وَ عِلَّتِهَا فَقَالَ «إِنَّ اَلنَّاسَ إِذَا أَحْرَمُوا نَادَاهُمُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَقَالَ «عِبَادِي وَ إِمَائِي لَأُحَرِّمَنَّكُمْ عَلَى اَلنَّارِ كَمَا أَحْرَمْتُمْ لِي» فَقَوْلُهُمْ لَبَّيْكَ اَللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ إِجَابَةٌ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَى نِدَائِهِ لَهُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2124 - In a narration from Abu Al-Husayn Al-Asadi, may Allah (swt) be pleased with him, from Sahl bin Ziyad, from Ja'far bin Uthman Al-Darimi, from Sulayman bin Ja'far, he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Al-Hasan (as) about the Talbiyah and its reason.
Imam (as) said: 'Indeed, when people enter Ihram, Allah (swt), Mighty and Majestic, calls out to them, saying, "My servants and handmaids, I will make you forbidden upon the Fire just as you have entered Ihram for Me."
