arabicText: 2595 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «كُلُّ ثَوْبٍ تُصَلِّي فِيهِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تُحْرِمَ فِيهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2595 - Hamad narrated from Hariz, from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in wearing any garment while praying."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2596 - Hammad al-Nawwa’ asked, or was present when someone asked, about a Muhrim entering Ihram while wearing a striped cloak (burd).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it. Were people not entering Ihram except in striped cloaks?"
arabicText: 2596 - وَ سَأَلَهُ حَمَّادٌ اَلنَّوَّاءُ أَوْ سُئِلَ وَ هُوَ حَاضِرٌ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يُحْرِمُ فِي بُرْدٍ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ وَ هَلْ كَانَ اَلنَّاسُ يُحْرِمُونَ إِلاَّ فِي اَلْبُرُودِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2596 - Hammad al-Nawwa’ asked, or was present when someone asked, about a Muhrim entering Ihram while wearing a striped cloak (burd).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in it. Were people not entering Ihram except in striped cloaks?"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2597 - Khalid ibn Abi al-'Ala' al-Khaffaf narrated:
"I saw Abu Ja'far (as) wearing a green striped cloak (burd akhdar) while he was in the state of Ihram."
arabicText: 2597 - وَ رَوَى خَالِدُ بْنُ أَبِي اَلْعَلاَءِ اَلْخَفَّافُ قَالَ : رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ عَلَيْهِ بُرْدٌ أَخْضَرُ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2597 - Khalid ibn Abi al-'Ala' al-Khaffaf narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "I saw Abu Ja'far (as) wearing a green striped cloak (burd akhdar) while he was in the state of Ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2598 - It was narrated from Amr ibn Shimmar, from his father, who said:
"I saw Abu Ja'far (as) wearing a lightweight striped cloak (burd mukhaffaf) while he was in the state of Ihram."
arabicText: 2598 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شِمْرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ : رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ عَلَيْهِ بُرْدٌ مُخَفَّفٌ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2598 - It was narrated from Amr ibn Shimmar, from his father, who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I saw Abu Ja'far (as) wearing a lightweight striped cloak (burd mukhaffaf) while he was in the state of Ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2599 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of the Imams (as)  that he was asked about a man entering Ihram in a dirty garment.
Imam (as) said: "No, and I do not say it is forbidden, but what I prefer is that he purifies it. Its purification is through washing. A man should not wash the garment in which he enters Ihram until he exits Ihram, even if it becomes dirty, unless it is affected by a state of ritual impurity (janabah) or something similar, in which case he may wash it."
arabicText: 2599 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُحْرِمُ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْوَسِخِ فَقَالَ «لاَ وَ لاَ أَقُولُ إِنَّهُ حَرَامٌ وَ لَكِنْ أَحَبُّ ذَلِكَ إِلَيَّ أَنْ يُطَهِّرَهُ وَ طُهْرُهُ غَسْلُهُ وَ لاَ يَغْسِلُ اَلرَّجُلُ ثَوْبَهُ اَلَّذِي يُحْرِمُ فِيهِ حَتَّى يَحِلَّ وَ إِنْ تَوَسَّخَ إِلاَّ أَنْ تُصِيبَهُ جَنَابَةٌ أَوْ شَيْءٌ فَيَغْسِلَهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2599 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of the Imams (as)  that he was asked about a man entering Ihram in a dirty garment.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "No, and I do not say it is forbidden, but what I prefer is that he purifies it. Its purification is through washing. A man should not wash the garment in which he enters Ihram until he exits Ihram, even if it becomes dirty, unless it is affected by a state of ritual impurity (janabah) or something similar, in which case he may wash it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2600 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm if a man enters Ihram wearing a dyed or striped garment."
arabicText: 2600 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُحْرِمَ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي ثَوْبٍ مَصْبُوغٍ مُمَشَّقٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2600 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a man enters Ihram wearing a dyed or striped garment."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2601 - It was narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
I heard Abu Ja'far (as) say:
"Imam Ali (as) was with some of his children when Umar passed by and said, 'What are these two dyed garments you are wearing while in the state of Ihram?'
Imam Ali (as) replied: 'We do not need anyone to teach us about the Sunnah. These two garments were dyed with clay.'"
arabicText: 2601 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُول : «كَانَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَعَهُ بَعْضُ صِبْيَانِهِ فَمَرَّ عَلَيْهِ عُمَرُ فَقَالَ مَا هَذَانِ اَلثَّوْبَانِ اَلْمَصْبُوغَانِ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «مَا نُرِيدُ أَحَداً يُعَلِّمُنَا بِالسُّنَّةِ إِنَّ هَذَيْنِ اَلثَّوْبَيْنِ صُبِغَا بِطِينٍ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2601 - It was narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
I heard Abu Ja'far (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Imam Ali (as) was with some of his children when Umar passed by and said, 'What are these two dyed garments you are wearing while in the state of Ihram?'
Imam Ali (as) replied: 'We do not need anyone to teach us about the Sunnah. These two garments were dyed with clay.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2602 - It was narrated from Al-Husayn ibn al-Mukhtar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "Can a man enter Ihram wearing a black garment?"
Imam (as) said: "He should not enter Ihram in a black garment, nor should a deceased person be shrouded in it."
arabicText: 2602 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ اَلْمُخْتَارِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَ يُحْرِمُ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْأَسْوَدِ قَالَ «لاَ يُحْرِمُ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْأَسْوَدِ وَ لاَ يُكَفَّنُ فِيهِ اَلْمَيِّتُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2602 - It was narrated from Al-Husayn ibn al-Mukhtar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "Can a man enter Ihram wearing a black garment?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "He should not enter Ihram in a black garment, nor should a deceased person be shrouded in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2603 - Hanan ibn Sudayr narrated:
I was sitting with Abu Abdullah (as) when a man asked him, "Can one enter Ihram wearing a garment that contains silk?"
Imam (as) called for a striped lower garment (izar furqubi) and said: "I enter Ihram in this, and it contains silk."
arabicText: 2603 - وَ رَوَى حَنَانُ بْنُ سَدِيرٍ قَالَ : كُنْتُ جَالِساً عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَسَأَلَهُ رَجُلٌ أَ يُحْرَمُ فِي ثَوْبٍ فِيهِ حَرِيرٌ قَالَ فَدَعَا بِإِزَارٍ لَهُ فُرْقُبِيٍّ فَقَالَ «أَنَا أُحْرِمُ فِي هَذَا وَ فِيهِ حَرِيرٌ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2603 - Hanan ibn Sudayr narrated:
I was sitting with Abu Abdullah (as) when a man asked him, "Can one enter Ihram wearing a garment that contains silk?"
Imam (as) called for a striped lower garment (izar furqubi) and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I enter Ihram in this, and it contains silk."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2604 - It was narrated from Al-Halabi, who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man entering Ihram wearing a garment with an embroidered border.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2604 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ اَلرَّجُلِ يُحْرِمُ فِي ثَوْبٍ لَهُ عَلَمٌ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2604 - It was narrated from Al-Halabi, who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a man entering Ihram wearing a garment with an embroidered border.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2605 - In a narration from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
"There is no harm if a man enters Ihram wearing an embroidered garment, but avoiding it is more beloved to me if he has the means to wear something else."
arabicText: 2605 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُحْرِمَ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْمُعْلَمِ وَ تَرْكُهُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ إِذَا قَدَرَ عَلَى غَيْرِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2605 - In a narration from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a man enters Ihram wearing an embroidered garment, but avoiding it is more beloved to me if he has the means to wear something else."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2606 - Laith al-Muradi asked Imam (as) about a man entering Ihram in an embroidered garment.
Imam (as) said: "Yes, it is permissible. What is disliked is a fully patterned garment (mulham)."
arabicText: 2606 - وَ سَأَلَهُ لَيْثٌ اَلْمُرَادِيُّ : عَنِ اَلثَّوْبِ اَلْمُعْلَمِ هَلْ يُحْرِمُ فِيهِ اَلرَّجُلُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ إِنَّمَا يُكْرَهُ اَلْمُلْحَمُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2606 - Laith al-Muradi asked Imam (as) about a man entering Ihram in an embroidered garment.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, it is permissible. What is disliked is a fully patterned garment (mulham)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2607 - Al-Husayn ibn Abi al-‘Ala’ asked Imam (as) about a garment for a Muhrim that has been stained with saffron and then washed.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it if the scent has been removed. Even if it has been entirely dyed, as long as it leans toward whiteness and has been washed, there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2607 - وَ سَأَلَهُ اَلْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ أَبِي اَلْعَلاَءِ : عَنِ اَلثَّوْبِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ يُصِيبُهُ اَلزَّعْفَرَانُ ثُمَّ يُغْسَلُ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ إِذَا ذَهَبَ رِيحُهُ وَ لَوْ كَانَ مَصْبُوغاً كُلُّهُ إِذَا ضُرِبَ إِلَى اَلْبَيَاضِ وَ غُسِلَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2607 - Al-Husayn ibn Abi al-‘Ala’ asked Imam (as) about a garment for a Muhrim that has been stained with saffron and then washed.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in it if the scent has been removed. Even if it has been entirely dyed, as long as it leans toward whiteness and has been washed, there is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2608 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a Muhrim is compelled to wear a cloak (qabā’) made of striped cloth and cannot find any other garment, he may wear it inside out and should not insert his arms into the sleeves of the cloak."
arabicText: 2608 - وَ رَوَى اَلْقَاسِمُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْجَوْهَرِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِنِ اُضْطُرَّ اَلْمُحْرِمُ إِلَى أَنْ يَلْبَسَ قَبَاءً مِنْ بَرْدٍ وَ لاَ يَجِدُ ثَوْباً غَيْرَهُ فَلْيَلْبَسْهُ مَقْلُوباً وَ لاَ يُدْخِلْ يَدَيْهِ فِي يَدَيِ اَلْقَبَاءِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2608 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Jawhari narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a Muhrim is compelled to wear a cloak (qabā’) made of striped cloth and cannot find any other garment, he may wear it inside out and should not insert his arms into the sleeves of the cloak."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2609 - It was narrated from al-Kahili, who said:
A man asked Imam (as) in my presence about a garment dyed with safflower (‘usfur) that has been washed. "Can I wear it while in the state of Ihram?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, safflower is not considered a fragrance. However, I dislike for you to wear something that makes you stand out among people."
arabicText: 2609 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْكَاهِلِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلَهُ رَجُلٌ وَ أَنَا حَاضِرٌ عَنِ اَلثَّوْبِ يَكُونُ مَصْبُوغاً بِالْعُصْفُرِ ثُمَّ يُغْسَلُ أَلْبَسُهُ وَ أَنَا مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ لَيْسَ اَلْعُصْفُرُ مِنَ اَلطِّيبِ وَ لَكِنِّي أَكْرَهُ أَنْ تَلْبَسَ مَا يَشْهَرُكَ بِهِ اَلنَّاسُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2609 - It was narrated from al-Kahili, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man asked Imam (as) in my presence about a garment dyed with safflower (‘usfur) that has been washed. "Can I wear it while in the state of Ihram?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, safflower is not considered a fragrance. However, I dislike for you to wear something that makes you stand out among people."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2610 - Isma'il ibn al-Fadl asked Imam (as) about whether a Muhrim can wear a garment that has been affected by perfume.
Imam (as) said: "If the scent of the perfume has disappeared, then he may wear it."
arabicText: 2610 - وَ سَأَلَهُ إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ اَلْفَضْلِ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ أَ يَلْبَسُ اَلثَّوْبَ قَدْ أَصَابَهُ اَلطِّيبُ فَقَالَ «إِذَا ذَهَبَ رِيحُ اَلطِّيبِ فَلْيَلْبَسْهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2610 - Isma'il ibn al-Fadl asked Imam (as) about whether a Muhrim can wear a garment that has been affected by perfume.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the scent of the perfume has disappeared, then he may wear it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2611 - It was narrated from Abu al-Hasan al-Nahdi, who said:
Sa'id al-A'raj asked Abu Abdullah (as) in my presence about a garment (khamiṣah) whose warp was made of silk (ibrīsīm) and its weft was made of goat wool (mir‘izzā).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in entering Ihram in it. What is disliked is the garment made entirely of silk."
arabicText: 2611 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلنَّهْدِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلَ سَعِيدٌ اَلْأَعْرَجُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَنَا عِنْدَهُ عَنِ اَلْخَمِيصَةِ سَدَاهَا إِبْرِيسَمٌ وَ لَحْمَتُهَا مِرْعِزَّى فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تُحْرِمَ فِيهَا إِنَّمَا يُكْرَهُ اَلْخَالِصُ مِنْهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2611 - It was narrated from Abu al-Hasan al-Nahdi, who said:
Sa'id al-A'raj asked Abu Abdullah (as) in my presence about a garment (khamiṣah) whose warp was made of silk (ibrīsīm) and its weft was made of goat wool (mir‘izzā).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in entering Ihram in it. What is disliked is the garment made entirely of silk."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2612 - Hammad ibn Uthman asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the khaluq of the Ka'bah and the khaluq of the grave that might be present on the Ihram garment.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in them; both are pure."
arabicText: 2612 - وَ سَأَلَ حَمَّادُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ خَلُوقِ اَلْكَعْبَةِ وَ خَلُوقِ اَلْقَبْرِ يَكُونُ فِي ثَوْبِ اَلْإِحْرَامِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِمَا هُمَا طَهُورَانِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2612 - Hammad ibn Uthman asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the khaluq of the Ka'bah and the khaluq of the grave that might be present on the Ihram garment.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in them; both are pure."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2613 - Sama'ah asked Imam (as) about a man whose garment is stained with the saffron of the Ka'bah while he is in the state of Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it; it is pure, so do not avoid it if it touches you."
arabicText: 2613 - وَ سَأَلَهُ سَمَاعَةُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُصِيبُ ثَوْبَهُ زَعْفَرَانُ اَلْكَعْبَةِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ وَ هُوَ طَهُورٌ فَلاَ تَتَّقِهِ أَنْ يُصِيبَكَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2613 - Sama'ah asked Imam (as) about a man whose garment is stained with the saffron of the Ka'bah while he is in the state of Ihram.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it; it is pure, so do not avoid it if it touches you."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2614 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a Muhrim wearing a buttoned taylasan (cloak).
Imam (as) said: "Yes, as stated in the book of Imam Ali (as): 'Do not wear a taylasan until you undo its buttons.' He also said: 'It was disliked only out of concern that an ignorant person might button it while wearing it. As for someone knowledgeable, there is no harm in wearing it.'"
arabicText: 2614 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَلْبَسُ اَلطَّيْلَسَانَ اَلْمُزَرَّرَ قَالَ «نَعَمْ فِي كِتَابِ عَلِيٍّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «لاَ تَلْبَسْ طَيْلَسَاناً حَتَّى تَحُلَّ أَزْرَارَهُ» » وَ قَالَ «إِنَّمَا كُرِهَ ذَلِكَ مَخَافَةَ أَنْ يَزُرَّهُ اَلْجَاهِلُ عَلَيْهِ فَأَمَّا اَلْفَقِيهُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَلْبَسَهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2614 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a Muhrim wearing a buttoned taylasan (cloak).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, as stated in the book of Imam Ali (as): 'Do not wear a taylasan until you undo its buttons.' He also said: 'It was disliked only out of concern that an ignorant person might button it while wearing it. As for someone knowledgeable, there is no harm in wearing it.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2615 - Rifa’ah ibn Musa asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim wearing socks (jawrabayn).
Imam (as) said: "Yes, and also leather slippers (khuffayn) if he is compelled to wear them."
arabicText: 2615 - وَ سَأَلَهُ رِفَاعَةُ بْنُ مُوسَى : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَلْبَسُ اَلْجَوْرَبَيْنِ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ اَلْخُفَّيْنِ إِذَا اُضْطُرَّ إِلَيْهِمَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2615 - Rifa’ah ibn Musa asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim wearing socks (jawrabayn).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, and also leather slippers (khuffayn) if he is compelled to wear them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2616 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) regarding a Muhrim wearing leather slippers (khuff) if he does not have sandals.
Imam (as) said: "Yes, but he must cut open the top of the foot area. A Muhrim may also wear a cloak (qabā’) if he does not have a cloak-like garment (rida’), but he should wear it inside out."
arabicText: 2616 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَلْبَسُ اَلْخُفَّ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ نَعْلٌ قَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ لَكِنْ يَشُقُّ ظَهْرَ اَلْقَدَمِ وَ يَلْبَسُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ اَلْقَبَاءَ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ رِدَاءٌ وَ يَقْلِبُ ظَهْرَهُ لِبَاطِنِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2616 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) regarding a Muhrim wearing leather slippers (khuff) if he does not have sandals.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, but he must cut open the top of the foot area. A Muhrim may also wear a cloak (qabā’) if he does not have a cloak-like garment (rida’), but he should wear it inside out."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2617 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Do not wear a garment with buttons while you are in the state of Ihram unless you wear it inside out. Do not wear a garment that is worn like a tunic (tadarru’), nor trousers (sarawil), unless you have no loincloth (izar). Do not wear leather slippers (khuffayn) unless you have no sandals (na'lan)."
arabicText: 2617 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ تَلْبَسْ ثَوْباً لَهُ أَزْرَارٌ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ إِلاَّ أَنْ تَنْكُسَهُ وَ لاَ ثَوْباً تَدَرَّعُهُ وَ لاَ سَرَاوِيلَ إِلاَّ أَنْ لاَ يَكُونَ لَكَ إِزَارٌ وَ لاَ خُفَّيْنِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ لَكَ نَعْلاَنِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2617 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not wear a garment with buttons while you are in the state of Ihram unless you wear it inside out. Do not wear a garment that is worn like a tunic (tadarru’), nor trousers (sarawil), unless you have no loincloth (izar). Do not wear leather slippers (khuffayn) unless you have no sandals (na'lan)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2618 - Zurara narrated from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about what is disliked for a Muhrim to wear.
Imam (as) said: "He may wear any garment except a single garment worn like a tunic (tadarru’)."
arabicText: 2618 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَمَّا يُكْرَهُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يَلْبَسَهُ فَقَالَ «يَلْبَسُ كُلَّ ثَوْبٍ إِلاَّ ثَوْباً وَاحِداً يَتَدَرَّعُهُ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2618 - Zurara narrated from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about what is disliked for a Muhrim to wear.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He may wear any garment except a single garment worn like a tunic (tadarru’)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2619 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm if a Muhrim changes his clothes. However, when he enters Makkah, he should wear the two garments of Ihram that he entered Ihram with. It is disliked to sell them."
It has also been narrated that there is a concession allowing their sale.
arabicText:
2619 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنَّ يُغَيِّرَ اَلْمُحْرِمُ ثِيَابَهُ وَ لَكِنْ إِذَا دَخَلَ مَكَّةَ لَبِسَ ثَوْبَيْ إِحْرَامِهِ اَللَّذَيْنِ أَحْرَمَ فِيهِمَا وَ كُرِهَ أَنْ يَبِيعَهُمَا ».
وقد رويت رخصة في بيعهما.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2619 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no harm if a Muhrim changes his clothes. However, when he enters Makkah, he should wear the two garments of Ihram that he entered Ihram with. It is disliked to sell them."
It has also been narrated that there is a concession allowing their sale.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2620 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"I dislike for a Muhrim to sleep on a yellow mattress or a yellow cushion."
arabicText: 2620 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ : «أَكْرَهُ أَنْ يَنَامَ اَلْمُحْرِمُ عَلَى اَلْفِرَاشِ اَلْأَصْفَرِ أَوِ اَلْمِرْفَقَةِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2620 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I dislike for a Muhrim to sleep on a yellow mattress or a yellow cushion."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2621 - Abdul Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a Muhrim wearing khazz (a type of fabric).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2621 - وَ سَأَلَ عَبْدُ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ اَلْحَجَّاجِ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَلْبَسُ اَلْخَزَّ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2621 - Abdul Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a Muhrim wearing khazz (a type of fabric).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2622 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a Muhrim fears for his safety, he may wear weapons."
arabicText: 2622 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْمُحْرِمُ إِذَا خَافَ لَبِسَ اَلسِّلاَحَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2622 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a Muhrim fears for his safety, he may wear weapons."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2623 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about a Muhrim who needs to wear various types of different clothing.
Imam (as) said: "For each type of clothing, he must offer an expiation (fidya)."
arabicText: 2623 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ إِذَا اِحْتَاجَ إِلَى ضُرُوبٍ مِنَ اَلثِّيَابِ مُخْتَلِفَةٍ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «عَلَيْهِ لِكُلِّ صِنْفٍ مِنْهَا فِدَاءٌ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2623 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about a Muhrim who needs to wear various types of different clothing.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "For each type of clothing, he must offer an expiation (fidya)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2624 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a Muhrim whose garment is affected by janabah (ritual impurity).
Imam (as) said: "He should not wear it until he washes it, and his state of Ihram remains valid."
arabicText: 2624 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ تُصِيبُ ثَوْبَهُ اَلْجَنَابَةُ قَالَ «لاَ يَلْبَسْهُ حَتَّى يَغْسِلَهُ وَ إِحْرَامُهُ تَامٌّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2624 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a Muhrim whose garment is affected by janabah (ritual impurity).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He should not wear it until he washes it, and his state of Ihram remains valid."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2625 - In a narration from Hammad ibn Uthman, from Hariz, Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"A woman in Ihram should let her garment hang over her face down to her chin."
arabicText: 2625 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «اَلْمُحْرِمَةُ تَسْدُلُ اَلثَّوْبَ عَلَى وَجْهِهَا إِلَى اَلذَّقَنِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2625 - In a narration from Hammad ibn Uthman, from Hariz, Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman in Ihram should let her garment hang over her face down to her chin."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2626 - In a narration from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, from Imam (as), he said:
"A woman should let her garment hang over her face from above down to her chest when she is riding."
arabicText: 2626 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «تَسْدُلُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلثَّوْبَ عَلَى وَجْهِهَا مِنْ أَعْلاَهَا إِلَى اَلنَّحْرِ إِذَا كَانَتْ رَاكِبَةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2626 - In a narration from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, from Imam (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman should let her garment hang over her face from above down to her chest when she is riding."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2627 - Abdullah ibn Maymun narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq, from his father (as), who said:
"A woman in Ihram should not wear a face veil, because the Ihram of a woman is in her face, while the Ihram of a man is in his head."
arabicText: 2627 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ مَيْمُونٍ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْمُحْرِمَةُ لاَ تَتَنَقَّبُ لِأَنَّ إِحْرَامَ اَلْمَرْأَةِ فِي وَجْهِهَا وَ إِحْرَامَ اَلرَّجُلِ فِي رَأْسِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2627 - Abdullah ibn Maymun narrated from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq, from his father (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman in Ihram should not wear a face veil, because the Ihram of a woman is in her face, while the Ihram of a man is in his head."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2628 - Abu Ja'far (as) passed by a woman in Ihram who had covered her face with a fan. He moved the fan away from her face with his staff.
arabicText: 2628 - وَ مَرَّ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : بِامْرَأَةٍ مُحْرِمَةٍ قَدِ اِسْتَتَرَتْ بِمِرْوَحَةٍ فَأَمَاطَ اَلْمِرْوَحَةَ بِقَضِيبِهِ عَنْ وَجْهِهَا.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2628 - Abu Ja'far (as) passed by
thaqalaynMatn: a woman in Ihram who had covered her face with a fan. He moved the fan away from her face with his staff.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2629 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"A woman in Ihram who is menstruating may wear an inner garment (ghilalah) under her clothes."
arabicText: 2629 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «تَلْبَسُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُحْرِمَةُ اَلْحَائِضُ تَحْتَ ثِيَابِهَا غِلاَلَةً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2629 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman in Ihram who is menstruating may wear an inner garment (ghilalah) under her clothes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2630 - Yahya ibn Abi al-Ala narrated from Abu Abdullah, from his father (as):
"He disliked the use of a niqab (face veil) and gloves for a woman in Ihram."
arabicText: 2630 - وَ رَوَى يَحْيَى بْنُ أَبِي اَلْعَلاَءِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ كَرِهَ لِلْمُحْرِمَةِ اَلْبُرْقُعَ وَ اَلْقُفَّازَيْنِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2630 - Yahya ibn Abi al-Ala narrated from Abu Abdullah, from his father (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "He disliked the use of a niqab (face veil) and gloves for a woman in Ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2631 - Muhammad ibn Ali al-Halabi asked Imam (as) about a woman in Ihram: "Can she wear trousers (sarawil)?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, as she intends by that to maintain modesty."
arabicText: 2631 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ : عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ إِذَا أَحْرَمَتْ أَتَلْبَسُ اَلسَّرَاوِيلَ؟ فَقَالَ: «نَعَمْ إِنَّمَا تُرِيدُ بِذَلِكَ اَلسَّتْرَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2631 - Muhammad ibn Ali al-Halabi asked Imam (as) about a woman in Ihram: "Can she wear trousers (sarawil)?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, as she intends by that to maintain modesty."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2632 - Al-Kahili narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
"A woman in Ihram may wear all types of jewelry except conspicuous earrings (al-qurt al-mashhoor) and a conspicuous necklace (al-qiladah al-mashhoorah)."
arabicText: 2632 - وَ رَوَى اَلْكَاهِلِيُّ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «تَلْبَسُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُحْرِمَةُ اَلْحُلِيَّ كُلَّهُ إِلاَّ اَلْقُرْطَ اَلْمَشْهُورَ وَ اَلْقِلاَدَةَ اَلْمَشْهُورَةَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2632 - Al-Kahili narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman in Ihram may wear all types of jewelry except conspicuous earrings (al-qurt al-mashhoor) and a conspicuous necklace (al-qiladah al-mashhoorah)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2633 - Amir ibn Jutha'ah asked Imam (as) about dyed garments worn by a woman in Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it, except for prominently dyed garments (al-mufdam al-mashhoor)."
arabicText: 2633 - وَ سَأَلَهُ عَامِرُ بْنُ جُذَاعَةَ : عَنْ مُصَبَّغَاتِ اَلثِّيَابِ تَلْبَسُهَا اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُحْرِمَةُ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ إِلاَّ اَلْمُفْدَمُ اَلْمَشْهُورُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2633 - Amir ibn Jutha'ah asked Imam (as) about dyed garments worn by a woman in Ihram.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in it, except for prominently dyed garments (al-mufdam al-mashhoor)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2634 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a woman in Ihram:
"She may wear all types of jewellery, except for jewellery that is prominently worn for adornment."
arabicText: 2634 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمُحْرِمَةِ أَنَّهَا تَلْبَسُ اَلْحُلِيَّ كُلَّهُ إِلاَّ حُلِيّاً مَشْهُوراً لِزِينَةٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2634 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a woman in Ihram:
thaqalaynMatn: "She may wear all types of jewellery, except for jewellery that is prominently worn for adornment."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2635 - Sama'ah asked Imam (as) about a woman in Ihram wearing silk.
Imam (as) said: "It is not proper for her to wear pure silk without any mixture. However, there is no harm if she wears khazz (a silk-blended fabric) or a garment with embroidery while she is in Ihram. If a man passes by her, she should cover herself with her garment but not use her hand to shield herself from the sun. She may wear khazz, although people may say that khazz contains silk. What is disliked is pure silk."
arabicText: 2635 - وَ سَأَلَهُ سَمَاعَةُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمَةِ تَلْبَسُ اَلْحَرِيرَ فَقَالَ «لاَ يَصْلُحُ لَهَا أَنْ تَلْبَسَ حَرِيراً مَحْضاً لاَ خِلْطَ فِيهِ فَأَمَّا اَلْخَزُّ وَ اَلْعَلَمُ فِي اَلثَّوْبِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تَلْبَسَهُ وَ هِيَ مُحْرِمَةٌ وَ إِنْ مَرَّ بِهَا رَجُلٌ اِسْتَتَرَتْ مِنْهُ بِثَوْبِهَا وَ لاَ تَسْتُرُ بِيَدِهَا مِنَ اَلشَّمْسِ وَ تَلْبَسُ اَلْخَزَّ أَمَا إِنَّهُمْ سَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّ فِي اَلْخَزِّ حَرِيراً وَ إِنَّمَا يُكْرَهُ اَلْحَرِيرُ اَلْمُبْهَمُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2635 - Sama'ah asked Imam (as) about a woman in Ihram wearing silk.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "It is not proper for her to wear pure silk without any mixture. However, there is no harm if she wears khazz (a silk-blended fabric) or a garment with embroidery while she is in Ihram. If a man passes by her, she should cover herself with her garment but not use her hand to shield herself from the sun. She may wear khazz, although people may say that khazz contains silk. What is disliked is pure silk."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2636 - Abu Basir al-Muradi asked Imam (as) about a woman wearing qazz (a fabric made from silk and other materials) while in Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it. What is disliked is pure silk (al-harir al-mubham)."
arabicText: 2636 - وَ سَأَلَهُ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ اَلْمُرَادِيُّ : عَنِ اَلْقَزِّ تَلْبَسُهُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ فِي اَلْإِحْرَامِ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ إِنَّمَا يُكْرَهُ اَلْحَرِيرُ اَلْمُبْهَمُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2636 - Abu Basir al-Muradi asked Imam (as) about a woman wearing qazz (a fabric made from silk and other materials) while in Ihram.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it. What is disliked is pure silk (al-harir al-mubham)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2637 - Ya'qub ibn Shu'ayb asked Imam (as) about a woman wearing jewelry while in Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "She may wear anklets (masak) and bracelets (khalkhalayn)."
arabicText: 2637 - وَ سَأَلَهُ يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ : عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَلْبَسُ اَلْحُلِيَّ قَالَ «تَلْبَسُ اَلْمَسَكَ وَ اَلْخَلْخَالَيْنِ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2637 - Ya'qub ibn Shu'ayb asked Imam (as) about a woman wearing jewelry while in Ihram.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "She may wear anklets (masak) and bracelets (khalkhalayn)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2638 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm if a woman enters Ihram wearing gold or khazz (a silk-blended fabric). What is disliked is only pure silk (al-harir al-mubham)."
arabicText: 2638 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تُحْرِمَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ فِي اَلذَّهَبِ وَ اَلْخَزِّ وَ لَيْسَ يُكْرَهُ إِلاَّ اَلْحَرِيرُ اَلْمَحْضُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2638 - Al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a woman enters Ihram wearing gold or khazz (a silk-blended fabric). What is disliked is only pure silk (al-harir al-mubham)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2639 - In a narration from Hariz, he said:
"If a woman has jewelry that she did not acquire specifically for Ihram, she does not need to remove her jewelry."
arabicText: 2639 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَرِيزٍ قَالَ : «إِذَا كَانَ لِلْمَرْأَةِ حُلِيٌّ لَمْ تُحْدِثْهُ لِلْإِحْرَامِ لَمْ تَنْزِعْ حُلِيَّهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2639 - In a narration from Hariz, he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a woman has jewelry that she did not acquire specifically for Ihram, she does not need to remove her jewelry."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2640 - It was narrated from Abu al-Hasan al-Nahdi, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked, while I was present, about a woman entering Ihram wearing a turban (imamah) with an emblem (alam).
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2640 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلنَّهْدِيِّ قَالَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَنَا حَاضِرٌ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تُحْرِمُ فِي اَلْعِمَامَةِ وَ لَهَا عَلَمٌ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2640 - It was narrated from Abu al-Hasan al-Nahdi, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked, while I was present, about a woman entering Ihram wearing a turban (imamah) with an emblem (alam).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2641 - Sa'id al-A'raj asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim tying his loincloth (izar) around his neck.
Imam (as) said: "No."
arabicText: 2641 - وَ سَأَلَهُ سَعِيدٌ اَلْأَعْرَجُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَعْقِدُ إِزَارَهُ فِي عُنُقِهِ قَالَ «لاَ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2642 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim placing the strap of a water bag (qirbah) on his head while drawing water.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2642 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَضَعُ عِصَامَ اَلْقِرْبَةِ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ إِذَا اِسْتَقَى فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2642 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim placing the strap of a water bag (qirbah) on his head while drawing water.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2643 - Ya'qub ibn Shu'ayb asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim who has a wound. Can he bind it or wrap it with a cloth?
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2643 - وَ سَأَلَهُ يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَكُونُ بِهِ اَلْقَرْحَةُ يَرْبِطُهَا أَوْ يُعَصِّبُهَا بِخِرْقَةٍ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2644 - Imran al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"A Muhrim may tie a cloth around his waist or secure it around the position of the loincloth (izar), but he should not raise it to his chest."
arabicText: 2644 - وَ رَوَى عِمْرَانُ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْمُحْرِمُ يَشُدُّ عَلَى بَطْنِهِ اَلْعِمَامَةَ وَ إِنْ شَاءَ يُعَصِّبُهَا عَلَى مَوْضِعِ اَلْإِزَارِ وَ لاَ يَرْفَعُهَا إِلَى صَدْرِهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2644 - Imran al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A Muhrim may tie a cloth around his waist or secure it around the position of the loincloth (izar), but he should not raise it to his chest."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2645 - Ibn Faddal narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim tying a belt (himyan) around his waist.
Imam (as) said: "Yes, and what is better than securing his money?"
arabicText: 2645 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَشُدُّ اَلْهِمْيَانَ فِي وَسَطِهِ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ مَا خَيْرُهُ بَعْدَ نَفَقَتِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2645 - Ibn Faddal narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim tying a belt (himyan) around his waist.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, and what is better than securing his money?"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible to Wear in the State of Ihram
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2646 - In a narration from Abu Basir, from Imam (as), he said:
"My father (as) used to tie his money securely around his waist, as it was part of completing his Hajj."
arabicText: 2646 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَشُدُّ عَلَى بَطْنِهِ نَفَقَتَهُ يَسْتَوْثِقُ بِهَا فَإِنَّهَا تَمَامُ حَجِّهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2646 - In a narration from Abu Basir, from Imam (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "My father (as) used to tie his money securely around his waist, as it was part of completing his Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2647 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm for a Muhrim to use kohl that does not contain musk or camphor if he has an eye ailment. A woman in Ihram may use any kohl except black kohl intended for adornment."
arabicText: 2647 - رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يَكْتَحِلَ بِكُحْلٍ لَيْسَ فِيهِ مِسْكٌ وَ لاَ كَافُورٌ إِذَا اِشْتَكَى عَيْنَيْهِ وَ تَكْتَحِلُ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُحْرِمَةُ بِالْكُحْلِ كُلِّهِ إِلاَّ كُحْلاً أَسْوَدَ لِزِينَةٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2647 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm for a Muhrim to use kohl that does not contain musk or camphor if he has an eye ailment. A woman in Ihram may use any kohl except black kohl intended for adornment."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2648 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"A Muhrim may apply kohl to his eyes if he wishes, provided it is made with sabr (aloe) and does not contain saffron (za'faran) or turmeric (wars)."
arabicText: 2648 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «يَكْتَحِلُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ عَيْنَيْهِ إِنْ شَاءَ بِصَبِرٍ لَيْسَ فِيهِ زَعْفَرَانٌ وَ لاَ وَرْسٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2648 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A Muhrim may apply kohl to his eyes if he wishes, provided it is made with sabr (aloe) and does not contain saffron (za'faran) or turmeric (wars)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2649 - Hariz narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Do not look into a mirror while you are in Ihram, because it is considered a form of adornment (zeenah)."
arabicText: 2649 - وَ رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ تَنْظُرْ فِي اَلْمِرْآةِ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ لِأَنَّهُ مِنَ اَلزِّينَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2649 - Hariz narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not look into a mirror while you are in Ihram, because it is considered a form of adornment (zeenah)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2650 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim using a miswak (tooth-stick).
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I asked: "What if it causes bleeding while using it?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, it is part of the Sunnah."
arabicText: 2650 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَسْتَاكُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ» قَالَ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ أَدْمَى يَسْتَاكُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ هُوَ مِنَ اَلسُّنَّةِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2650 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim using a miswak (tooth-stick).
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I asked: "What if it causes bleeding while using it?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, it is part of the Sunnah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2651 - Hammad narrated from Hariz, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm for a Muhrim to undergo cupping (hijamah), provided he does not shave or pluck hair."
arabicText: 2651 - وَ رَوَى حَمَّادٌ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَحْتَجِمَ اَلْمُحْرِمُ مَا لَمْ يَحْلِقْ أَوْ يَقْلَعِ اَلشَّعْرَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2651 - Hammad narrated from Hariz, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm for a Muhrim to undergo cupping (hijamah), provided he does not shave or pluck hair."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2652 - Dharih asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim undergoing cupping (hijamah).
Imam (as) said: "Yes, if he fears harm from the blood."
arabicText: 2652 - وَ سَأَلَ ذَرِيحٌ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَحْتَجِمُ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ إِذَا خَشِيَ اَلدَّمَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2652 - Dharih asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim undergoing cupping (hijamah).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, if he fears harm from the blood."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2653 - Al-Hasan al-Sayqal asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim whose tooth is causing him pain: "Can he have it extracted?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2653 - وَ سَأَلَ اَلْحَسَنُ اَلصَّيْقَلُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يُؤْذِيهِ ضِرْسُهُ أَ يَقْلَعُهُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2653 - Al-Hasan al-Sayqal asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a Muhrim whose tooth is causing him pain: "Can he have it extracted?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, there is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2654 - Imran al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he was asked about a Muhrim who has a wound and uses a medicine containing saffron.
Imam (as) said: "If the saffron is the dominant ingredient in the medicine, then no. But if the other ingredients are dominant, there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2654 - وَ رَوَى عِمْرَانُ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَكُونُ بِهِ اَلْجُرْحُ فَيَتَدَاوَى بِدَوَاءٍ فِيهِ زَعْفَرَانٌ فَقَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ اَلزَّعْفَرَانُ غَالِباً عَلَى اَلدَّوَاءِ فَلاَ وَ إِنْ كَانَتِ اَلْأَدْوِيَةُ غَالِبَةً عَلَيْهِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2654 - Imran al-Halabi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he was asked about a Muhrim who has a wound and uses a medicine containing saffron.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the saffron is the dominant ingredient in the medicine, then no. But if the other ingredients are dominant, there is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2655 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Imam (as) about a Muhrim squeezing a boil and tying a cloth around it.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2655 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَعْصِرُ اَلدُّمَّلَ وَ يَرْبِطُ عَلَيْهِ اَلْخِرْقَةَ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2656 - Imam (as) said:
"If a Muhrim falls ill, let him seek treatment with what is permissible for him to consume while in the state of Ihram."
arabicText: 2656 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «إِذَا اِشْتَكَى اَلْمُحْرِمُ فَلْيَتَدَاوَ بِمَا يَحِلُّ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2656 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a Muhrim falls ill, let him seek treatment with what is permissible for him to consume while in the state of Ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2657 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a Muhrim develops an abscess or a boil, he may lance it and treat it with oil or fat."
arabicText: 2657 - وَ رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا خَرَجَ بِالْمُحْرِمِ اَلْخُرَاجُ وَ اَلدُّمَّلُ فَلْيَبُطَّهُ وَ لْيُدَاوِهِ بِزَيْتٍ أَوْ سَمْنٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2657 - Hisham ibn Salim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a Muhrim develops an abscess or a boil, he may lance it and treat it with oil or fat."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2658 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of the Imams (as) regarding a Muhrim whose hands have cracked.
Imam (as) said: "He may anoint them with oil, fat, or melted fat (ihalah)."
arabicText: 2658 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمُحْرِمِ تَشَقَّقُ يَدَاهُ فَقَالَ «يَدْهُنُهُمَا بِزَيْتٍ أَوْ سَمْنٍ أَوْ إِهَالَةٍ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2658 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from one of the Imams (as) regarding a Muhrim whose hands have cracked.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He may anoint them with oil, fat, or melted fat (ihalah)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2659 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudayl narrated from Abu al-Sabbah al-Kinani, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who wished to enter Ihram but feared skin cracking. Could she apply henna beforehand?
Imam (as) said: "I do not like for her to do so."
arabicText: 2659 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ أَبِي اَلصَّبَّاحِ اَلْكِنَانِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ أَرَادَتْ أَنْ تُحْرِمَ فَتَخَوَّفَتِ اَلشُّقَاقَ تَخْضِبُ بِالْحِنَّاءِ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ «مَا يُعْجِبُنِي أَنْ تَفْعَلَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2659 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudayl narrated from Abu al-Sabbah al-Kinani, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who wished to enter Ihram but feared skin cracking. Could she apply henna beforehand?
Imam (as) said: "I do not like for her to do so."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2660 - It is reported that Imam Ali ibn al-Husayn (as) used to say to his family when preparing for a journey to Makkah:
"Be cautious not to include anything scented, such as perfume or saffron, in our provisions, whether for us to eat or to serve to others."
arabicText: 2660 - وَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : إِذَا تَجَهَّزَ إِلَى مَكَّةَ قَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ «إِيَّاكُمْ أَنْ تَجْعَلُوا فِي زَادِنَا شَيْئاً مِنَ اَلطِّيبِ وَ لاَ اَلزَّعْفَرَانِ نَأْكُلْهُ أَوْ نُطْعِمْهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2660 - It is reported that Imam Ali ibn al-Husayn (as) used to say to his family when preparing for a journey to Makkah:
thaqalaynMatn: "Be cautious not to include anything scented, such as perfume or saffron, in our provisions, whether for us to eat or to serve to others."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2661 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Four types of fragrances are disliked for a Muhrim: musk, ambergris, saffron, and turmeric. He also disliked fragrant oils with a strong scent."
arabicText: 2661 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «يُكْرَهُ مِنَ اَلطِّيبِ أَرْبَعَةُ أَشْيَاءَ لِلْمُحْرِمِ اَلْمِسْكُ وَ اَلْعَنْبَرُ وَ اَلزَّعْفَرَانُ وَ اَلْوَرْسُ وَ كَانَ يَكْرَهُ مِنَ اَلْأَدْهَانِ اَلطَّيِّبَةَ اَلرِّيحِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2661 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Four types of fragrances are disliked for a Muhrim: musk, ambergris, saffron, and turmeric. He also disliked fragrant oils with a strong scent."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2662 - It was narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Harun, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I ate a sweet dish (khabis) that contained saffron until I was full while I was in Ihram."
Imam (as) said: "When you complete your rituals and wish to leave Makkah, buy dates with a dirham and give them in charity. This will be an expiation for that and for anything else that might have affected your Ihram unknowingly."
arabicText: 2662 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ هَارُونَ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَكَلْتُ خَبِيصاً فِيهِ زَعْفَرَانٌ حَتَّى شَبِعْتُ مِنْهُ وَ أَنَا مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ «إِذَا فَرَغْتَ مِنْ مَنَاسِكِكَ وَ أَرَدْتَ اَلْخُرُوجَ مِنْ مَكَّةَ فَابْتَعْ بِدِرْهَمٍ تَمْراً وَ تَصَدَّقْ بِهِ فَيَكُونَ كَفَّارَةً لِذَلِكَ وَ لِمَا دَخَلَ عَلَيْكَ فِي إِحْرَامِكَ مِمَّا لاَ تَعْلَمُ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2662 - It was narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Harun, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I ate a sweet dish (khabis) that contained saffron until I was full while I was in Ihram."
Imam (as) said: "When you complete your rituals and wish to leave Makkah, buy dates with a dirham and give them in charity. This will be an expiation for that and for anything else that might have affected your Ihram unknowingly."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2663 - Zurara narrated from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"Whoever intentionally eats saffron or food containing fragrance while in Ihram must offer a blood sacrifice (dam). However, if he does so out of forgetfulness, there is nothing upon him, but he should seek forgiveness from Allah (swt) and repent to Him."
arabicText: 2663 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «مَنْ أَكَلَ زَعْفَرَاناً مُتَعَمِّداً أَوْ طَعَاماً فِيهِ طِيبٌ فَعَلَيْهِ دَمٌ وَ إِنْ كَانَ نَاسِياً فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ وَ يَسْتَغْفِرُ اَللَّهَ وَ يَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2663 - Zurara narrated from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever intentionally eats saffron or food containing fragrance while in Ihram must offer a blood sacrifice (dam). However, if he does so out of forgetfulness, there is nothing upon him, but he should seek forgiveness from Allah (swt) and repent to Him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2664 - It was narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Ziyad, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "My servant poured water for me to perform ablution, and I was unaware that there was fragrance (dustashan) in it. I then washed my hands while I was in Ihram."
Imam (as) said: "Give something in charity as an expiation for that."
arabicText: 2664 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَضَّأَنِي اَلْغُلاَمُ وَ أَنَا لاَ أَعْلَمُ بدستشان فِيهِ طِيبٌ فَغَسَلْتُ يَدَيَّ وَ أَنَا مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ «تَصَدَّقْ بِشَيْءٍ لِذَلِكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2664 - It was narrated from Al-Hasan ibn Ziyad, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"My servant poured water for me to perform ablution, and I was unaware that there was fragrance (dustashan) in it. I then washed my hands while I was in Ihram."
Imam (as) said: "Give something in charity as an expiation for that."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2665 - Ibrahim ibn Sufyan wrote to Abu al-Hasan (as) asking about a Muhrim washing his hands with soapwort (ushnan) that contains idhkhar (a type of fragrant grass).
Imam (as) wrote back: "I do not like it for you."
arabicText: 2665 - وَ كَتَبَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ سُفْيَانَ إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : اَلْمُحْرِمُ يَغْسِلُ يَدَهُ بِأُشْنَانٍ فِيهِ اَلْإِذْخِرُ فَكَتَبَ «لاَ أُحِبُّهُ لَكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2665 - Ibrahim ibn Sufyan wrote to Abu al-Hasan (as) asking about a Muhrim washing his hands with soapwort (ushnan) that contains idhkhar (a type of fragrant grass).
Imam (as) wrote back:
thaqalaynMatn: "I do not like it for you."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2666 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
I asked him about a man who touched perfume while in Ihram, out of forgetfulness.
Imam (as) said: "He should wash his hands, recite the Talbiyah, and there is nothing upon him."
In another narration: "He should seek forgiveness from his Lord (azj)."
arabicText:
2666 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَسَّ اَلطِّيبَ نَاسِياً وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ قَالَ «يَغْسِلُ يَدَيْهِ وَ يُلَبِّي وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ.
وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ: «وَ يَسْتَغْفِرُ رَبَّهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2666 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about a man who touched perfume while in Ihram, out of forgetfulness.
Imam (as) said: "He should wash his hands, recite the Talbiyah, and there is nothing upon him."
In another narration: "He should seek forgiveness from his Lord (azj)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2667 - Humran narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) regarding the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted:
"Then let them complete their prescribed duties and fulfill their vows" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said: "Tafath refers to a person's grooming, including the use of perfume. Once he has completed his rituals, perfume becomes permissible for him."
arabicText: 2667 - وَ رَوَى حُمْرَانُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «۝ ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ وَ لْيُوفُوا نُذُورَهُمْ ۝» قَالَ «اَلتَّفَثُ حُفُوفُ اَلرَّجُلِ مِنَ اَلطِّيبِ فَإِذَا قَضَى نُسُكَهُ حَلَّ لَهُ اَلطِّيبُ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2667 - Humran narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) regarding the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted:
"Then let them complete their prescribed duties and fulfill their vows" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Tafath refers to a person's grooming, including the use of perfume. Once he has completed his rituals, perfume becomes permissible for him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2668 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Abu Abdullah (as) about henna.
Imam (as) said: "A Muhrim may touch it and use it to treat his camel. It is not considered a perfume, and there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2668 - وَ سَأَلَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْحِنَّاءِ فَقَالَ «إِنَّ اَلْمُحْرِمَ لَيَمَسُّهُ وَ يُدَاوِي بِهِ بَعِيرَهُ وَ مَا هُوَ بِطِيبٍ وَ مَا بِهِ بَأْسٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2668 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Abu Abdullah (as) about henna.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "A Muhrim may touch it and use it to treat his camel. It is not considered a perfume, and there is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2669 - Imam (as) said: "There is no harm if a Muhrim washes khaluq (a fragrant substance) off his garment."
arabicText:
2669 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَغْسِلَ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْخَلُوقَ عَنْ ثَوْبِهِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ».
وإذا اضطر المحرم إلى سعوط فيه مسك من ريح يعرض له في وجهه وعلة تصيبه فلا بأس بأن يستعط به
فَقَدْ سَأَلَ إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ جَابِرٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ «اِسْتَعِطْ بِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2669 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a Muhrim washes khaluq (a fragrant substance) off his garment."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2670 - Al-Halabi and Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"A Muhrim may cover his nose from a pleasant fragrance but should not cover his nose from an unpleasant odor."
arabicText: 2670 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْمُحْرِمُ يُمْسِكُ عَلَى أَنْفِهِ مِنَ اَلرِّيحِ اَلطَّيِّبَةِ وَ لاَ يُمْسِكُ عَلَى أَنْفِهِ مِنَ اَلرِّيحِ اَلْخَبِيثَةِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2670 - Al-Halabi and Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A Muhrim may cover his nose from a pleasant fragrance but should not cover his nose from an unpleasant odor."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2671 - Hisham ibn al-Hakam narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm in the pleasant fragrances encountered between Safa and Marwah from the perfumers' shops, and he should not cover his nose."
arabicText: 2671 - وَ رَوَى هِشَامُ بْنُ اَلْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ بِالرِّيحِ اَلطَّيِّبَةِ فِيمَا بَيْنَ اَلصَّفَا وَ اَلْمَرْوَةِ مِنْ رِيحِ اَلْعَطَّارِينَ وَ لاَ يُمْسِكُ عَلَى أَنْفِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2671 - Hisham ibn al-Hakam narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in the pleasant fragrances encountered between Safa and Marwah from the perfumers' shops, and he should not cover his nose."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2672 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm in smelling idhkhar (a type of fragrant grass), qaysum (a medicinal herb), khuzama (lavender), shiḥ (wormwood), and similar plants while you are in Ihram."
Ali ibn Mahziyar reported:
I asked Ibn Abi Umayr about apples, citrons (utruj), lotus fruit (nabq), and other fragrant items. Imam (as) said: "Refrain from smelling or eating them." However, he did not narrate anything specific regarding their permissibility.
arabicText:
2672 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تَشَمَّ اَلْإِذْخِرَ وَ اَلْقَيْصُومَ وَ اَلْخُزَامَى وَ اَلشِّيحَ وَ أَشْبَاهَهُ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ».
وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ مَهْزِيَارَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ اِبْنَ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ اَلتُّفَّاحِ وَ اَلْأُتْرُجِّ وَ اَلنَّبِقِ وَ مَا طَابَ مِنْ رِيحِهِ فَقَالَ تُمْسِكُ عَنْ شَمِّهِ وَ أَكْلِهِ وَ لَمْ يَرْوِ فِيهِ شَيْئاً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2672 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no harm in smelling idhkhar (a type of fragrant grass), qaysum (a medicinal herb), khuzama (lavender), shiḥ (wormwood), and similar plants while you are in Ihram."
Ali ibn Mahziyar reported:
I asked Ibn Abi Umayr about apples, citrons (utruj), lotus fruit (nabq), and other fragrant items. Imam (as) said: "Refrain from smelling or eating them." However, he did not narrate anything specific regarding their permissibility.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2673 - It was narrated from Abdullah ibn al-Mughira, who said:
I said to Abu al-Hasan the First (as): "Can I use a shade while I am in Ihram?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I asked: "What if I use a shade and offer expiation?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I asked: "What if I fall ill?"
Imam (as) said: "Use a shade and offer expiation."
Then Imam (as) said: "Do you not know that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: 'There is no pilgrim who exposes himself to the sun while reciting the Talbiyah until the sun sets except that his sins disappear with the setting of the sun.'"
arabicText: 2673 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ اَلْمُغِيرَةِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أُظَلِّلُ وَ أَنَا مُحْرِمٌ قَالَ «لاَ» قُلْتُ فَأُظَلِّلُ وَ أُكَفِّرُ قَالَ «لاَ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ مَرِضْتُ قَالَ «ظَلِّلْ وَ كَفِّرْ » ثُمَّ قَالَ «أَ مَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ قَالَ «مَا مِنْ حَاجٍّ يَضْحَى مُلَبِّياً حَتَّى تَغِيبَ اَلشَّمْسُ إِلاَّ غَابَتْ ذُنُوبُهُ مَعَهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2673 - It was narrated from Abdullah ibn al-Mughira, who said:
I said to Abu al-Hasan the First (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"Can I use a shade while I am in Ihram?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I asked: "What if I use a shade and offer expiation?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I asked: "What if I fall ill?"
Imam (as) said: "Use a shade and offer expiation."
Then Imam (as) said: "Do you not know that the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) said: 'There is no pilgrim who exposes himself to the sun while reciting the Talbiyah until the sun sets except that his sins disappear with the setting of the sun.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2674 - It was narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Muslim, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far the Second (as): "What is the difference between a tent (fusṭāṭ) and the shade of a litter (maḥmil)?"
Imam (as) said: "One should not seek shade in the maḥmil. The difference between them is like the case of a woman who menstruates during Month of Ramadan; she makes up the fasts but does not make up the prayers."
I replied: "You have spoken the truth, may I be your ransom."
arabicText: 2674 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ مَا فَرْقُ مَا بَيْنَ اَلْفُسْطَاطِ وَ بَيْنَ ظِلِّ اَلْمَحْمِلِ قَالَ «لاَ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُسْتَظَلَّ فِي اَلْمَحْمِلِ وَ اَلْفَرْقُ بَيْنَهُمَا أَنَّ اَلْمَرْأَةَ تَطْمَثُ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ فَتَقْضِي اَلصِّيَامَ وَ لاَ تَقْضِي اَلصَّلاَةَ» قَالَ صَدَقْتَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2674 - It was narrated from Al-Husayn ibn Muslim, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far the Second (as): "What is the difference between a tent (fusṭāṭ) and the shade of a litter (maḥmil)?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"One should not seek shade in the maḥmil. The difference between them is like the case of a woman who menstruates during Month of Ramadan; she makes up the fasts but does not make up the prayers."
I replied: "You have spoken the truth, may I be your ransom."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2675 - Ali ibn Mahziyar narrated from Bakr ibn Salih, who said:
I wrote to Abu Ja'far the Second (as), saying: "My aunt is with me, and she is my travel companion. She suffers greatly from the heat when she is in Ihram. Do you permit me to use shade for both of us?"
Imam (as) wrote back: "Shade her alone."
arabicText: 2675 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ قَالَ كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّ عَمَّتِي مَعِي وَ هِيَ زَمِيلَتِي وَ يَشْتَدُّ عَلَيْهَا اَلْحَرُّ إِذَا أَحْرَمَتْ فَتَرَى أَنْ أُظَلِّلَ عَلَيَّ وَ عَلَيْهَا فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «ظَلِّلْ عَلَيْهَا وَحْدَهَا».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2675 - Ali ibn Mahziyar narrated from Bakr ibn Salih, who said:
I wrote to Abu Ja'far the Second (as), saying:
thaqalaynMatn:
"My aunt is with me, and she is my travel companion. She suffers greatly from the heat when she is in Ihram. Do you permit me to use shade for both of us?"
Imam (as) wrote back: "Shade her alone."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2676 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Abu Basir, who said:
I asked Imam (as) about a woman placing a shade over herself while she is in Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I asked: "What about a man placing a shade over himself while in Ihram?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, if he is afflicted with severe pain (shaqiqah), and he should give charity of a mudd for each day."
arabicText: 2676 - وَ رَوَى اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَضْرِبُ عَلَيْهَا اَلظِّلاَلَ وَ هِيَ مُحْرِمَةٌ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ» قُلْتُ فَالرَّجُلُ يَضْرِبُ عَلَيْهِ اَلظِّلاَلَ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ قَالَ «نَعَمْ إِذَا كَانَتْ بِهِ شَقِيقَةٌ وَ يَتَصَدَّقُ بِمُدٍّ لِكُلِّ يَوْمٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2676 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Abu Basir, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Imam (as) about a woman placing a shade over herself while she is in Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
I asked: "What about a man placing a shade over himself while in Ihram?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, if he is afflicted with severe pain (shaqiqah), and he should give charity of a mudd for each day."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2677 - Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Bazi' narrated that Abu al-Hasan (as) was asked—while I was listening—about a person in the state of ihram seeking shade due to harm from rain or the sun, or, he said, due to illness.
Imam (as) commanded that a sheep should be sacrificed in Mina and said: "When we want to do this, we seek shade and offer the expiation."
arabicText: 2677 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَنَا أَسْمَعُ عَنِ اَلظِّلِّ لِلْمُحْرِمِ فِي أَذًى مِنْ مَطَرٍ أَوْ شَمْسٍ أَوْ قَالَ مِنْ عِلَّةٍ فَأَمَرَ بِفِدَاءِ شَاةٍ يَذْبَحُهَا بِمِنًى وَ قَالَ «نَحْنُ إِذَا أَرَدْنَا ذَلِكَ ظَلَّلْنَا وَ فَدَيْنَا».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2677 - Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Bazi' narrated that Abu al-Hasan (as) was asked—while I was listening—about a person in the state of ihram seeking shade due to harm from rain or the sun, or, he said, due to illness.
Imam (as) commanded that a sheep should be sacrificed in Mina and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When we want to do this, we seek shade and offer the expiation."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2678 - In the narration of Hariz, Abu Abdullah (as) said: "There is no harm in a tent being set up over women and children while they are in the state of ihram. However, the person in ihram must not immerse themselves in water, nor should someone who is fasting."
arabicText: 2678 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَرِيزٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ بَأْسَ بِالْقُبَّةِ عَلَى اَلنِّسَاءِ وَ اَلصِّبْيَانِ وَ هُمْ مُحْرِمُونَ وَ لاَ يَرْتَمِسُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ فِي اَلْمَاءِ وَ لاَ اَلصَّائِمُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2678 - In the narration of Hariz, Abu Abdullah (as) said:
