thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in a tent being set up over women and children while they are in the state of ihram. However, the person in ihram must not immerse themselves in water, nor should someone who is fasting."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2679 - It is narrated from Mansur ibn Hazim who said: "I saw Abu Abdullah (as) perform ablution while he was in the state of ihram, and then he took a towel and wiped his face with it."
arabicText: 2679 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ قَالَ : رَأَيْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ قَدْ تَوَضَّأَ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ ثُمَّ أَخَذَ مِنْدِيلاً فَمَسَحَ بِهِ وَجْهَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2679 - It is narrated from Mansur ibn Hazim who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I saw Abu Abdullah (as) perform ablution while he was in the state of ihram, and then he took a towel and wiped his face with it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2680 - It is narrated by Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "It is disliked for the person in ihram to cover their nose with their garment. However, there is no harm if the person in ihram extends their garment until it reaches their nose."
arabicText: 2680 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «يُكْرَهُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يَجُوزَ بِثَوْبِهِ فَوْقَ أَنْفِهِ وَ لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَمُدَّ اَلْمُحْرِمُ ثَوْبَهُ حَتَّى يَبْلُغَ أَنْفَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2680 - It is narrated by Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is disliked for the person in ihram to cover their nose with their garment. However, there is no harm if the person in ihram extends their garment until it reaches their nose."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2681 - Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari and Hisham ibn al-Hakam narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said: "It is disliked for the person in ihram to let their garment cover their nose from below."
Imam (as) also said, "Show openness to the One for whom you have entered the state of ihram."
arabicText: 2681 - أَنَّ حَفْصَ بْنَ اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ وَ هِشَامَ بْنَ اَلْحَكَمِ رَوَيَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «يُكْرَهُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يَجُوزَ ثَوْبُهُ أَنْفَهُ مِنْ أَسْفَلَ» وَ قَالَ «اِضْحَ لِمَنْ أَحْرَمْتَ لَهُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2681 - Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari and Hisham ibn al-Hakam narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"It is disliked for the person in ihram to let their garment cover their nose from below."
Imam (as) also said, "Show openness to the One for whom you have entered the state of ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2682 - It is narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan who said: "I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say to my father, who complained to him about the heat of the sun while he was in the state of ihram and was troubled by it.
He asked, 'Do you think it is permissible for me to cover myself with the edge of my garment?'
Imam (as) said: 'There is no harm in that as long as it does not touch your head.'"
arabicText: 2682 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ : سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ لِأَبِي وَ شَكَا إِلَيْهِ حَرَّ اَلشَّمْسِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ وَ هُوَ يَتَأَذَّى بِهِ وَ قَالَ تَرَى أَنْ أَسْتَتِرَ بِطَرَفِ ثَوْبِي قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ مَا لَمْ يُصِبْ رَأْسَكَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2682 - It is narrated from Abdullah ibn Sinan who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say to my father, who complained to him about the heat of the sun while he was in the state of ihram and was troubled by it.
He asked, 'Do you think it is permissible for me to cover myself with the edge of my garment?'
Imam (as) said: 'There is no harm in that as long as it does not touch your head.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2683 - Saeed al-A'raj asked him about a person in the state of ihram seeking shade from the sun using a stick or their hand.
Imam (as) said: "No, except in the case of an illness."
arabicText: 2683 - وَ سَأَلَهُ سَعِيدٌ اَلْأَعْرَجُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَسْتَتِرُ مِنَ اَلشَّمْسِ بِعُودِ أَوْ بِيَدِهِ فَقَالَ «لاَ إِلاَّ مِنْ عِلَّةٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2683 - Saeed al-A'raj asked him about a person in the state of ihram seeking shade from the sun using a stick or their hand.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "No, except in the case of an illness."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2684 - Al-Halabi asked him about a person in the state of ihram who covers their head unintentionally or while sleeping.
Imam (as) said: "They should recite the Talbiyah when they remember."
arabicText: 2684 - وَ سَأَلَهُ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يُغَطِّي رَأْسَهُ نَاسِياً أَوْ نَائِماً فَقَالَ «يُلَبِّي إِذَا ذَكَرَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2684 - Al-Halabi asked him about a person in the state of ihram who covers their head unintentionally or while sleeping.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "They should recite the Talbiyah when they remember."

englishText: Hadith.2685 - In the narration of Hariz: "They should remove the covering, recite the Talbiyah, and there is nothing upon them (no penalty).
arabicText: 2685 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَرِيزٍ : «يُلْقِي اَلْقِنَاعَ وَ يُلَبِّي وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2685 - In the narration of Hariz:
thaqalaynMatn: "They should remove the covering, recite the Talbiyah, and there is nothing upon them (no penalty).

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2686 - He was asked about a person in the state of ihram sleeping on their face while on their mount.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in that."
arabicText: 2686 - وَ سَأَلَهُ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَنَامُ عَلَى وَجْهِهِ وَ هُوَ عَلَى رَاحِلَتِهِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2686 - He was asked about a person in the state of ihram sleeping on their face while on their mount.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in that."

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2687 - Zurara asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a person in the state of ihram who has flies landing on their face, preventing them from sleeping, and whether they may cover their face when they wish to sleep.
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2687 - وَ سَأَلَ زُرَارَةُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَقَعُ اَلذُّبَابُ عَلَى وَجْهِهِ حِينَ يُرِيدُ اَلنَّوْمَ فَيَمْنَعُهُ مِنَ اَلنَّوْمِ أَ يُغَطِّي وَجْهَهُ إِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَنَامَ قَالَ «نَعَمْ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2687 - Zurara asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a person in the state of ihram who has flies landing on their face, preventing them from sleeping, and whether they may cover their face when they wish to sleep.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes."

chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2688 - Zurara narrated from Abu Abdullah (as): "A woman in the state of ihram should let her garment hang down to her chest."
arabicText: 2688 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «أَنَّ اَلْمُحْرِمَةَ تَسْدُلُ ثَوْبَهَا إِلَى نَحْرِهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2688 - Zurara narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "A woman in the state of ihram should let her garment hang down to her chest."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2689 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man in the state of ihram who trimmed one of his nails.
Imam (as) said: "He must give a mudd of food as expiation. If he trims ten nails, he must sacrifice a sheep."
I asked: "What if he trims the nails of both his hands and feet?"
Imam (as) said: "If he does this in one sitting, he must offer one sacrifice. If he does it in two separate sittings, he must offer two sacrifices."
arabicText: 2689 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَلَّمَ ظُفُراً مِنْ أَظَافِيرِهِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ مُدٌّ مِنْ طَعَامٍ حَتَّى يَبْلُغَ عَشَرَةً فَإِنْ قَلَّمَ أَصَابِعَ يَدَيْهِ كُلَّهَا فَعَلَيْهِ دَمُ شَاةٍ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ قَلَّمَ أَظَافِيرَ يَدَيْهِ وَ رِجْلَيْهِ جَمِيعاً فَقَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ فِي مَجْلِسٍ وَاحِدٍ فَعَلَيْهِ دَمٌ وَ إِنْ كَانَ فَعَلَهُ مُتَفَرِّقاً فِي مَجْلِسَيْنِ فَعَلَيْهِ دَمَانِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2689 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man in the state of ihram who trimmed one of his nails.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He must give a mudd of food as expiation. If he trims ten nails, he must sacrifice a sheep."
I asked: "What if he trims the nails of both his hands and feet?"
Imam (as) said: "If he does this in one sitting, he must offer one sacrifice. If he does it in two separate sittings, he must offer two sacrifices."

chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2690 - In the narration of Zurara from Abu Ja'far (as): "Whoever does that (trims nails) out of forgetfulness, inattentiveness, or ignorance, there is nothing upon them (no penalty)."
arabicText: 2690 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «أَنَّ مَنْ فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ نَاسِياً أَوْ سَاهِياً أَوْ جَاهِلاً فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2690 - In the narration of Zurara from Abu Ja'far (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever does that (trims nails) out of forgetfulness, inattentiveness, or ignorance, there is nothing upon them (no penalty)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2691 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram whose nails grow long or some of them break and cause harm.
Imam (as) said: "They should not cut any of them if they can avoid it. But if they cause harm, they may trim them, and for each nail, they must give a handful of food as expiation."
arabicText: 2691 - وَ سَأَلَ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ تَطُولُ أَظْفَارَهُ أَوْ يَنْكَسِرُ بَعْضُهَا فَيُؤْذِيهِ ذَلِكَ قَالَ «لاَ يَقُصَّ مِنْهَا شَيْئاً إِنِ اِسْتَطَاعَ فَإِنْ كَانَتْ تُؤْذِيهِ فَلْيَقُصَّهَا وَ لْيُطْعِمْ مَكَانَ كُلِّ ظُفُرٍ قَبْضَةً مِنْ طَعَامٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2691 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram whose nails grow long or some of them break and cause harm.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They should not cut any of them if they can avoid it. But if they cause harm, they may trim them, and for each nail, they must give a handful of food as expiation."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2692 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Ibrahim (as) about a man who forgot to trim his nails before entering the state of ihram until he had already entered it.
Imam (as) said: "He should leave them as they are."
I said: "One of our companions advised him to trim his nails and renew his ihram, so he did."
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sacrifice (as expiation)."
arabicText: 2692 - وَ سَأَلَ إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ أَبَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ نَسِيَ أَنْ يُقَلِّمَ أَظَافِيرَهُ عِنْدَ اَلْإِحْرَامِ حَتَّى أَحْرَمَ قَالَ «يَدَعُهَا» قُلْتُ فَإِنَّ رَجُلاً مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا أَفْتَاهُ أَنْ يُقَلِّمَ أَظَافِيرَهُ وَ يُعِيدَ إِحْرَامَهُ فَفَعَلَ فَقَالَ «عَلَيْهِ دَمٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2692 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Ibrahim (as) about a man who forgot to trim his nails before entering the state of ihram until he had already entered it.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He should leave them as they are."
I said: "One of our companions advised him to trim his nails and renew his ihram, so he did."
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sacrifice (as expiation)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2693 - Hariz narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "If a man plucks his underarm hair after entering the state of ihram, he must offer a sacrifice (as expiation)."
arabicText: 2693 - وَ رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا نَتَفَ اَلرَّجُلُ إِبْطَهُ بَعْدَ اَلْإِحْرَامِ فَعَلَيْهِ دَمٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2693 - Hariz narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man plucks his underarm hair after entering the state of ihram, he must offer a sacrifice (as expiation)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2694 - In another narration: "Whoever shaves their head or plucks their underarm hair out of forgetfulness, inattentiveness, or ignorance, there is nothing upon them (no penalty)."
arabicText: 2694 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : «مَنْ حَلَقَ رَأْسَهُ أَوْ نَتَفَ إِبْطَهُ نَاسِياً أَوْ سَاهِياً أَوْ جَاهِلاً فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2695 - Imam (as) said: "There is no harm if a person in the state of ihram enters the bathhouse, but they should not scrub themselves."
arabicText: 2695 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَدْخُلَ اَلْمُحْرِمُ اَلْحَمَّامَ وَ لَكِنْ لاَ يَتَدَلَّكُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2695 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a person in the state of ihram enters the bathhouse, but they should not scrub themselves."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2696 - Imam (as) said: "A person in the state of ihram should not cut the hair of one who is not in the state of ihram."
arabicText: 2696 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ يَأْخُذِ اَلْحَرَامُ مِنْ شَعْرِ اَلْحَلاَلِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2696 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A person in the state of ihram should not cut the hair of one who is not in the state of ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2697 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) passed by Ka'b ibn Ujrah al-Ansari while he was in the state of ihram, and lice had afflicted his head, eyebrows, and eyes. The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"I did not think the matter would reach the state that I now see."
He (sw) then commanded him to perform an expiation on his behalf, and Ka'b shaved his head, following the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "But if any of you is ill or has an ailment in his head, [making shaving necessary], then [his ransom is] fasting, or charity, or sacrifice" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:196).
The expiation is:
-	Fasting for three days.
-	Giving charity to six needy individuals, with each person receiving a measure (sa') of dates—or, as narrated in another report, a mudd of dates.
Sacrificing a sheep, which must only be given to the needy and not eaten by anyone else.
arabicText: 2697 - وَ مَرَّ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ عَلَى كَعْبِ بْنِ عُجْرَةَ اَلْأَنْصَارِيِّ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ وَ قَدْ أَكَلَ اَلْقَمْلُ رَأْسَهُ وَ حَاجِبَيْهِ وَ عَيْنَيْهِ فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ «مَا كُنْتُ أَرَى أَنَّ اَلْأَمْرَ يَبْلُغُ مَا أَرَى» فَأَمَرَهُ فَنَسَكَ عَنْهُ نُسُكاً وَ حَلَقَ رَأْسَهُ بِقَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «۝ فَمَنْ كٰانَ مِنْكُمْ مَرِيضاً أَوْ بِهِ أَذىً مِنْ رَأْسِهِ فَفِدْيَةٌ مِنْ صِيٰامٍ أَوْ صَدَقَةٍ أَوْ نُسُكٍ ۝» فَالصِّيَامُ ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَ اَلصَّدَقَةُ عَلَى سِتَّةِ مَسَاكِينَ لِكُلِّ مِسْكِينٍ صَاعٌ مِنْ تَمْرٍ وَ رُوِيَ «مُدٌّ مِنْ تَمْرٍ وَ اَلنُّسُكُ شَاةٌ لاَ يُطْعَمُ مِنْهَا أَحَدٌ إِلاَّ اَلْمَسَاكِينُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2697 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) passed by Ka'b ibn Ujrah al-Ansari while he was in the state of ihram, and lice had afflicted his head, eyebrows, and eyes. The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I did not think the matter would reach the state that I now see."
He (sw) then commanded him to perform an expiation on his behalf, and Ka'b shaved his head, following the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "But if any of you is ill or has an ailment in his head, [making shaving necessary], then [his ransom is] fasting, or charity, or sacrifice" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:196).
The expiation is:
-	Fasting for three days.
-	Giving charity to six needy individuals, with each person receiving a measure (sa') of dates—or, as narrated in another report, a mudd of dates.
Sacrificing a sheep, which must only be given to the needy and not eaten by anyone else.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2698 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Abu Abdullah (as): "What do you say if I find a tick or a louse on me while I am in the state of ihram? Should I remove it?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, even the small ones of these, as they have ascended to a place where they do not belong."
arabicText: 2698 - وَ قَالَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ وَجَدْتُ عَلَيَّ قُرَاداً أَوْ حَلَمَةً أَطْرَحُهَا عَنِّي وَ أَنَا مُحْرِمٌ قَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ صَغَاراً لَهُمَا إِنَّهُمَا رَقِيَا فِي غَيْرِ مَرْقَاهُمَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2698 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Abu Abdullah (as): "What do you say if I find a tick or a louse on me while I am in the state of ihram? Should I remove it?"
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, even the small ones of these, as they have ascended to a place where they do not belong."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2699 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked him about a person in the state of ihram who scratches their head, causing one or two lice to fall off.
Imam (as) said: "There is no penalty upon them, nor do they need to replace the lice."
He asked: "How should the person in ihram scratch?"
Imam (as) replied: "With their nails, as long as they do not cause bleeding or cut any hair."
arabicText: 2699 - وَ قَالَ لَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ : اَلْمُحْرِمُ يَحُكُّ رَأْسَهُ فَتَسْقُطُ اَلْقَمْلَةُ وَ اَلثِّنْتَانِ فَقَالَ «لاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ وَ لاَ يُعِيدُهَا» قَالَ كَيْفَ يَحُكُّ اَلْمُحْرِمُ قَالَ «بِأَظْفَارِهِ مَا لَمْ يُدْمِ وَ لاَ يَقْطَعْ شَعْرَهُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2699 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked him about a person in the state of ihram who scratches their head, causing one or two lice to fall off.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "There is no penalty upon them, nor do they need to replace the lice."
He asked: "How should the person in ihram scratch?"
Imam (as) replied: "With their nails, as long as they do not cause bleeding or cut any hair."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2700 - He was asked about a person in the state of ihram who fiddles with their beard, causing one or two hairs to fall out.
Imam (as) said: "They must give some food as expiation."
arabicText: 2700 - وَ سَأَلَهُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَعْبَثُ بِلِحْيَتِهِ فَيَسْقُطُ مِنْهَا اَلشَّعْرَةُ وَ اَلثِّنْتَانِ قَالَ «يُطْعِمُ شَيْئاً».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2701 - In another narration: "A mudd of food or two handfuls."
It is preferable that the person in the state of ihram does not scratch their head except gently, using the tips of their fingers.
arabicText:
2701 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : «مُدّاً مِنْ طَعَامٍ أَوْ كَفَّيْنِ».
والأولى أن لا يحك المحرم رأسه إلا حكا رفيقا بأطراف الأصابع.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2702 - In the narration of Hisham ibn Salim, Abu Abdullah (as) said: "If one of you places their hand on their head or beard while in the state of ihram and some hair falls out, they should give in charity a handful of biscuits or barley flour."
arabicText: 2702 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «إِذَا وَضَعَ أَحَدُكُمْ يَدَهُ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَ عَلَى لِحْيَتِهِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَسَقَطَ شَيْءٌ مِنَ اَلشَّعْرِ فَلْيَتَصَدَّقْ بِكَفٍّ مِنْ كَعْكٍ أَوْ سَوِيقٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2702 - In the narration of Hisham ibn Salim, Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If one of you places their hand on their head or beard while in the state of ihram and some hair falls out, they should give in charity a handful of biscuits or barley flour."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2703 - Aban narrated from Abu al-Jarud, who said: A man asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a person in the state of ihram who killed a louse.
Imam (as) said: "What a bad thing he has done."
The man asked: "What is its expiation?"
Imam (as) replied: "There is no expiation for it."
arabicText: 2703 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْجَارُودِ قَالَ : سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَتَلَ قَمْلَةً وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ قَالَ «بِئْسَ مَا صَنَعَ» قَالَ فَمَا فِدَاؤُهَا قَالَ «لاَ فِدَاءَ لَهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2703 - Aban narrated from Abu al-Jarud, who said: A man asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a person in the state of ihram who killed a louse.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "What a bad thing he has done."
The man asked: "What is its expiation?"
Imam (as) replied: "There is no expiation for it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2704 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "A person in the state of ihram should remove all insects from themselves, except for lice, as they are from their body. However, if they wish to move a louse from one place to another, it does not harm them."
arabicText: 2704 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْمُحْرِمُ يُلْقِي عَنْهُ اَلدَّوَابَّ كُلَّهَا إِلاَّ اَلْقَمْلَةَ فَإِنَّهَا مِنْ جَسَدِهِ فَإِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يُحَوِّلَ قَمْلَةً مِنْ مَكَانٍ إِلَى مَكَانٍ فَلاَ يَضُرَّهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2704 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A person in the state of ihram should remove all insects from themselves, except for lice, as they are from their body. However, if they wish to move a louse from one place to another, it does not harm them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2705 - Aban narrated from Zurara, who said: I asked him about a person in the state of ihram—can they scratch their head or wash it with water?
Imam (as) said: "They may scratch their head as long as they do not intentionally kill an insect, and there is no harm in washing with water or pouring it over their head, as long as their head is not treated with a binding substance (muddied). If their head is treated with such a substance, they should not pour water over it unless it is due to a state of ritual impurity (from a wet dream)."
arabicText: 2705 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ هَلْ يَحُكُّ رَأْسَهُ أَوْ يَغْسِلُ بِالْمَاءِ فَقَالَ «يَحُكُّ رَأْسَهُ مَا لَمْ يَتَعَمَّدْ قَتْلَ دَابَّةٍ وَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَغْتَسِلَ بِالْمَاءِ وَ يَصُبَّ عَلَى رَأْسَهُ مَا لَمْ يَكُنْ مُلَبِّداً فَإِنْ كَانَ مُلَبِّداً فَلاَ يُفِيضُ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ اَلْمَاءَ إِلاَّ مِنِ اِحْتِلاَمٍ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2705 - Aban narrated from Zurara, who said: I asked him about a person in the state of ihram—can they scratch their head or wash it with water?
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "They may scratch their head as long as they do not intentionally kill an insect, and there is no harm in washing with water or pouring it over their head, as long as their head is not treated with a binding substance (muddied). If their head is treated with such a substance, they should not pour water over it unless it is due to a state of ritual impurity (from a wet dream)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2706 - Ya'qub ibn Shu'ayb asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram taking a bath.
Imam (as) said: "Yes, they may pour water over their head, but they should not scrub it."
arabicText: 2706 - وَ سَأَلَ يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَغْتَسِلُ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ يُفِيضُ اَلْمَاءَ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَ لاَ يَدْلُكُهُ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2707 - In the narration of Hariz from Abu Abdullah (as), Imam (as) said:
"When a person in the state of ihram performs ghusl (ritual bath) for janabah (major ritual impurity), they should pour water over their head and separate their hair with their fingers, parting it gently."
arabicText: 2707 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا اِغْتَسَلَ اَلْمُحْرِمُ مِنَ اَلْجَنَابَةِ صَبَّ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ اَلْمَاءَ وَ يَمِيزُ اَلشَّعْرَ بِأَنَامِلِهِ بَعْضَهُ مِنْ بَعْضٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2707 - In the narration of Hariz from Abu Abdullah (as), Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When a person in the state of ihram performs ghusl (ritual bath) for janabah (major ritual impurity), they should pour water over their head and separate their hair with their fingers, parting it gently."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2708 - Imam (as) said regarding a person in the state of ihram attending the marriage of those not in ihram: "They should not witness it."
Then Imam (as) said: "It is permissible for a person in the state of ihram to point out game to someone not in ihram."
arabicText: 2708 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَشْهَدُ نِكَاحَ مُحِلَّيْنِ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «لاَ يَشْهَدْ » ثُمَّ قَالَ «يَجُوزُ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يُشِيرَ بِصَيْدٍ عَلَى مُحِلٍّ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2709 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "A person in the state of ihram is not allowed to marry or to officiate the marriage of someone who is not in ihram. If they marry or officiate a marriage, the marriage is invalid."
arabicText: 2709 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لَيْسَ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ وَ لاَ يُزَوِّجَ مُحِلاًّ فَإِنْ تَزَوَّجَ أَوْ زَوَّجَ فَتَزْوِيجُهُ بَاطِلٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2709 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A person in the state of ihram is not allowed to marry or to officiate the marriage of someone who is not in ihram. If they marry or officiate a marriage, the marriage is invalid."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2710 - A man from the Ansar married while he was in the state of ihram, and the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) invalidated his marriage.
arabicText: 2710 - وَ إِنَّ رَجُلاً مِنَ اَلْأَنْصَارِ تَزَوَّجَ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَأَبْطَلَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ نِكَاحَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2710 -
thaqalaynMatn: A man from the Ansar married while he was in the state of ihram, and the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) invalidated his marriage.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2711 - Imam (as) said: "Whoever marries a woman while in the state of ihram, they shall be separated, and she will never be permissible for him."
arabicText: 2711 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «مَنْ تَزَوَّجَ اِمْرَأَةً فِي إِحْرَامِهِ فُرِّقَ بَيْنَهُمَا وَ لَمْ تَحِلَّ لَهُ أَبَداً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2711 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever marries a woman while in the state of ihram, they shall be separated, and she will never be permissible for him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2712 - In the narration of Sama'ah: "She is entitled to the dowry if he had consummated the marriage with her."
arabicText: 2712 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ سَمَاعَةَ : «لَهَا اَلْمَهْرُ إِنْ كَانَ دَخَلَ بِهَا».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2713 - In the narration of Asim ibn Humayd from Abu Basir, he said: I heard Imam Abu Abdullah (as) say: "A person in the state of ihram may pronounce divorce but may not marry."
arabicText: 2713 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَاصِمِ بْنِ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : «اَلْمُحْرِمُ يُطَلِّقُ وَ لاَ يَتَزَوَّجُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2713 - In the narration of Asim ibn Humayd from Abu Basir, he said:
thaqalaynMatn: I heard Imam Abu Abdullah (as) say: "A person in the state of ihram may pronounce divorce but may not marry."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2714 - Saeed al-A'raj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who helps a woman down from her mount and holds her close while in the state of ihram.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it unless he does so intentionally [with inappropriate intent], and he has more right to help her down than others."
arabicText: 2714 - وَ سَأَلَ سَعِيدٌ اَلْأَعْرَجُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُنْزِلُ اَلْمَرْأَةَ مِنَ اَلْمَحْمِلِ فَيَضُمُّهَا إِلَيْهِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَتَعَمَّدَ وَ هُوَ أَحَقُّ أَنْ يُنْزِلَهَا مِنْ غَيْرِهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2714 - Saeed al-A'raj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who helps a woman down from her mount and holds her close while in the state of ihram.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it unless he does so intentionally [with inappropriate intent], and he has more right to help her down than others."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2715 - It is narrated from Muhammad al-Halabi, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man in the state of ihram looking at his wife while she is also in the state of ihram.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2715 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ يَنْظُرُ إِلَى اِمْرَأَتِهِ وَ هِيَ مُحْرِمَةٌ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2715 - It is narrated from Muhammad al-Halabi, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man in the state of ihram looking at his wife while she is also in the state of ihram.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2716 - It is narrated from Khalid, the seller of caps, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who had intercourse with his wife before completing the Tawaf al-Nisa.
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a camel (as expiation)."
Then another person came and asked him about the same situation.
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a cow."
Then another person came and asked him.
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sheep."
I said to him after they had left: "May Allah (swt) set you right, how is it that you said a camel for one, a cow for another, and a sheep for the last?"
Imam (as) said: "For the wealthy, it is a camel; for one of moderate means, it is a cow; and for the poor, it is a sheep."
arabicText: 2716 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ خَالِدٍ بَيَّاعِ اَلْقَلاَنِسِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَتَى أَهْلَهُ وَ عَلَيْهِ طَوَافُ اَلنِّسَاءِ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ» ثُمَّ جَاءَهُ آخَرُ فَسَأَلَهُ عَنْهَا فَقَالَ «عَلَيْهِ بَقَرَةٌ» ثُمَّ جَاءَهُ آخَرُ فَسَأَلَهُ عَنْهَا فَقَالَ «عَلَيْهِ شَاةٌ» فَقُلْتُ بَعْدَ مَا قَامُوا أَصْلَحَكَ اَللَّهُ كَيْفَ قُلْتَ عَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ فَقَالَ «أَنْتَ مُوسِرٌ وَ عَلَيْكَ بَدَنَةٌ وَ عَلَى اَلْوَسَطِ بَقَرَةٌ وَ عَلَى اَلْفَقِيرِ شَاةٌ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2717 - Imam (as) said: "Game should not be slaughtered in the Sacred Sanctuary (Haram), even if it was hunted outside the sanctuary."
arabicText: 2717 - وقال عليه السلام: " لا يذبح الصيد في الحرم وإن صيد في الحل.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2717 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Game should not be slaughtered in the Sacred Sanctuary (Haram), even if it was hunted outside the sanctuary."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2718 - Hanan ibn Sadir narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) that he said:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) commanded the killing of a mouse in the Sacred Sanctuary, as well as a snake, a scorpion, and a pied crow. If you strike it, may Allah (swt) distance it [from His mercy]."
He (sw) used to call the mouse "al-Fuwaysiqah" (the little corrupt one) and said: "It weakens water-skins and sets houses on fire for their inhabitants."
arabicText: 2718 - وَ رَوَى حَنَانُ بْنُ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «أَمَرَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِقَتْلِ اَلْفَأْرَةِ فِي اَلْحَرَمِ وَ اَلْأَفْعَى وَ اَلْعَقْرَبِ وَ اَلْغُرَابِ اَلْأَبْقَعِ تَرْمِيهِ فَإِنْ أَصَبْتَهُ فَأَبْعَدَهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ كَانَ يُسَمِّي اَلْفَأْرَةَ اَلْفُوَيْسِقَةِ وَ قَالَ «إِنَّهَا تُوهِي اَلسِّقَاءَ وَ تُضْرِمُ اَلْبَيْتَ عَلَى أَهْلِهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2718 - Hanan ibn Sadir narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) commanded the killing of a mouse in the Sacred Sanctuary, as well as a snake, a scorpion, and a pied crow. If you strike it, may Allah (swt) distance it [from His mercy]."
He (sw) used to call the mouse "al-Fuwaysiqah" (the little corrupt one) and said: "It weakens water-skins and sets houses on fire for their inhabitants."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2719 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a person in the state of ihram removes ticks from their camel, there is no harm in that, but they should not remove lice."
arabicText: 2719 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِنْ أَلْقَى اَلْمُحْرِمُ اَلْقُرَادَ عَنْ بَعِيرِهِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ وَ لاَ يُلْقِي اَلْحَلَمَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2719 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a person in the state of ihram removes ticks from their camel, there is no harm in that, but they should not remove lice."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2720 - In the narration of Hariz from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
"Ticks are not considered part of the camel, but lice are considered part of the camel."
arabicText: 2720 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِنَّ اَلْقُرَادَ لَيْسَ مِنَ اَلْبَعِيرِ وَ اَلْحَلَمَةَ مِنَ اَلْبَعِيرِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2720 - In the narration of Hariz from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Ticks are not considered part of the camel, but lice are considered part of the camel."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2721 - In the narration of Ali ibn Abi Hamzah from Abu Basir, he said: I asked him about a person in the state of ihram removing lice from a camel.
Imam (as) said: "No, it is like the lice from your own body."
arabicText: 2721 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يَنْزِعُ اَلْحَلَمَةَ عَنِ اَلْبَعِيرِ فَقَالَ «لاَ هِيَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ اَلْقَمْلَةِ مِنْ جَسَدِكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2721 - In the narration of Ali ibn Abi Hamzah from Abu Basir, he said: I asked him about a person in the state of ihram removing lice from a camel.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "No, it is like the lice from your own body."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Permissible and Impermissible for the Muhrim to Do and Use of All Types
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2722 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl narrated from Abu al-Hasan (as), who said: I asked him about what a person in the state of ihram is permitted to kill from among the creatures.
Imam (as) said: "They may kill black snakes, vipers, mice, scorpions, and any snake. If a predatory animal attacks you, kill it; but if it does not attack, do not kill it. As for a rabid dog, if it attacks you, kill it. There is no harm for a person in ihram to throw stones at a kite. If robbers confront them, they may defend themselves."
arabicText: 2722 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ وَ مَا يَقْتُلُ مِنَ اَلدَّوَابِّ قَالَ «يَقْتُلُ اَلْأَسْوَدَ وَ اَلْأَفْعَى وَ اَلْفَأْرَةَ وَ اَلْعَقْرَبَ وَ كُلَّ حَيَّةٍ وَ إِنْ أَرَادَكَ اَلسَّبُعُ فَاقْتُلْهُ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يُرِدْكَ فَلاَ تَقْتُلْهُ وَ اَلْكَلْبُ اَلْعَقُورُ إِنْ أَرَادَكَ فَاقْتُلْهُ وَ لاَ بَأْسَ لِلْمُحْرِمِ أَنْ يَرْمِيَ اَلْحِدَأَةَ وَ إِنْ عَرَضَ لَهُ اَللُّصُوصُ اِمْتَنَعَ مِنْهُمْ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2722 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl narrated from Abu al-Hasan (as), who said: I asked him about what a person in the state of ihram is permitted to kill from among the creatures.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They may kill black snakes, vipers, mice, scorpions, and any snake. If a predatory animal attacks you, kill it; but if it does not attack, do not kill it. As for a rabid dog, if it attacks you, kill it. There is no harm for a person in ihram to throw stones at a kite. If robbers confront them, they may defend themselves."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2723 - Jamil narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim and Zurara, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a person in the state of ihram who killed an ostrich.
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a camel. If they cannot find one, they must feed sixty needy people. If the value of the camel exceeds the cost of feeding sixty needy people, they do not need to provide more than the feeding of sixty needy people. If the value of the camel is less than the cost of feeding sixty needy people, they are only required to pay the value of the camel."
arabicText: 2723 - رَوَى جَمِيلٌ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ وَ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي مُحْرِمٍ قَتَلَ نَعَامَةً قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ فَإِطْعَامُ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِيناً فَإِنْ كَانَتْ قِيمَةُ اَلْبَدَنَةِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ إِطْعَامِ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِيناً لَمْ يَزِدْ عَلَى إِطْعَامِ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِيناً وَ إِنْ كَانَتْ قِيمَةُ اَلْبَدَنَةِ أَقَلَّ مِنْ إِطْعَامِ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِيناً لَمْ يَكُنْ عَلَيْهِ إِلاَّ قِيمَةُ اَلْبَدَنَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2723 - Jamil narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim and Zurara, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a person in the state of ihram who killed an ostrich.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They must offer a camel. If they cannot find one, they must feed sixty needy people. If the value of the camel exceeds the cost of feeding sixty needy people, they do not need to provide more than the feeding of sixty needy people. If the value of the camel is less than the cost of feeding sixty needy people, they are only required to pay the value of the camel."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2724 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Dawud al-Raqqi, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man upon whom a camel is obligatory as expiation.
Imam (as) said: "If he cannot find a camel, then seven sheep. If he cannot afford that, he should fast for eighteen days, either in Mecca or at his place of residence."
arabicText: 2724 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ اَلرَّقِّيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ وَاجِبَةٌ فِي فِدَاءٍ فَقَالَ «إِذَا لَمْ يَجِدْ فَسَبْعُ شِيَاهٍ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ صَامَ ثَمَانِيَةَ عَشَرَ يَوْماً ، بِمَكَّةَ أَوْ فِي مَنْزِلِهِ
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2724 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Dawud al-Raqqi, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man upon whom a camel is obligatory as expiation.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he cannot find a camel, then seven sheep. If he cannot afford that, he should fast for eighteen days, either in Mecca or at his place of residence."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2725 - Abdullah ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram who hunted an ostrich or a wild donkey.
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a camel."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford it?"
Imam (as) said: "They should feed sixty needy people."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford to feed anyone?"
Imam (as) said: "They must fast for eighteen days."
I then asked: "What if they hunted a cow?"
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a cow."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford it?"
Imam (as) said: "They should feed thirty needy people."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford to feed anyone?"
Imam (as) said: "They must fast for nine days."
I then asked: "What if they hunted a gazelle?"
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a sheep."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford it?"
Imam (as) said: "They must feed ten needy people."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford to feed anyone?"
Imam (as) said: "They must fast for three days."
arabicText: 2725 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ مُحْرِمٍ أَصَابَ نَعَامَةً أَوْ حِمَارَ وَحْشٍ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ قَالَ «يُطْعِمُ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِيناً» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى مَا يَتَصَدَّقُ بِهِ مَا عَلَيْهِ قَالَ «فَلْيَصُمْ ثَمَانِيَةَ عَشَرَ يَوْماً» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ أَصَابَ بَقَرَةً مَا عَلَيْهِ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ بَقَرَةٌ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ قَالَ «فَلْيُطْعِمْ ثَلاَثِينَ مِسْكِيناً» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَقْدِرْ عَلَى مَا يَتَصَدَّقُ بِهِ قَالَ «فَلْيَصُمْ تِسْعَةَ أَيَّامٍ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ أَصَابَ ظَبْياً مَا عَلَيْهِ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ شَاةٌ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ قَالَ «فَعَلَيْهِ إِطْعَامُ عَشَرَةِ مَسَاكِينَ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ مَا يَتَصَدَّقُ بِهِ قَالَ «فَعَلَيْهِ صِيَامُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2725 - Abdullah ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram who hunted an ostrich or a wild donkey.
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a camel."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford it?"
Imam (as) said: "They should feed sixty needy people."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford to feed anyone?"
Imam (as) said: "They must fast for eighteen days."
I then asked: "What if they hunted a cow?"
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a cow."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford it?"
Imam (as) said: "They should feed thirty needy people."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford to feed anyone?"
Imam (as) said: "They must fast for nine days."
I then asked: "What if they hunted a gazelle?"
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a sheep."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford it?"
Imam (as) said: "They must feed ten needy people."
I asked: "What if they cannot afford to feed anyone?"
Imam (as) said: "They must fast for three days."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2726 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man in the state of ihram who shot at game, breaking its leg or hand, and it ran off so that he did not know what happened to it.
Imam (as) said: "He must pay its full expiation."
I asked: "What if he later sees it grazing and walking?"
Imam (as) said: "He must pay a quarter of its value."
arabicText: 2726 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ رَمَى صَيْداً وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَكَسَرَ يَدَهُ أَوْ رِجْلَهُ فَذَهَبَ عَلَى وَجْهِهِ فَلاَ يَدْرِي مَا صَنَعَ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ فِدَاؤُهُ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ رَآهُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ قَدْ رَعَى وَ مَشَى قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ رُبُعُ قِيمَتِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2726 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man in the state of ihram who shot at game, breaking its leg or hand, and it ran off so that he did not know what happened to it.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He must pay its full expiation."
I asked: "What if he later sees it grazing and walking?"
Imam (as) said: "He must pay a quarter of its value."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2727 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Abu al-Hasan (as), who said: I asked him about a person in the state of ihram who hunted a rabbit or a fox.
Imam (as) said: "For the rabbit, the expiation is the sacrifice of a sheep."
arabicText: 2727 - وَ رَوَى اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ مُحْرِمٍ أَصَابَ أَرْنَباً أَوْ ثَعْلَباً قَالَ «فِي اَلْأَرْنَبِ دَمُ شَاةٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2727 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Abu al-Hasan (as), who said: I asked him about a person in the state of ihram who hunted a rabbit or a fox.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "For the rabbit, the expiation is the sacrifice of a sheep."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2728 - In the narration of Ibn Muskan from al-Halabi, he said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a rabbit hunted by a person in the state of ihram.
Imam (as) said: "A sheep must be offered as a sacrifice, to be delivered to the Kaaba."
arabicText: 2728 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اِبْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْأَرْنَبِ يُصِيبُهُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ فَقَالَ «شَاةٌ هَدْياً بَالِغَ اَلْكَعْبَةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2728 - In the narration of Ibn Muskan from al-Halabi, he said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a rabbit hunted by a person in the state of ihram.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "A sheep must be offered as a sacrifice, to be delivered to the Kaaba."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2729 - In the narration of Al-Bazanti from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Abu Basir, he said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram who killed a fox.
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a blood sacrifice."
I asked: "What about a rabbit?"
Imam (as) said: "The same as for the fox."
arabicText: 2729 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلْبَزَنْطِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ فَقَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ مُحْرِمٍ قَتَلَ ثَعْلَباً قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ دَمٌ» فَقُلْتُ فَأَرْنَباً فَقَالَ «مِثْلُ مَا فِي اَلثَّعْلَبِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2729 - In the narration of Al-Bazanti from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, from Abu Basir, he said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person in the state of ihram who killed a fox.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a blood sacrifice."
I asked: "What about a rabbit?"
Imam (as) said: "The same as for the fox."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2730 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl narrated: I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who killed a pigeon from the pigeons of the Sacred Sanctuary while he was in the state of ihram.
Imam (as) said: "If he killed it while he was in the state of ihram and in the Haram, he must offer a sheep, and the value of the pigeon is one dirham. If he killed it in the Haram while not in the state of ihram, he must pay its value, which is one dirham, to be given as charity or used to buy food for the pigeons of the Haram. If he killed it while in the state of ihram but outside the Haram, he must offer the sacrifice of a sheep."
arabicText: 2730 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْفُضَيْلِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَتَلَ حَمَامَةً مِنْ حَمَامِ اَلْحَرَمِ وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فَقَالَ «إِنْ قَتَلَهَا وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فِي اَلْحَرَمِ فَعَلَيْهِ شَاةٌ وَ قِيمَةُ اَلْحَمَامَةِ دِرْهَمٌ وَ إِنْ قَتَلَهَا فِي اَلْحَرَمِ وَ هُوَ غَيْرُ مُحْرِمٍ فَعَلَيْهِ قِيمَتُهَا وَ هُوَ دِرْهَمٌ يَتَصَدَّقُ بِهِ أَوْ يَشْتَرِي بِهِ طَعَاماً لِحَمَامِ اَلْحَرَمِ وَ إِنْ قَتَلَهَا وَ هُوَ مُحْرِمٌ فِي غَيْرِ اَلْحَرَمِ فَعَلَيْهِ دَمُ شَاةٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2730 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl narrated: I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who killed a pigeon from the pigeons of the Sacred Sanctuary while he was in the state of ihram.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he killed it while he was in the state of ihram and in the Haram, he must offer a sheep, and the value of the pigeon is one dirham. If he killed it in the Haram while not in the state of ihram, he must pay its value, which is one dirham, to be given as charity or used to buy food for the pigeons of the Haram. If he killed it while in the state of ihram but outside the Haram, he must offer the sacrifice of a sheep."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2731 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Whatever you step on or your camel steps on while you are in the state of ihram, you must pay its expiation."
arabicText: 2731 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «مَا وَطِئْتَ أَوْ وَطِئَهُ بَعِيرُكَ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ فَعَلَيْكَ فِدَاؤُهُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2731 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whatever you step on or your camel steps on while you are in the state of ihram, you must pay its expiation."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2732 - Abu Ja'far (as) passed by a group of people eating locusts and said: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! And you are in the state of ihram?"
They said, "It is from the sea."
Imam (as) replied: "Then return it to the water."
arabicText: 2732 - : وَ مَرَّ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَلَى اَلنَّاسِ وَ هُمْ يَأْكُلُونَ جَرَاداً فَقَالَ «سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ وَ أَنْتُمْ مُحْرِمُونَ» قَالُوا إِنَّمَا هُوَ مِنَ اَلْبَحْرِ قَالَ «فَارْمُسُوهُ فِي اَلْمَاءِ إِذَنْ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2732 - Abu Ja'far (as) passed by a group of people eating locusts and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Glory be to Allah (swt)! And you are in the state of ihram?"
They said, "It is from the sea."
Imam (as) replied: "Then return it to the water."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2733 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about a person in the state of ihram who hunts game and pays its expiation: Should they eat it or discard it?
Imam (as) said: "If they eat it, then another expiation becomes obligatory upon them."
They asked: "What should they do with it then?"
Imam (as) replied: "They should bury it."
arabicText: 2733 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمُحْرِمِ يُصِيبُ اَلصَّيْدَ فَيَفْدِيهِ يَطْعَمُهُ أَوْ يَطْرَحُهُ قَالَ «إِذاً يَكُونَ عَلَيْهِ فِدَاءٌ آخَرُ» قِيلَ فَأَيَّ شَيْءٍ يَصْنَعُ بِهِ قَالَ «يَدْفِنُهُ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2734 - Abu Ja'far al-Thani, Imam Muhammad al-Jawad (as) said:
"Slaughtering the game, eating it, and paying the expiation is more beloved to me than eating carrion."
arabicText: 2734 - أَنَّ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلثَّانِيَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «يَذْبَحُ اَلصَّيْدَ وَ يَأْكُلُهُ وَ يَفْدِي أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنَ اَلْمَيْتَةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2734 - Abu Ja'far al-Thani, Imam Muhammad al-Jawad (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Slaughtering the game, eating it, and paying the expiation is more beloved to me than eating carrion."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2735 - Yusuf al-Tatari narrated: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "What is the ruling if a group of people in the state of ihram eat game?"
Imam (as) said: "Each of them must offer a sheep, and the one who slaughtered it is only required to offer one sheep."
arabicText: 2735 - وَ رَوَى يُوسُفُ اَلطَّاطَرِيُّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ صَيْدٌ أَكَلَهُ قَوْمٌ مُحْرِمُونَ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِمْ شَاةٌ شَاةٌ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَى اَلَّذِي ذَبَحَهُ إِلاَّ شَاةٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2735 - Yusuf al-Tatari narrated: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "What is the ruling if a group of people in the state of ihram eat game?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Each of them must offer a sheep, and the one who slaughtered it is only required to offer one sheep."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2736 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Aban ibn Taghlib, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a group of pilgrims in the state of ihram who hunted and ate ostrich chicks together.
Imam (as) said: "For each chick they ate, they must collectively offer a camel. They should purchase a camel for each chick based on the number of chicks and the number of people involved."
arabicText: 2736 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ تَغْلِبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْمٍ حُجَّاجٍ مُحْرِمِينَ أَصَابُوا أَفْرَاخَ نَعَامٍ فَأَكَلُوا جَمِيعاً قَالَ «عَلَيْهِمْ مَكَانَ كُلِّ فَرْخٍ أَكَلُوهُ بَدَنَةٌ يَشْتَرِكُونَ فِيهَا جَمِيعاً فَيَشْتَرُونَهَا عَلَى عَدَدِ اَلْفِرَاخِ وَ عَلَى عَدَدِ اَلرِّجَالِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2736 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Aban ibn Taghlib, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a group of pilgrims in the state of ihram who hunted and ate ostrich chicks together.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "For each chick they ate, they must collectively offer a camel. They should purchase a camel for each chick based on the number of chicks and the number of people involved."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2737 - Zurara and Bukayr narrated from one of the Imams (as) regarding two people in the state of ihram who hunted game.
Imam (as) said: "Each of them must individually pay the expiation."
arabicText: 2737 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ وَ بُكَيْرٌ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي مُحْرِمَيْنِ أَصَابَا صَيْداً فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «عَلَى كُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمَا اَلْفِدَاءُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2737 - Zurara and Bukayr narrated from one of the Imams (as) regarding two people in the state of ihram who hunted game.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Each of them must individually pay the expiation."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2738 - Abu Basir asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a group of people in the state of ihram who purchased game and shared it among themselves. A woman who was their companion said, "Give me a portion of it for one dirham," and they did so.
Imam (as) said: "Each of them must offer a sheep as expiation."
arabicText: 2738 - وَ سَأَلَ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَوْمٍ مُحْرِمِينَ اِشْتَرَوْا صَيْداً فَاشْتَرَكُوا فِيهِ فَقَالَتِ اِمْرَأَةٌ رَفِيقَةٌ لَهُمُ اِجْعَلُوا لِي مِنْهُ بِدِرْهَمٍ فَجَعَلُوا لَهَا فَقَالَ «عَلَى كُلِّ إِنْسَانٍ مِنْهُمْ شَاةٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2738 - Abu Basir asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a group of people in the state of ihram who purchased game and shared it among themselves. A woman who was their companion said, "Give me a portion of it for one dirham," and they did so.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Each of them must offer a sheep as expiation."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2739 - Allah (swt), the Exalted, says: "Lawful to you is the game of the sea and its food as provision for you and for travelers" (Surah Al-Ma'idah 5:96).
Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "Its 'food' refers to salted fish that you eat."
Imam (as) also said: "The distinction between them is as follows: any bird that resides in thickets, lays its eggs on land, and hatches its young on land is considered land game. Any bird that resides on land but lays its eggs in the sea and hatches its young in the sea is considered sea game."
arabicText: 2739 - وَ قَالَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ، «۝ أُحِلَّ لَكُمْ صَيْدُ اَلْبَحْرِ وَ طَعٰامُهُ مَتٰاعاً لَكُمْ وَ لِلسَّيّٰارَةِ ۝» وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «هُوَ مَلِيحُهُ اَلَّذِي تَأْكُلُونَ» وَ قَالَ «فَصْلُ مَا بَيْنَهُمَا كُلُّ طَيْرٍ يَكُونُ فِي اَلْآجَامِ يَبِيضُ فِي اَلْبَرِّ وَ يُفْرِخُ فِي اَلْبَرِّ فَهُوَ صَيْدُ اَلْبَرِّ وَ مَا كَانَ مِنْ طَيْرٍ يَكُونُ فِي اَلْبَرِّ وَ يَبِيضُ فِي اَلْبَحْرِ وَ يُفْرِخُ فِي اَلْبَحْرِ فَهُوَ مِنْ صَيْدِ اَلْبَحْرِ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Obligatory on the Muhrim for the Various Types of Game He Injures
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2740 - A person in the state of ihram must not guide others to game. If they do guide someone to game and it is killed, they are obligated to pay the expiation.
arabicText: 2740 - وَ اَلْمُحْرِمُ لاَ يَدُلُّ عَلَى اَلصَّيْدِ فَإِنْ دَلَّ عَلَيْهِ فَقُتِلَ فَعَلَيْهِ اَلْفِدَاءُ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2741 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"When you have completed your sa’i (ritual walking) and you are performing tamattu' (Hajj), trim the hair from the sides of your head, your beard, and your mustache, and clip your nails, leaving some for your Hajj. When you do this, you are released from all the restrictions of ihram, just as a person who has exited ihram. Then, perform as many voluntary tawaf (circuits around the Kaaba) as you wish."
arabicText: 2741 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا فَرَغْتَ مِنْ سَعْيِكَ وَ أَنْتَ مُتَمَتِّعٌ فَقَصِّرْ مِنْ شَعْرِ رَأْسِكَ مِنْ جَوَانِبِهِ وَ لِحْيَتِكَ وَ خُذْ مِنْ شَارِبِكَ وَ قَلِّمْ أَظْفَارَكَ وَ أَبْقِ مِنْهَا لِحَجِّكَ فَإِذَا فَعَلْتَ ذَلِكَ فَقَدْ أَحْلَلْتَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ يَحِلُّ مِنْهُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ فَطُفْ بِالْبَيْتِ تَطَوُّعاً مَا شِئْتَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2741 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When you have completed your sa’i (ritual walking) and you are performing tamattu' (Hajj), trim the hair from the sides of your head, your beard, and your mustache, and clip your nails, leaving some for your Hajj. When you do this, you are released from all the restrictions of ihram, just as a person who has exited ihram. Then, perform as many voluntary tawaf (circuits around the Kaaba) as you wish."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2742 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Ibrahim (as): I asked him about a man performing tamattu‘ (Hajj) who forgets to trim his hair until he has already entered the state of ihram for Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sacrifice."
In another narration, Abdullah ibn Sinan reported from Abu Abdullah (as):
"He should seek forgiveness from Allah (swt), the Exalted."
arabicText:
2742 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَتَمَتَّعُ فَيَنْسَى أَنْ يُقَصِّرَ حَتَّى يُهِلَّ بِالْحَجِّ فَقَالَ «عَلَيْهِ دَمٌ».
وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «يَسْتَغْفِرُ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2742 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Ibrahim (as): I asked him about a man performing tamattu‘ (Hajj) who forgets to trim his hair until he has already entered the state of ihram for Hajj.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"He must offer a sacrifice."
In another narration, Abdullah ibn Sinan reported from Abu Abdullah (as):
"He should seek forgiveness from Allah (swt), the Exalted."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2743 - Imran al-Halabi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who performed tawaf of the Kaaba and the sa'i between Safa and Marwa while performing tamattu‘, then hastened and kissed his wife before trimming his hair.
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sacrifice of a sheep. If he engaged in intercourse, he must offer a camel or a cow."
arabicText: 2743 - وَ سَأَلَ عِمْرَانُ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ طَافَ بِالْبَيْتِ وَ بِالصَّفَا وَ اَلْمَرْوَةِ وَ قَدْ تَمَتَّعَ ثُمَّ عَجَّلَ فَقَبَّلَ اِمْرَأَتَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُقَصِّرَ مِنْ رَأْسِهِ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ دَمٌ يُهَرِيقُهُ وَ إِنْ جَامَعَ فَعَلَيْهِ جَزُورٌ أَوْ بَقَرَةٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2743 - Imran al-Halabi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who performed tawaf of the Kaaba and the sa'i between Safa and Marwa while performing tamattu‘, then hastened and kissed his wife before trimming his hair.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sacrifice of a sheep. If he engaged in intercourse, he must offer a camel or a cow."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2744 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man performing tamattu‘ who tied up his hair before arriving in Mecca. He completed his rites, untied his hair, trimmed it, applied oil, and considered himself released from ihram.
Imam (as) said: "He must offer a sheep as expiation."
arabicText: 2744 - وَ سَأَلَ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَقَصَ رَأْسَهُ وَ هُوَ مُتَمَتِّعٌ فَقَدِمَ مَكَّةَ فَقَضَى نُسُكَهُ وَ حَلَّ عِقَاصَ رَأْسِهِ وَ قَصَّرَ وَ اِدَّهَنَ وَ أَحَلَّ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ دَمُ شَاةٍ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2744 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man performing tamattu‘ who tied up his hair before arriving in Mecca. He completed his rites, untied his hair, trimmed it, applied oil, and considered himself released from ihram.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "He must offer a sheep as expiation."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2745 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man performing tamattu‘ who had intercourse with his wife before trimming his hair.
Imam (as) said: "He must slaughter a camel. I fear that his Hajj may be invalid if he acted knowingly. However, if he acted out of ignorance, there is no penalty upon him."
Mu'awiyah also said: I asked him about a person performing tamattu‘ who bites their nails with their teeth or trims their hair using a sharp-edged tool.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it. Not everyone has access to scissors."
arabicText: 2745 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ مُتَمَتِّعٍ وَقَعَ عَلَى اِمْرَأَتِهِ وَ لَمْ يُقَصِّرْ قَالَ «يَنْحَرُ جَزُوراً وَ قَدْ خَشِيتُ أَنْ يَكُونَ قَدْ ثُلِمَ حَجُّهُ إِنْ كَانَ عَالِماً وَ إِنْ كَانَ جَاهِلاً فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ» قَالَ وَ قُلْتُ لَهُ مُتَمَتِّعٌ قَرَضَ مِنْ أَظْفَارِهِ بِأَسْنَانِهِ وَ أَخَذَ مِنْ شَعْرِهِ بِمِشْقَصٍ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ لَيْسَ كُلُّ أَحَدٍ يَجِدُ اَلْجَلَمَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2745 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man performing tamattu‘ who had intercourse with his wife before trimming his hair.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He must slaughter a camel. I fear that his Hajj may be invalid if he acted knowingly. However, if he acted out of ignorance, there is no penalty upon him."
Mu'awiyah also said: I asked him about a person performing tamattu‘ who bites their nails with their teeth or trims their hair using a sharp-edged tool.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it. Not everyone has access to scissors."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2746 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as): I asked him about a person performing tamattu‘ who intended to trim their hair but instead shaved their head.
Imam (as) said: "They must offer a sheep as expiation. On the Day of Sacrifice (Yawm al-Nahr), they should pass a razor over their head when they intend to shave."
arabicText: 2746 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ مُتَمَتِّعٍ أَرَادَ أَنْ يُقَصِّرَ فَحَلَقَ رَأْسَهُ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ دَمٌ يُهَرِيقُهُ فَإِذَا كَانَ يَوْمُ اَلنَّحْرِ أَمَرَّ اَلْمُوسَى عَلَى رَأْسِهِ حِينَ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَحْلِقَ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2746 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as): I asked him about a person performing tamattu‘ who intended to trim their hair but instead shaved their head.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "They must offer a sheep as expiation. On the Day of Sacrifice (Yawm al-Nahr), they should pass a razor over their head when they intend to shave."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2747 - Abu al-Maghra’ narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I said to Abu Ja‘far (as):
"A man exits his state of ihram, but his wife has not yet exited hers, and he has intercourse with her."
Imam (as) said: "She must offer a camel as expiation, and her husband is responsible for providing it."
arabicText: 2747 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو اَلْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ أَحَلَّ مِنْ إِحْرَامِهِ وَ لَمْ تَحِلَّ اِمْرَأَتُهُ فَوَقَعَ عَلَيْهَا قَالَ «عَلَيْهَا بَدَنَةٌ يَغْرَمُهَا زَوْجُهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2747 - Abu al-Maghra’ narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I said to Abu Ja‘far (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"A man exits his state of ihram, but his wife has not yet exited hers, and he has intercourse with her."
Imam (as) said: "She must offer a camel as expiation, and her husband is responsible for providing it."

chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2748 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "It is appropriate for a person performing tamattu‘ ('Umrah followed by Hajj) when they exit ihram not to wear a shirt and to resemble those who are still in the state of ihram."
arabicText: 2748 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «يَنْبَغِي لِلْمُتَمَتِّعِ «بِالْعُمْرَةِ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ» إِذَا أَحَلَّ أَنْ لاَ يَلْبَسَ قَمِيصاً وَ أَنْ يَتَشَبَّهَ بِالْمُحْرِمِينَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2748 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is appropriate for a person performing tamattu‘ ('Umrah followed by Hajj) when they exit ihram not to wear a shirt and to resemble those who are still in the state of ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2749 - Hafs, Jamil, and others narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a person in the state of ihram who trims some of their hair but not all of it.
Imam (as) said: "It suffices."
arabicText: 2749 - وَ رَوَى حَفْصٌ وَ جَمِيلٌ وَ غَيْرُهُمَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي مُحْرِمٍ يُقَصِّرُ مِنْ بَعْضٍ وَ لاَ يُقَصِّرُ مِنْ بَعْضٍ قَالَ «يُجْزِيهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2749 - Hafs, Jamil, and others narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a person in the state of ihram who trims some of their hair but not all of it.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "It suffices."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2750 - Jamil ibn Darraj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person performing tamattu‘ who shaved their head in Mecca.
Imam (as) said: "If it was done out of ignorance, there is no penalty upon them. If they intentionally did so during the first thirty days of the months of Hajj, there is also no penalty. However, if they intentionally did so after the thirty days, during which the hair is to be preserved for Hajj, they must offer a blood sacrifice."
arabicText: 2750 - وَ سَأَلَهُ جَمِيلُ بْنُ دَرَّاجٍ: عَنْ مُتَمَتِّعٍ حَلَقَ رَأْسَهُ بِمَكَّةَ فَقَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ جَاهِلاً فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ فَإِنْ تَعَمَّدَ ذَلِكَ فِي أَوَّلِ شُهُورِ اَلْحَجِّ بِثَلاَثِينَ يَوْماً فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ وَ إِنْ تَعَمَّدَ ذَلِكَ بَعْدَ اَلثَّلاَثِينَ اَلَّتِي يُوَفَّرُ فِيهَا اَلشَّعْرُ لِلْحَجِّ فَإِنَّ عَلَيْهِ دَماً يُهَرِيقُهُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2750 - Jamil ibn Darraj asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a person performing tamattu‘ who shaved their head in Mecca.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If it was done out of ignorance, there is no penalty upon them. If they intentionally did so during the first thirty days of the months of Hajj, there is also no penalty. However, if they intentionally did so after the thirty days, during which the hair is to be preserved for Hajj, they must offer a blood sacrifice."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Trimming or Shaving for the mutamatti‘, His Release From Ihram, and the Rulings for One Who Forgets to Trim Until He Engages in Intimacy or Commences the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2751 - It is narrated from Hammad ibn Uthman, who said: A man said to Imam Abu Abdullah (as), "May I be your ransom! After completing my rituals for ‘Umrah, I went to my wife but had not trimmed my hair."
Imam (as) said: "You must offer a camel as expiation."
The man then said: "When I attempted this with her, and she had not trimmed her hair either, she resisted. When I overpowered her, she bit off some of her hair with her teeth."
Imam (as) said: "May Allah (swt) have mercy on her. She was more understanding of the matter than you. You must offer a camel as expiation, but nothing is required of her."
arabicText: 2751 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ قَالَ : قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنِّي لَمَّا قَضَيْتُ نُسُكِي لِلْعُمْرَةِ أَتَيْتُ أَهْلِي وَ لَمْ أُقَصِّرْ قَالَ «عَلَيْكَ بَدَنَةٌ» قَالَفَإِنِّي لَمَّا أَرَدْتُ ذَلِكَ مِنْهَا وَ لَمْ تَكُنْ قَصَّرَتْ اِمْتَنَعَتْ فَلَمَّا غَلَبْتُهَا قَرَضَتْ بَعْضَ شَعْرِهَا بِأَسْنَانِهَا قَالَ «رَحِمَهَا اَللَّهُ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ أَفْقَهَ مِنْكَ عَلَيْكَ بَدَنَةٌ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا شَيْءٌ.».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2751 - It is narrated from Hammad ibn Uthman, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
A man said to Imam Abu Abdullah (as), "May I be your ransom! After completing my rituals for ‘Umrah, I went to my wife but had not trimmed my hair."
Imam (as) said: "You must offer a camel as expiation."
The man then said: "When I attempted this with her, and she had not trimmed her hair either, she resisted. When I overpowered her, she bit off some of her hair with her teeth."
Imam (as) said: "May Allah (swt) have mercy on her. She was more understanding of the matter than you. You must offer a camel as expiation, but nothing is required of her."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the mutamatti‘ Leaving Mecca and Returning
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
