arabicText: 2882 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ ضُرَيْسٍ اَلْكُنَاسِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَلَيْهِ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ نَذَرَ نَذْراً فِي شُكْرٍ لَيُحِجَّنَّ بِهِ رَجُلاً إِلَى مَكَّةَ فَمَاتَ اَلَّذِي نَذَرَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَحُجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَفِيَ بِنَذْرِهِ اَلَّذِي نَذَرَ قَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ تَرَكَ مَالاً يُحَجُّ عَنْهُ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ مِنْ جَمِيعِ اَلْمَالِ وَ أُخْرِجَ مِنْ ثُلُثِهِ مَا يَحُجُّ بِهِ رَجُلٌ لِنَذْرِهِ وَ قَدْ وَفَى بِالنَّذْرِ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ تَرَكَ مَالاً إِلاَّ بِقَدْرِ مَا يُحَجُّ بِهِ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ حُجَّ عَنْهُ بِمَا تَرَكَ وَ يَحُجُّ عَنْهُ وَلِيُّهُ حَجَّةَ اَلنَّذْرِ إِنَّمَا هُوَ مِثْلُ دَيْنٍ عَلَيْهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2882 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Durays al-Kunasi, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a man who was obligated to perform the Hajj of Islam but made a vow of gratitude to send another man to perform Hajj to Mecca on his behalf. The man died before performing the Hajj of Islam and before fulfilling the vow he had made.
Imam (as) said: "If he left wealth, the Hajj of Islam should be performed on his behalf from his entire estate, and from one-third of his estate, funds should be allocated to send a man to fulfill the vow he made. In this way, the vow will have been fulfilled. However, if he left only enough wealth for the Hajj of Islam, it should be used for that purpose, and his heir should perform the Hajj of the vow on his behalf, as the vow is akin to a debt upon him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Narrated Regarding Performing Hajj Before Gaining Knowledge
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2883 - Umar ibn Udhaynah narrated:
I wrote to Abu Abdullah (as) asking about a man who performed Hajj without knowing or recognizing this [truthful] matter. Then Allah (swt) blessed him with understanding and adherence to it. Is the Hajj of Islam still obligatory upon him?
Imam (as) replied: "He has fulfilled the obligation of Allah (swt), the Exalted, but performing Hajj again is more beloved to me."
arabicText: 2883 - رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ أُذَيْنَةَ قَالَ : كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَسْأَلُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ حَجَّ وَ لاَ يَدْرِي وَ لاَ يَعْرِفُ هَذَا اَلْأَمْرَ ثُمَّ مَنَّ اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ بِمَعْرِفَتِهِ وَ اَلدَّيْنُونَةِ بِهِ أَ عَلَيْهِ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ قَالَ «قَدْ قَضَى فَرِيضَةَ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ اَلْحَجُّ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2883 - Umar ibn Udhaynah narrated:
I wrote to Abu Abdullah (as) asking about a man who performed Hajj without knowing or recognizing this [truthful] matter. Then Allah (swt) blessed him with understanding and adherence to it. Is the Hajj of Islam still obligatory upon him?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He has fulfilled the obligation of Allah (swt), the Exalted, but performing Hajj again is more beloved to me."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Narrated Regarding Performing Hajj Before Gaining Knowledge
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2884 - It was narrated from Abu Abdullah al-Khurasani, from Abu Ja'far al-Thani, Imam Muhammad al-Jawad (as), who said:
I said to him: "I performed Hajj while I was a dissenter, and now I have performed this Hajj after Allah (swt), the Exalted, has blessed me with the knowledge of you (Ahlulbayt). I have come to know that what I was upon was false. What is your view of my previous Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Make this [current] Hajj the Hajj of Islam, and consider the previous one as a supererogatory (nafl) Hajj."
arabicText: 2884 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ اَلْخُرَاسَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ إِنِّي حَجَجْتُ وَ أَنَا مُخَالِفٌ وَ حَجَجْتُ حَجَّتِي هَذِهِ وَ قَدْ مَنَّ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَيَّ بِمَعْرِفَتِكُمْ وَ عَلِمْتُ أَنَّ اَلَّذِي كُنْتُ فِيهِ كَانَ بَاطِلاً فَمَا تَرَى فِي حَجَّتِي قَالَ «اِجْعَلْ هَذِهِ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ تِلْكَ نَافِلَةً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2884 - It was narrated from Abu Abdullah al-Khurasani, from Abu Ja'far al-Thani, Imam Muhammad al-Jawad (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to him: "I performed Hajj while I was a dissenter, and now I have performed this Hajj after Allah (swt), the Exalted, has blessed me with the knowledge of you (Ahlulbayt). I have come to know that what I was upon was false. What is your view of my previous Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Make this [current] Hajj the Hajj of Islam, and consider the previous one as a supererogatory (nafl) Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Narrated Regarding the Hajj of One Passing Through
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2885 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A man passes through on his way to Yemen or another city, and his route takes him through Mecca. He finds people preparing to go out for Hajj, so he joins them and performs the rites. Does this suffice as the Hajj of Islam for him?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes."
arabicText: 2885 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَمُرُّ مُجْتَازاً يُرِيدُ اَلْيَمَنَ أَوْ غَيْرَهَا مِنَ اَلْبُلْدَانِ وَ طَرِيقُهُ بِمَكَّةَ فَيُدْرِكُ اَلنَّاسَ وَ هُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ فَيَخْرُجُ مَعَهُمْ إِلَى اَلْمَشَاهِدِ أَ يُجْزِيهِ ذَلِكَ عَنْ حَجَّةِ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of the Male and Female Slave
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2886 - Hariz narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Whatever a servant in the state of Ihram incurs during their Ihram is the responsibility of the master if the master gave permission for the Ihram."
arabicText: 2886 - رَوَى حَرِيزٌ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «كُلَّمَا أَصَابَ اَلْعَبْدُ اَلْمُحْرِمُ فِي إِحْرَامِهِ فَهُوَ عَلَى اَلسَّيِّدِ إِذَا أَذِنَ لَهُ فِي اَلْإِحْرَامِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2886 - Hariz narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whatever a servant in the state of Ihram incurs during their Ihram is the responsibility of the master if the master gave permission for the Ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of the Male and Female Slave
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2887 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Fadl ibn Yunus, who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as): "I have female servants with me in Mecca. Should I instruct them to enter into the state of Ihram for Hajj on the Day of Tarwiyah and take them out to witness the rites, or should I leave them behind in Mecca?"
Imam (as) said: "If you take them out with you, that is better. However, if you leave them behind with someone trustworthy, there is no harm in that. There is no obligation of Hajj or 'Umrah on a servant until they are freed."
arabicText: 2887 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ اَلْفَضْلِ بْنِ يُونُسَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقُلْتُ تَكُونُ عِنْدِي اَلْجَوَارِي وَ أَنَا بِمَكَّةَ فَآمُرُهُنَّ أَنْ يَعْقِدْنَ بِالْحَجِّ يَوْمَ اَلتَّرْوِيَةِ فَأَخْرُجُ بِهِنَّ فَيَشْهَدْنَ اَلْمَنَاسِكَ أَوْ أُخَلِّفُهُنَّ بِمَكَّةَ قَالَ فَقَالَ «إِنْ خَرَجْتَ بِهِنَّ فَهُوَ أَفْضَلُ وَ إِنْ خَلَّفْتَهُنَّ عِنْدَ ثِقَةٍ فَلاَ بَأْسَ فَلَيْسَ عَلَى اَلْمَمْلُوكِ حَجٌّ وَ لاَ عُمْرَةٌ حَتَّى يُعْتَقَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2887 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Al-Fadl ibn Yunus, who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as): "I have female servants with me in Mecca. Should I instruct them to enter into the state of Ihram for Hajj on the Day of Tarwiyah and take them out to witness the rites, or should I leave them behind in Mecca?"
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If you take them out with you, that is better. However, if you leave them behind with someone trustworthy, there is no harm in that. There is no obligation of Hajj or 'Umrah on a servant until they are freed."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of the Male and Female Slave
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2888 - Misma' ibn Abdul-Malik narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a servant performs ten Hajj pilgrimages, the Hajj of Islam is still obligatory upon them when they become capable of fulfilling it."
arabicText: 2888 - وَ رَوَى مِسْمَعُ بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلْمَلِكِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لَوْ أَنَّ عَبْداً حَجَّ عَشْرَ حِجَجٍ كَانَتْ عَلَيْهِ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ إِذَا اِسْتَطَاعَ إِلَى ذَلِكَ سَبِيلاً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2888 - Misma' ibn Abdul-Malik narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a servant performs ten Hajj pilgrimages, the Hajj of Islam is still obligatory upon them when they become capable of fulfilling it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of the Male and Female Slave
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2889 - In a narration from Al-Nadr, from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a servant performs Hajj while still in servitude, it suffices for them if they die before being freed. However, if they are freed, then Hajj becomes obligatory upon them."
arabicText: 2889 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلنَّضْرِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِنَّ اَلْمَمْلُوكَ إِنْ حَجَّ وَ هُوَ مَمْلُوكٌ أَجْزَأَهُ إِذَا مَاتَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُعْتَقَ وَ إِنْ أُعْتِقَ فَعَلَيْهِ اَلْحَجُّ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2889 - In a narration from Al-Nadr, from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a servant performs Hajj while still in servitude, it suffices for them if they die before being freed. However, if they are freed, then Hajj becomes obligatory upon them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of the Male and Female Slave
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2890 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated:
I asked Abu Ibrahim (as) about a concubine (umm walad) of a man whom he had sent for Hajj. "Does that suffice for her as the Hajj of Islam?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I asked: "Does she have any reward for her Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2890 - رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ أُمِّ وَلَدٍ تَكُونُ لِلرَّجُلِ قَدْ أَحَجَّهَا أَ يَجُوزُ ذَلِكَ عَنْهَا مِنْ حَجَّةِ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ قَالَ «لاَ» قُلْتُ لَهَا أَجْرٌ فِي حَجِّهَا قَالَ «نَعَمْ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2890 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ibrahim (as) about a concubine (umm walad) of a man whom he had sent for Hajj. "Does that suffice for her as the Hajj of Islam?"
Imam (as) said: "No."
I asked: "Does she have any reward for her Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Suffices for the Freed Person on the Eve of Arafah Regarding the Hajj of Islam
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2891 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Shihab, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who freed his servant on the eve of Arafah.
Imam (as) said: "The Hajj of Islam suffices for the servant, and the master is rewarded twice: once for the act of freeing the servant and once for the reward of the Hajj."
arabicText: 2891 - رَوَى اَلْحَسَنُ بْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ شِهَابٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَعْتَقَ عَشِيَّةَ عَرَفَةَ عَبْداً لَهُ قَالَ «يُجْزِي عَنِ اَلْعَبْدِ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ يُكْتَبُ لِلسَّيِّدِ أَجْرَانِ ثَوَابُ اَلْعِتْقِ وَ ثَوَابُ اَلْحَجِّ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2891 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Shihab, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who freed his servant on the eve of Arafah.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "The Hajj of Islam suffices for the servant, and the master is rewarded twice: once for the act of freeing the servant and once for the reward of the Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Suffices for the Freed Person on the Eve of Arafah Regarding the Hajj of Islam
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2892 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A servant was freed on the Day of Arafah."
Imam (as) said: "If he reaches one of the two stations (Arafah or Muzdalifah), then he has caught the Hajj."
arabicText: 2892 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مَمْلُوكٌ أُعْتِقَ يَوْمَ عَرَفَةَ قَالَ «إِذَا أَدْرَكَ أَحَدَ اَلْمَوْقِفَيْنِ فَقَدْ أَدْرَكَ اَلْحَجَّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2892 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A servant was freed on the Day of Arafah."
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he reaches one of the two stations (Arafah or Muzdalifah), then he has caught the Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2893 - Zurara narrated from one of the Imams (as), who said:
"If a man takes his young child for Hajj, he instructs him to recite the Talbiyah and obligates the Hajj upon him. If the child cannot recite the Talbiyah properly, the father recites it on his behalf. The child is carried for Tawaf, and prayers are performed on his behalf."
I asked: "What if they do not have the means to slaughter (an animal) on his behalf?"
Imam (as) said: "An animal is slaughtered for the children, while the adults fast. The same restrictions of Ihram regarding clothing and fragrance apply to the child. However, if the child kills game, the liability falls upon the father."
arabicText: 2893 - رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا حَجَّ اَلرَّجُلُ بِابْنِهِ وَ هُوَ صَغِيرٌ، فَإِنَّهُ يَأْمُرُهُ أَنْ يُلَبِّيَ وَ يَفْرِضَ اَلْحَجَّ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُحْسِنْ أَنْ يُلَبِّيَ لَبَّى عَنْهُ وَ يُطَافُ بِهِ وَ يُصَلَّى عَنْهُ » قُلْتُ لَيْسَ لَهُمْ مَا يَذْبَحُونَ عَنْهُ قَالَ «يُذْبَحُ عَنِ اَلصِّغَارِ وَ يَصُومُ اَلْكِبَارُ وَ يُتَّقَى عَلَيْهِمْ مَا يُتَّقَى عَلَى اَلْمُحْرِمِ مِنَ اَلثِّيَابِ وَ اَلطِّيبِ فَإِنْ قَتَلَ صَيْداً فَعَلَى أَبِيهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2893 - Zurara narrated from one of the Imams (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"If a man takes his young child for Hajj, he instructs him to recite the Talbiyah and obligates the Hajj upon him. If the child cannot recite the Talbiyah properly, the father recites it on his behalf. The child is carried for Tawaf, and prayers are performed on his behalf."
I asked: "What if they do not have the means to slaughter (an animal) on his behalf?"
Imam (as) said: "An animal is slaughtered for the children, while the adults fast. The same restrictions of Ihram regarding clothing and fragrance apply to the child. However, if the child kills game, the liability falls upon the father."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2894 - It was narrated from Ayyub, the brother of Udaym, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked: "From where are the children stripped (for Ihram)?"
Imam (as) said: "My father (as) used to strip them at Fakh."
arabicText: 2894 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ أَخِي أُدَيْمٍ قَالَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ مِنْ أَيْنَ يُجَرَّدُ اَلصِّبْيَانُ فَقَالَ «كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُجَرِّدُهُمْ مِنْ فَخٍّ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2894 - It was narrated from Ayyub, the brother of Udaym, who said:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked: "From where are the children stripped (for Ihram)?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "My father (as) used to strip them at Fakh."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2895 - It was narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, from his father, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I have young children with me, and I fear the cold for them. From where should they enter the state of Ihram?"
Imam (as) said: "Take them to Al-‘Arj, and let them enter Ihram from there, for when you reach Al-‘Arj, you will have entered Tihamah."
Then Imam (as) added: "If you still fear for them, take them to Al-Juhfah."
arabicText: 2895 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ مَعِي صِبْيَةً صِغَاراً وَ أَنَا أَخَافُ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلْبَرْدَ فَمِنْ أَيْنَ يُحْرِمُونَ فَقَالَ «اِئْتِ بِهِمُ اَلْعَرْجَ فَلْيُحْرِمُوا مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ إِذَا أَتَيْتَ اَلْعَرْجَ وَقَعْتَ فِي تِهَامَةَ » ثُمَّ قَالَ «فَإِنْ خِفْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ فَائْتِ بِهِمُ اَلْجُحْفَةَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2895 - It was narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, from his father, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I have young children with me, and I fear the cold for them. From where should they enter the state of Ihram?"
Imam (as) said: "Take them to Al-‘Arj, and let them enter Ihram from there, for when you reach Al-‘Arj, you will have entered Tihamah."
Then Imam (as) added: "If you still fear for them, take them to Al-Juhfah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2896 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Look at the children who are with you. Take them to Al-Juhfah or Batn Marr, and treat them as you would treat those in the state of Ihram. Perform Tawaf for them, throw (the pebbles) on their behalf, and if they cannot offer the sacrifice, their guardian should fast on their behalf. Imam Ali ibn Al-Husayn (as) used to place the knife in the child's hand, then an adult would hold the child's hand to perform the slaughter."
arabicText: 2896 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اُنْظُرُوا مَنْ كَانَ مَعَكُمْ مِنَ اَلصِّبْيَانِ فَقَدِّمُوهُ إِلَى اَلْجُحْفَةِ أَوْ إِلَى بَطْنِ مَرٍّ وَ يُصْنَعُ بِهِمْ مَا يُصْنَعُ بِالْمُحْرِمِ وَ يُطَافُ بِهِمْ وَ يُرْمَى عَنْهُمْ وَ مَنْ لاَ يَجِدُ اَلْهَدْيَ مِنْهُمْ فَلْيَصُمْ عَنْهُ وَلِيُّهُ وَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ يَضَعُ اَلسِّكِّينَ فِي يَدِ اَلصَّبِيِّ ثُمَّ يَقْبِضُ عَلَى يَدِهِ اَلرَّجُلُ فَيَذْبَحُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2896 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Look at the children who are with you. Take them to Al-Juhfah or Batn Marr, and treat them as you would treat those in the state of Ihram. Perform Tawaf for them, throw (the pebbles) on their behalf, and if they cannot offer the sacrifice, their guardian should fast on their behalf. Imam Ali ibn Al-Husayn (as) used to place the knife in the child's hand, then an adult would hold the child's hand to perform the slaughter."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2897 - It was narrated that Sama'ah asked Imam (as) about a man who instructed his servants to perform Tamattu‘ (Umrah and Hajj combined).
Imam (as) said: "It is incumbent upon him to offer the sacrifice on their behalf."
I said: "What if he gave them dirhams, and some of them offered the sacrifice while others kept the dirhams and chose to fast?"
Imam (as) said: "It is sufficient for them, and he has the choice to leave it as is if he wishes."
Imam (as) further said: "If he had commanded them to fast instead, it would have sufficed for them."
arabicText: 2897 - وَ سَأَلَهُ سَمَاعَةُ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَمَرَ غِلْمَانَهُ أَنْ يَتَمَتَّعُوا قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُضَحِّيَ عَنْهُمْ» قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهُ أَعْطَاهُمْ دَرَاهِمَ فَبَعْضُهُمْ ضَحَّى وَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَمْسَكَ اَلدَّرَاهِمَ وَ صَامَ قَالَ «قَدْ أَجْزَأَ عَنْهُمْ وَ هُوَ بِالْخِيَارِ إِنْ شَاءَ تَرَكَهَا » قَالَ قَالَ «وَ لَوْ أَنَّهُ أَمَرَهُمْ فَصَامُوا كَانَ قَدْ أَجْزَأَ عَنْهُمْ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2898 - Safwan narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a ten-year-old boy performing Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "The Hajj of Islam becomes obligatory upon him if he reaches puberty, and likewise for a girl—it becomes obligatory upon her when she begins menstruating."
arabicText: 2898 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اِبْنِ عَشْرِ سِنِينَ يَحُجُّ قَالَ «عَلَيْهِ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ إِذَا اِحْتَلَمَ وَ كَذَلِكَ اَلْجَارِيَةُ عَلَيْهَا اَلْحَجُّ إِذَا طَمِثَتْ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2898 - Safwan narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a ten-year-old boy performing Hajj.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Hajj of Islam becomes obligatory upon him if he reaches puberty, and likewise for a girl—it becomes obligatory upon her when she begins menstruating."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2899 - It was narrated from Ali ibn Mahziyar, from Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far al-Thani, Imam Muhammad al-Jawad (as) about when a child should be entered into the state of Ihram.
Imam (as) said: "When they begin to grow teeth."
arabicText: 2899 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ اَلثَّانِيَ عَنِ اَلصَّبِيِّ مَتَى يُحْرَمُ بِهِ قَالَ «إِذَا اِثَّغَرَ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2899 - It was narrated from Ali ibn Mahziyar, from Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far al-Thani, Imam Muhammad al-Jawad (as) about when a child should be entered into the state of Ihram.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When they begin to grow teeth."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Hajj of Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2900 - Aban narrated from Al-Hakam, who said:
I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say: "If a child is taken for Hajj, it does not fulfill the Hajj of Islam when they grow up. Similarly, if a servant is taken for Hajj, it does not fulfill the Hajj of Islam until they are freed."
arabicText: 2900 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنِ اَلْحَكَمِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : «اَلصَّبِيُّ إِذَا حُجَّ بِهِ فَقَدْ قَضَى حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ حَتَّى يَكْبَرَ وَ اَلْعَبْدُ إِذَا حُجَّ بِهِ فَقَدْ قَضَى حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ حَتَّى يُعْتَقَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2900 - Aban narrated from Al-Hakam, who said:
I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a child is taken for Hajj, it does not fulfill the Hajj of Islam when they grow up. Similarly, if a servant is taken for Hajj, it does not fulfill the Hajj of Islam until they are freed."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Borrowing to Perform Hajj and the Obligation of Hajj on Someone in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2901 - It was narrated from Ya'qub ibn Shu'ayb, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who performs Hajj with borrowed money and has already performed the Hajj of Islam.
Imam (as) said: "Yes, and Allah (swt), the Exalted, will settle his debt, God willing."
arabicText: 2901 - رُوِيَ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَحُجُّ بِدَيْنٍ وَ قَدْ حَجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ سَيَقْضِي عَنْهُ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2901 - It was narrated from Ya'qub ibn Shu'ayb, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who performs Hajj with borrowed money and has already performed the Hajj of Islam.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, and Allah (swt), the Exalted, will settle his debt, God willing."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Borrowing to Perform Hajj and the Obligation of Hajj on Someone in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2902 - It was narrated from Abdul-Malik ibn Utbah, who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who has debt but borrows money to perform Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "If he has a means to repay the debt, there is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2902 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ يَسْتَقْرِضُ وَ يَحُجُّ قَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ لَهُ وَجْهٌ فِي مَالٍ فَلاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2902 - It was narrated from Abdul-Malik ibn Utbah, who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who has debt but borrows money to perform Hajj.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he has a means to repay the debt, there is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Borrowing to Perform Hajj and the Obligation of Hajj on Someone in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2903 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Imam (as), who said:
I asked him: "Can a man borrow money to perform Hajj if he has resources left behind to settle the debt in case something happens to him?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2903 - وَ رَوَى مُوسَى بْنُ بَكْرٍ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ هَلْ يَسْتَقْرِضُ اَلرَّجُلُ وَ يَحُجُّ إِذَا كَانَ خَلْفَ ظَهْرِهِ مَا يُؤَدَّى بِهِ عَنْهُ إِذَا حَدَثَ بِهِ حَدَثٌ قَالَ «نَعَمْ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2903 - Musa ibn Bakr narrated from Imam (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him: "Can a man borrow money to perform Hajj if he has resources left behind to settle the debt in case something happens to him?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Borrowing to Perform Hajj and the Obligation of Hajj on Someone in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2904 - It was narrated from Abu Hammam, who said:
I said to Al-Ridha (as): "A man has debt, and some wealth comes to him. Should he pay his debt or perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "He should pay part of it toward his debt and use part for Hajj."
I said: "What if the amount is only sufficient for the expenses of Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Let him pay his debt one year and perform Hajj the next year."
I asked: "What if the money comes from the government?"
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm for you in that."
arabicText: 2904 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ أَبِي هَمَّامٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ اَلدَّيْنُ وَ يَحْضُرُهُ اَلشَّيْءُ أَ يَقْضِي دَيْنَهُ أَوْ يَحُجُّ قَالَ «يَقْضِي بِبَعْضٍ وَ يَحُجُّ بِبَعْضٍ» قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَكُونُ إِلاَّ بِقَدْرِ نَفَقَةِ اَلْحَجِّ قَالَ «يَقْضِي سَنَةً وَ يَحُجُّ سَنَةً» قُلْتُ أُعْطِيَ اَلْمَالَ مِنْ نَاحِيَةِ اَلسُّلْطَانِ قَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2904 - It was narrated from Abu Hammam, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Al-Ridha (as): "A man has debt, and some wealth comes to him. Should he pay his debt or perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "He should pay part of it toward his debt and use part for Hajj."
I said: "What if the amount is only sufficient for the expenses of Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Let him pay his debt one year and perform Hajj the next year."
I asked: "What if the money comes from the government?"
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm for you in that."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Borrowing to Perform Hajj and the Obligation of Hajj on Someone in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2905 - A man asked Abu Abdullah (as): "I am a man in debt. Should I borrow money and perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, it is more effective in settling the debt."
arabicText: 2905 - وَ سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فَقَالَ لَهُ إِنِّي رَجُلٌ ذُو دَيْنٍ فَأَتَدَيَّنُ وَ أَحُجُّ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ هُوَ أَقْضَى لِلدَّيْنِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2905 - A man asked Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I am a man in debt. Should I borrow money and perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, it is more effective in settling the debt."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Borrowing to Perform Hajj and the Obligation of Hajj on Someone in Debt
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2906 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Aban, from Al-Hasan ibn Ziyad al-‘Attar, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I have debt, and some dirhams come into my possession. If I divide them among my creditors, they will not settle anything significant. Should I use them for Hajj, or should I distribute them among the creditors?"
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj with them, and pray to Allah (swt) to help you settle your debt, God willing."
arabicText: 2906 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنِ اَلْحَسَنِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ اَلْعَطَّارِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَكُونُ عَلَيَّ اَلدَّيْنُ فَيَقَعُ فِي يَدِيَ اَلدَّرَاهِمُ فَإِنْ وَزَّعْتُهَا بَيْنَهُمْ لَمْ يَقَعْ شَيْئاً أَ فَأَحُجُّ أَوْ أُوَزِّعُهَا بَيْنَ اَلْغُرَمَاءِ قَالَ «حُجَّ بِهَا وَ اُدْعُ اَللَّهَ أَنْ يَقْضِيَ عَنْكَ دَيْنَكَ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2906 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Aban, from Al-Hasan ibn Ziyad al-‘Attar, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "I have debt, and some dirhams come into my possession. If I divide them among my creditors, they will not settle anything significant. Should I use them for Hajj, or should I distribute them among the creditors?"
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj with them, and pray to Allah (swt) to help you settle your debt, God willing."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding a Woman Whose Husband Prevents Her From Performing the Obligatory Hajj or a Voluntary Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2907 - Aban narrated from Zurara, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
I asked him about a woman who has a husband, has not performed Hajj before (ṣarūra), and her husband does not permit her to go for Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "She should perform Hajj, even if he does not permit her."
arabicText: 2907 - رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ لَهَا زَوْجٌ وَ هِيَ صَرُورَةٌ وَ لاَ يَأْذَنُ لَهَا فِي اَلْحَجِّ قَالَ «تَحُجُّ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَأْذَنْ لَهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2907 - Aban narrated from Zurara, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
I asked him about a woman who has a husband, has not performed Hajj before (ṣarūra), and her husband does not permit her to go for Hajj.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "She should perform Hajj, even if he does not permit her."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding a Woman Whose Husband Prevents Her From Performing the Obligatory Hajj or a Voluntary Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2908 - In a narration from Abdul-Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as),
Imam (as) said: "She should perform Hajj, even if it displeases him."
arabicText: 2908 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنِ اَلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «تَحُجُّ وَ إِنْ رَغِمَ أَنْفُهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2908 - In a narration from Abdul-Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah, from Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as),
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "She should perform Hajj, even if it displeases him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What Has Been Reported Regarding a Woman Whose Husband Prevents Her From Performing the Obligatory Hajj or a Voluntary Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2909 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Ibrahim (as), who said:
I asked him about a wealthy woman who had already performed the Hajj of Islam but said to her husband, "Take me for Hajj again." Can he prevent her from going?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, he can say to her, 'My right over you is greater than your right over me in this matter.'"
arabicText: 2909 - وَ رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ اَلْمُوسِرَةِ قَدْ حَجَّتْ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ فَتَقُولُ لِزَوْجِهَا أَ حِجَّنِي مَرَّةً أُخْرَى أَ لَهُ أَنْ يَمْنَعَهَا قَالَ «نَعَمْ يَقُولُ لَهَا حَقِّي عَلَيْكِ أَعْظَمُ مِنْ حَقِّكِ عَلَيَّ فِي ذَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2909 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Ibrahim (as), who said:
I asked him about a wealthy woman who had already performed the Hajj of Islam but said to her husband,
thaqalaynMatn:
"Take me for Hajj again." Can he prevent her from going?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, he can say to her, 'My right over you is greater than your right over me in this matter.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Woman Performing Hajj Without a Mahram or Guardian
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2910 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman traveling to Mecca without a guardian.
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm if she travels with trustworthy people."
arabicText: 2910 - رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ تَخْرُجُ إِلَى مَكَّةَ بِغَيْرِ وَلِيٍّ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ تَخْرُجُ مَعَ قَوْمٍ ثِقَاتٍ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2910 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman traveling to Mecca without a guardian.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if she travels with trustworthy people."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Woman Performing Hajj Without a Mahram or Guardian
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2911 - In a narration from Hisham, from Sulayman ibn Khalid, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a woman who wants to perform Hajj but does not have a mahram (close male relative), he (as) was asked: "Is it permissible for her to perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, if she is trustworthy."
arabicText: 2911 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ هِشَامٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْمَرْأَةِ تُرِيدُ اَلْحَجَّ وَ لَيْسَ مَعَهَا مَحْرَمٌ هَلْ يَصْلُحُ لَهَا اَلْحَجُّ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ إِذَا كَانَتْ مَأْمُونَةً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2911 - In a narration from Hisham, from Sulayman ibn Khalid, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a woman who wants to perform Hajj but does not have a mahram (close male relative), he (as) was asked:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Is it permissible for her to perform Hajj?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, if she is trustworthy."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Woman Performing Hajj Without a Mahram or Guardian
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2912 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Safwan al-Jammal, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "You know my profession. A woman comes to me, and I know her to be Muslim, to love you, and to hold your guardianship (wilayah), but she has no mahram (close male relative)."
Imam (as) said: "If a Muslim woman comes, then take her, for a believer is a mahram for a believing woman." He then recited the verse: 'And the believing men and believing women are allies of one another.' (Surah At-Tawbah 9:71).
arabicText: 2912 - وَ رَوَى اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ اَلْجَمَّالِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَدْ عَرَفْتَنِي بِعَمَلِي تَأْتِينِي اَلْمَرْأَةُ أَعْرِفُهَا بِإِسْلاَمِهَا وَ حُبِّهَا إِيَّاكُمْ وَ وَلاَيَتِهَا لَكُمْ لَيْسَ لَهَا مَحْرَمٌ قَالَ «إِذَا جَاءَتِ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلْمُسْلِمَةُ فَاحْمِلْهَا فَإِنَّ اَلْمُؤْمِنَ مَحْرَمُ اَلْمُؤْمِنَةِ » ثُمَّ تَلاَ هَذِهِ اَلْآيَةَ ۝ وَ اَلْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَ اَلْمُؤْمِنٰاتُ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيٰاءُ بَعْضٍ۝
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2912 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Safwan al-Jammal, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "You know my profession. A woman comes to me, and I know her to be Muslim, to love you, and to hold your guardianship (wilayah), but she has no mahram (close male relative)."
Imam (as) said: "If a Muslim woman comes, then take her, for a believer is a mahram for a believing woman." He then recited the verse: 'And the believing men and believing women are allies of one another.' (Surah At-Tawbah 9:71).

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Woman Performing Hajj During the Iddah (waiting period)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2913 - Al-'Ala' narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from one of the Imams (as), who said:
"A divorced woman may perform Hajj during her waiting period ('iddah)."
arabicText: 2913 - رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْمُطَلَّقَةُ تَحُجُّ فِي عِدَّتِهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2913 - Al-'Ala' narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from one of the Imams (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A divorced woman may perform Hajj during her waiting period ('iddah)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Woman Performing Hajj During the Iddah (waiting period)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2914 - Ibn Bukayr narrated from Zurara, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman whose husband has passed away: "Can she perform Hajj during her waiting period ('iddah)?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2914 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلْمَرْأَةِ اَلَّتِي يُتَوَفَّى عَنْهَا زَوْجُهَا أَ تَحُجُّ فِي عِدَّتِهَا قَالَ «نَعَمْ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2914 - Ibn Bukayr narrated from Zurara, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman whose husband has passed away:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Can she perform Hajj during her waiting period ('iddah)?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Pilgrim Who Dies on the Way
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2915 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Durays, from Abu Ja'far (as), regarding a man who set out to perform the Hajj of Islam but died on the way.
Imam (as) said: "If he died within the sacred precinct (haram), it suffices as the Hajj of Islam. But if he died outside the haram, his heir should perform the Hajj of Islam on his behalf."
arabicText: 2915 - رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ ضُرَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ خَرَجَ حَاجّاً حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ فَمَاتَ فِي اَلطَّرِيقِ فَقَالَ «إِنْ مَاتَ فِي اَلْحَرَمِ فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَتْ عَنْهُ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ مَاتَ دُونَ اَلْحَرَمِ فَلْيَقْضِ عَنْهُ وَلِيُّهُ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2915 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Durays, from Abu Ja'far (as), regarding a man who set out to perform the Hajj of Islam but died on the way.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he died within the sacred precinct (haram), it suffices as the Hajj of Islam. But if he died outside the haram, his heir should perform the Hajj of Islam on his behalf."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Pilgrim Who Dies on the Way
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2916 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Burayd al-‘Ijli, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a man who set out for Hajj with his camel, provisions, and expenses, but died on the way.
Imam (as) said: "If he was a ṣarūra (someone who had not performed the Hajj of Islam) and died within the haram, it suffices as the Hajj of Islam. If he died as a ṣarūra before entering into Ihram, his camel, provisions, expenses, and all that he had with him should be used to fulfill the Hajj of Islam on his behalf. If there is anything left over, it goes to his heirs, provided he had no debts."
I asked: "What if the Hajj was voluntary, and he died on the way before entering into Ihram? What happens to his camel, expenses, and belongings?"
Imam (as) said: "Everything he had and left behind goes to his heirs unless he had debts, in which case they are paid from his estate. If he left a will, it is carried out for the person he designated, with the will being fulfilled from one-third of his estate."
arabicText: 2916 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ خَرَجَ حَاجّاً وَ مَعَهُ جَمَلٌ لَهُ وَ نَفَقَةٌ وَ زَادٌ فَمَاتَ فِي اَلطَّرِيقِ قَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ صَرُورَةً ثُمَّ مَاتَ فِي اَلْحَرَمِ فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَتْ عَنْهُ حَجَّةُ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ مَاتَ وَ هُوَ صَرُورَةٌ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُحْرِمَ جُعِلَ جَمَلُهُ وَ زَادُهُ وَ نَفَقَتُهُ وَ مَا مَعَهُ فِي حَجَّةِ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ، فَإِنْ فَضَلَ مِنْ ذَلِكَ شَيْءٌ فَهُوَ لِلْوَرَثَةِ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ» قُلْتُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَانَتِ اَلْحَجَّةُ تَطَوُّعاً ثُمَّ مَاتَ فِي اَلطَّرِيقِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُحْرِمَ لِمَنْ يَكُونُ جَمَلُهُ وَ نَفَقَتُهُ وَ مَا مَعَهُ قَالَ «يَكُونُ جَمِيعُ مَا مَعَهُ وَ مَا تَرَكَ لِلْوَرَثَةِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ فَيُقْضَى عَنْهُ أَوْ يَكُونَ أَوْصَى بِوَصِيَّةٍ فَيَنْفُذَ ذَلِكَ لِمَنْ أَوْصَى لَهُ وَ يُجْعَلَ ذَلِكَ مِنْ ثُلُثِهِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2916 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Burayd al-‘Ijli, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a man who set out for Hajj with his camel, provisions, and expenses, but died on the way.
Imam (as) said: "If he was a ṣarūra (someone who had not performed the Hajj of Islam) and died within the haram, it suffices as the Hajj of Islam. If he died as a ṣarūra before entering into Ihram, his camel, provisions, expenses, and all that he had with him should be used to fulfill the Hajj of Islam on his behalf. If there is anything left over, it goes to his heirs, provided he had no debts."
I asked: "What if the Hajj was voluntary, and he died on the way before entering into Ihram? What happens to his camel, expenses, and belongings?"
Imam (as) said: "Everything he had and left behind goes to his heirs unless he had debts, in which case they are paid from his estate. If he left a will, it is carried out for the person he designated, with the will being fulfilled from one-third of his estate."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Performed on Behalf of the Deceased Regarding the Pilgrimage of Islam, Whether They Made a Will or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2917 - Harun ibn Hamzah al-Ghanawi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who died without performing the Hajj of Islam and left behind only enough wealth for the expenses of Hajj, and he had heirs.
Imam (as) said: "They have the greater right to his inheritance. If they wish, they may use it for themselves, and if they wish, they may perform Hajj on his behalf."
arabicText: 2917 - رَوَى هَارُونُ بْنُ حَمْزَةَ اَلْغَنَوِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ لَمْ يَحُجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ لَمْ يَتْرُكْ إِلاَّ قَدْرَ نَفَقَةِ اَلْحَجِّ وَ لَهُ وَرَثَةٌ قَالَ «هُمْ أَحَقُّ بِمِيرَاثِهِ إِنْ شَاءُوا أَكَلُوا وَ إِنْ شَاءُوا حَجُّوا عَنْهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2917 - Harun ibn Hamzah al-Ghanawi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who died without performing the Hajj of Islam and left behind only enough wealth for the expenses of Hajj, and he had heirs.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "They have the greater right to his inheritance. If they wish, they may use it for themselves, and if they wish, they may perform Hajj on his behalf."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Performed on Behalf of the Deceased Regarding the Pilgrimage of Islam, Whether They Made a Will or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2918 - It was narrated from Harith, the seller of mats, that Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who had instructed in his will that a Hajj be performed on his behalf.
Imam (as) said: "If he was a ṣarūra (someone who had not performed the Hajj of Islam), it should be taken from the principal of his estate, as it is a debt upon him. But if he had already performed Hajj, it should be taken from one-third of his estate."
arabicText: 2918 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ حَارِثٍ بَيَّاعِ اَلْأَنْمَاطِ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِحَجَّةٍ فَقَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ صَرُورَةً فَهِيَ مِنْ صُلْبِ مَالِهِ إِنَّمَا هِيَ دَيْنٌ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ قَدْ حَجَّ فَهِيَ مِنَ اَلثُّلُثِ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2918 - It was narrated from Harith, the seller of mats, that Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who had instructed in his will that a Hajj be performed on his behalf.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he was a ṣarūra (someone who had not performed the Hajj of Islam), it should be taken from the principal of his estate, as it is a debt upon him. But if he had already performed Hajj, it should be taken from one-third of his estate."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Performed on Behalf of the Deceased Regarding the Pilgrimage of Islam, Whether They Made a Will or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2919 - It was narrated from Al-Harith ibn Al-Mughira, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "My daughter instructed in her will for a Hajj to be performed, but she did not perform Hajj during her lifetime."
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj on her behalf; the reward will be for both you and her."
I said: "My mother passed away and did not perform Hajj."
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj on her behalf; the reward will be for both you and her."
arabicText: 2919 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْحَارِثِ بْنِ اَلْمُغِيرَةِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ اِبْنَتِي أَوْصَتْ بِحَجَّةٍ وَ لَمْ تَحُجَّ قَالَ «فَحُجَّ عَنْهَا فَإِنَّهَا لَكَ وَ لَهَا» قُلْتُ إِنَّ أُمِّي مَاتَتْ وَ لَمْ تَحُجَّ قَالَ «حُجَّ عَنْهَا فَإِنَّهَا لَكَ وَ لَهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2919 - It was narrated from Al-Harith ibn Al-Mughira, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"My daughter instructed in her will for a Hajj to be performed, but she did not perform Hajj during her lifetime."
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj on her behalf; the reward will be for both you and her."
I said: "My mother passed away and did not perform Hajj."
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj on her behalf; the reward will be for both you and her."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Performed on Behalf of the Deceased Regarding the Pilgrimage of Islam, Whether They Made a Will or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2920 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who instructed in her will for her wealth to be used for charity, Hajj, and freeing slaves.
Imam (as) said: "Begin with Hajj, for it is obligatory. If anything remains, allocate a portion for charity and a portion for freeing slaves."
arabicText: 2920 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ أَوْصَتْ بِمَالٍ فِي اَلصَّدَقَةِ وَ اَلْحَجِّ وَ اَلْعِتْقِ فَقَالَ «اِبْدَأْ بِالْحَجِّ فَإِنَّهُ مَفْرُوضٌ فَإِنْ بَقِيَ شَيْءٌ فَاجْعَلْ فِي اَلصَّدَقَةِ طَائِفَةً وَ فِي اَلْعِتْقِ طَائِفَةً ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2920 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who instructed in her will for her wealth to be used for charity, Hajj, and freeing slaves.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Begin with Hajj, for it is obligatory. If anything remains, allocate a portion for charity and a portion for freeing slaves."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Performed on Behalf of the Deceased Regarding the Pilgrimage of Islam, Whether They Made a Will or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2921 - It was narrated from Basheer al-Nabbal, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "My mother passed away and did not perform Hajj."
Imam (as) said: "A man or a woman may perform Hajj on her behalf."
I asked: "Which is more preferable to you?"
Imam (as) said: "A man is more preferable to me."
arabicText: 2921 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ بَشِيرٍ اَلنَّبَّالِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ وَالِدَتِي تُوُفِّيَتْ وَ لَمْ تَحُجَّ قَالَ «يَحُجُّ عَنْهَا رَجُلٌ أَوِ اِمْرَأَةٌ» قَالَ قُلْتُ أَيُّهُمْ أَحَبُّ إِلَيْكَ قَالَ «رَجُلٌ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2921 - It was narrated from Basheer al-Nabbal, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"My mother passed away and did not perform Hajj."
Imam (as) said: "A man or a woman may perform Hajj on her behalf."
I asked: "Which is more preferable to you?"
Imam (as) said: "A man is more preferable to me."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Performed on Behalf of the Deceased Regarding the Pilgrimage of Islam, Whether They Made a Will or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2922 - It was narrated from Asim ibn Humayd, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said:
I asked Abu Ja'far (as) about a man who died without performing the Hajj of Islam and did not include it in his will. Should it be performed on his behalf?
Imam (as) said: "Yes."
arabicText: 2922 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَاصِمِ بْنِ حُمَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ لَمْ يَحُجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ لَمْ يُوصِ بِهَا أَ يُقْضَى عَنْهُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Makes a Will for a Pilgrimage and His Executor Assigns it to Someone Else
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2923 - Ibn Muskan narrated, who said that Abu Sa'id reported from Abu Abdullah (as):
He was asked about a man who instructed in his will for a Hajj to be performed on his behalf, but his executor used the funds for another purpose.
Imam (as) said: "The executor must bear the cost himself and ensure that it is used for a Hajj as specified in the will. For Allah (swt), the Exalted, says: 'But if anyone changes it after hearing it, the sin shall be upon those who make the change.' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)."
arabicText: 2923 - رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي أَبُو سَعِيدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى بِحَجَّةٍ فَجَعَلَهَا وَصِيُّهُ فِي نَسَمَةٍ قَالَ «يَغْرَمُهَا وَصِيُّهُ وَ يَجْعَلُهَا فِي حَجَّةٍ كَمَا أَوْصَى فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ: «۝ فَمَنْ بَدَّلَهُ بَعْدَ مٰا سَمِعَهُ فَإِنَّمٰا إِثْمُهُ عَلَى اَلَّذِينَ يُبَدِّلُونَهُ ۝» ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2923 - Ibn Muskan narrated, who said that Abu Sa'id reported from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
He was asked about a man who instructed in his will for a Hajj to be performed on his behalf, but his executor used the funds for another purpose.
Imam (as) said: "The executor must bear the cost himself and ensure that it is used for a Hajj as specified in the will. For Allah (swt), the Exalted, says: 'But if anyone changes it after hearing it, the sin shall be upon those who make the change.' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:181)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Hajj on Behalf of a Slave Mother (umm Al-walad) if She Passes Away
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2924 - Ibn Faddal narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, who said:
I sent a message to Abu Abdullah (as) asking about the mother of a woman who was a concubine (umm walad). She had passed away, and the woman wanted to perform Hajj on her behalf.
Imam (as) said: "Did she not gain her freedom through her child? She may perform Hajj on her behalf."
arabicText: 2924 - رَوَى اِبْنُ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ : أَرْسَلْتُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّ أُمَّ اِمْرَأَةٍ كَانَتْ أُمَّ وَلَدٍ فَمَاتَتْ فَأَرَادَتِ اَلْمَرْأَةُ أَنْ تَحُجَّ عَنْهَا قَالَ «أَ وَ لَيْسَ قَدْ عَتَقَتْ بِوَلَدِهَا تَحُجُّ عَنْهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2924 - Ibn Faddal narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, who said:
I sent a message to Abu Abdullah (as) asking about the mother of a woman who was a concubine (umm walad). She had passed away, and the woman wanted to perform Hajj on her behalf.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Did she not gain her freedom through her child? She may perform Hajj on her behalf."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Who is Bequeathed by Another to Arrange for Three Men to Perform Hajj on His Behalf, and Whether it is Permissible for Him to Take One of the Hajj Allocations for Himself
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2925 - Amr ibn Sa’id al-Sabati wrote to Abu Ja’far (as) asking about a man who had instructed in his will that Hajj be performed on his behalf by three different individuals. He asked if it was permissible for him to take one of those Hajj allocations for himself.
Imam (as) wrote back in his handwriting, and I read it:
"Perform Hajj on his behalf, God willing. You will receive a reward equal to his, and nothing will be diminished from his reward, God willing."
arabicText: 2925 - كَتَبَ عَمْرُو بْنُ سَعِيدٍ اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ إِلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : يَسْأَلُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَوْصَى إِلَيْهِ رَجُلٌ أَنْ يُحِجَّ عَنْهُ ثَلاَثَةَ رِجَالٍ فَيَحِلُّ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ لِنَفْسِهِ حَجَّةً مِنْهَا فَوَقَّعَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِخَطِّهِ وَ قَرَأْتُهُ «حُجَّ عَنْهُ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى فَإِنَّ لَكَ مِثْلَ أَجْرِهِ، وَ لاَ يَنْقُصُ مِنْ أَجْرِهِ شَيْءٌ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2925 - Amr ibn Sa’id al-Sabati wrote to Abu Ja’far (as) asking about a man who had instructed in his will that Hajj be performed on his behalf by three different individuals. He asked if it was permissible for him to take one of those Hajj allocations for himself.
Imam (as) wrote back in his handwriting, and I read it:
thaqalaynMatn: "Perform Hajj on his behalf, God willing. You will receive a reward equal to his, and nothing will be diminished from his reward, God willing."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on One Who Undertakes a Hajj but Finds the Allotted Resources Insufficient
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2926 - Ali ibn Mahziyar narrated from Muhammad ibn Isma'il, who said:
I instructed someone to ask Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who accepts funds for Hajj from one person, but it is insufficient. Can he then take another Hajj fund from a different person to cover the costs, allowing it to suffice for both of them? Or should he abandon both if one is insufficient?
Imam (as) replied: "It is preferable to dedicate the Hajj exclusively to one person. If it is insufficient, he should not accept it."
arabicText: 2926 - رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ قَالَ : أَمَرْتُ رَجُلاً أَنْ يَسْأَلَ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَأْخُذُ مِنَ اَلرَّجُلِ حَجَّةً فَلاَ تَكْفِيهِ أَ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْ رَجُلٍ آخَرَ حَجَّةً أُخْرَى فَيَتَّسِعَ بِهَا فَتُجْزِيَ عَنْهُمَا جَمِيعاً أَوْ يَتْرُكُهُمَا جَمِيعاً إِنْ لَمْ تَكْفِهِ إِحْدَاهُمَا فَذَكَرَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ «أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ أَنْ تَكُونَ خَالِصَةً لِوَاحِدٍ فَإِنْ كَانَتْ لاَ تَكْفِيهِ فَلاَ يَأْخُذْهَا».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2926 - Ali ibn Mahziyar narrated from Muhammad ibn Isma'il, who said:
I instructed someone to ask Abu al-Hasan (as) about a man who accepts funds for Hajj from one person, but it is insufficient. Can he then take another Hajj fund from a different person to cover the costs, allowing it to suffice for both of them? Or should he abandon both if one is insufficient?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "It is preferable to dedicate the Hajj exclusively to one person. If it is insufficient, he should not accept it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on One Who Bequeaths an Insufficient Amount for Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2927 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, from someone who asked Imam (as):
I said to him: "A man instructed in his will to allocate twenty dinars for a Hajj."
Imam (as) said: "A man should perform Hajj with it from wherever the amount suffices for him to begin."
arabicText: 2927 - رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَمَّنْ سَأَلَهُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ أَوْصَى بِعِشْرِينَ دِينَاراً فِي حَجَّةٍ فَقَالَ «يَحُجُّ بِهَا رَجُلٌ مِنْ حَيْثُ يَبْلُغُهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2927 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, from someone who asked Imam (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to him: "A man instructed in his will to allocate twenty dinars for a Hajj."
Imam (as) said: "A man should perform Hajj with it from wherever the amount suffices for him to begin."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on One Who Bequeaths an Insufficient Amount for Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2928 - Ibrahim ibn Mahziyar wrote to Abu Muhammad (as):
"I inform you, my master, that your servant Ali ibn Mahziyar instructed in his will that Hajj be performed on his behalf from a property, a quarter of which he dedicated for this purpose, allocating one Hajj every year with twenty dinars. However, since the route to Basra has been cut off, the expenses for travel have significantly increased, and twenty dinars are no longer sufficient. Similarly, several of your followers have made wills for two Hajj pilgrimages."
Imam (as) wrote back: "Combine three Hajj pilgrimages into two, God willing."
arabicText: 2928 - وَ كَتَبَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ بْنُ مَهْزِيَارَ إِلَى أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أُعْلِمُكَ يَا مَوْلاَيَ أَنَّ مَوْلاَكَ عَلِيَّ بْنَ مَهْزِيَارَ أَوْصَى أَنْ يُحَجَّ عَنْهُ مِنْ ضَيْعَةٍ صَيَّرَ رُبُعَهَا لَكَ حَجَّةٌ فِي كُلِّ سَنَةٍ بِعِشْرِينَ دِينَاراً وَ إِنَّهُ مُنْذُ اِنْقَطَعَ طَرِيقُ اَلْبَصْرَةِ تَضَاعَفَتِ اَلْمَئُونَةُ عَلَى اَلنَّاسِ فَلَيْسَ يَكْتَفُونَ بِعِشْرِينَ دِينَاراً وَ كَذَلِكَ أَوْصَى عِدَّةٌ مِنْ مَوَالِيكَ فِي حَجَّتَيْنِ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «يُجْعَلُ ثَلاَثُ حِجَجٍ حَجَّتَيْنِ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ تَعَالَى».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2928 - Ibrahim ibn Mahziyar wrote to Abu Muhammad (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"I inform you, my master, that your servant Ali ibn Mahziyar instructed in his will that Hajj be performed on his behalf from a property, a quarter of which he dedicated for this purpose, allocating one Hajj every year with twenty dinars. However, since the route to Basra has been cut off, the expenses for travel have significantly increased, and twenty dinars are no longer sufficient. Similarly, several of your followers have made wills for two Hajj pilgrimages."
Imam (as) wrote back: "Combine three Hajj pilgrimages into two, God willing."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on One Who Bequeaths an Insufficient Amount for Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2929 - Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hudhayni wrote to Imam (as):
"My cousin instructed in his will that Hajj be performed on his behalf every year with fifteen dinars, but this amount is not sufficient. What do you command me to do in this matter?"
Imam (as) wrote back: "Combine two Hajj pilgrimages into one, God willing. Allah (swt) is aware of this."
arabicText: 2929 - وَ كَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ اَلْحُضَيْنِيُّ : أَنَّ اِبْنَ عَمِّي أَوْصَى أَنْ يُحَجَّ عَنْهُ بِخَمْسَةَ عَشَرَ دِينَاراً فِي كُلِّ سَنَةٍ فَلَيْسَ يَكْفِي فَمَا تَأْمُرُنِي فِي ذَلِكَ فَكَتَبَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «تَجْعَلُ حَجَّتَيْنِ فِي حَجَّةٍ إِنْ شَاءَ اَللَّهُ إِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَالِمٌ بِذَلِكَ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Hajj Using a Trust Deposit
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2930 - Suwayd al-Qalla’ narrated from Ayyub ibn Harr, from Burayd al-‘Ijli, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a man who entrusted me with some money, but he died without leaving anything for his children, and he had not performed the Hajj of Islam.
Imam (as) said: "Perform Hajj on his behalf, and whatever remains, give it to his children."
arabicText: 2930 - رَوَى سُوَيْدٌ اَلْقَلاَّءُ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ حُرٍّ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِسْتَوْدَعَنِي مَالاً فَهَلَكَ وَ لَيْسَ لِوُلْدِهِ شَيْءٌ وَ لَمْ يَحُجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ قَالَ «حُجَّ عَنْهُ وَ مَا فَضَلَ فَأَعْطِهِمْ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2930 - Suwayd al-Qalla’ narrated from Ayyub ibn Harr, from Burayd al-‘Ijli, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a man who entrusted me with some money, but he died without leaving anything for his children, and he had not performed the Hajj of Islam.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Perform Hajj on his behalf, and whatever remains, give it to his children."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Man Who Passes Away While it is Uncertain Whether His Son Has Performed Hajj or Not
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2931 - Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who passed away and left behind a son, but it was not known whether the father had performed Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "The son should perform Hajj on his behalf. If the father had already performed Hajj, it will be recorded as a supererogatory act (nafl) for the father and as fulfilling the obligation (faridah) for the son. If the father had not performed Hajj, it will be recorded as fulfilling the obligation for the father and as a supererogatory act for the son."
arabicText: 2931 - سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ لَهُ اِبْنٌ فَلَمْ يَدْرِ حَجَّ أَبُوهُ أَمْ لاَ قَالَ «يَحُجُّ عَنْهُ فَإِنْ كَانَ أَبُوهُ قَدْ حَجَّ كُتِبَ لِأَبِيهِ نَافِلَةٌ وَ لِلاِبْنِ فَرِيضَةٌ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ حَجَّ أَبُوهُ كُتِبَ لِأَبِيهِ فَرِيضَةٌ وَ لِلاِبْنِ نَافِلَةٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2931 - Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who passed away and left behind a son, but it was not known whether the father had performed Hajj.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "The son should perform Hajj on his behalf. If the father had already performed Hajj, it will be recorded as a supererogatory act (nafl) for the father and as fulfilling the obligation (faridah) for the son. If the father had not performed Hajj, it will be recorded as fulfilling the obligation for the father and as a supererogatory act for the son."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Hajj Al-tamattu‘ on Behalf of one's Father
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2932 - Ja'far ibn Bashir narrated from Al-'Ala', from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
I asked him about a man who performs Hajj on behalf of his father. Should he perform Tamattu‘ (Umrah and Hajj combined)?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, the Tamattu‘ is for him, and the Hajj is on behalf of his father."
arabicText: 2932 - رَوَى جَعْفَرُ بْنُ بَشِيرٍ عَنِ اَلْعَلاَءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَحُجُّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ أَ يَتَمَتَّعُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ اَلْمُتْعَةُ لَهُ وَ اَلْحَجُّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2932 - Ja'far ibn Bashir narrated from Al-'Ala', from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about a man who performs Hajj on behalf of his father. Should he perform Tamattu‘ (Umrah and Hajj combined)?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, the Tamattu‘ is for him, and the Hajj is on behalf of his father."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Delaying the Performance of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2933 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl narrated:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way" (Surah Al-Isra 17:72).
Imam (as) said: "This verse was revealed concerning those who procrastinate the Hajj of Islam while possessing the means to perform it. They say, 'I will go next year, I will go next year,' until they die without performing Hajj."
arabicText:
2933 - رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ اَلْفُضَيْلِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ
«۝ وَ مَنْ كٰانَ فِي هٰذِهِ أَعْمىٰ فَهُوَ فِي اَلْآخِرَةِ أَعْمىٰ وَ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلاً ۝» فَقَالَ «نَزَلَتْ فِيمَنْ سَوَّفَ اَلْحَجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ عِنْدَهُ مَا يَحُجُّ بِهِ فَقَالَ اَلْعَامَ أَحُجُّ اَلْعَامَ أَحُجُّ حَتَّى يَمُوتَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَحُجَّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2933 - Muhammad ibn al-Fudhayl narrated:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (as) about the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way" (Surah Al-Isra 17:72).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "This verse was revealed concerning those who procrastinate the Hajj of Islam while possessing the means to perform it. They say, 'I will go next year, I will go next year,' until they die without performing Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Delaying the Performance of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2934 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who had never performed Hajj despite having wealth.
Imam (as) said: "He is among those about whom Allah (swt), the Exalted, says: 'And We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind.' (Surah Ta-Ha 20:124)."
I said: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! Blind?"
Imam (as) replied: "Allah (swt), the Exalted, has blinded him from the path of goodness."
arabicText: 2934 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ لَمْ يَحُجَّ قَطُّ وَ لَهُ مَالٌ فَقَالَ «هُوَ مِمَّنْ قَالَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «۝ وَ نَحْشُرُهُ يَوْمَ اَلْقِيٰامَةِ أَعْمىٰ ۝» » فَقُلْتُ سُبْحَانَ اَللَّهِ أَعْمَى فَقَالَ «أَعْمَاهُ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَنْ طَرِيقِ اَلْخَيْرِ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2934 - It was narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who had never performed Hajj despite having wealth.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"He is among those about whom Allah (swt), the Exalted, says: 'And We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind.' (Surah Ta-Ha 20:124)."
I said: "Glory be to Allah (swt)! Blind?"
Imam (as) replied: "Allah (swt), the Exalted, has blinded him from the path of goodness."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Delaying the Performance of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2935 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Dharih al-Muharibi, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Whoever dies without performing the Hajj of Islam, and there was nothing preventing him—such as a pressing need that depleted his resources, an illness that made him incapable of Hajj, or a tyrant preventing him from it—let him die as a Jew or a Christian."
arabicText: 2935 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ ذَرِيحٍ اَلْمُحَارِبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَمْ يَحُجَّ حَجَّةَ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ وَ لَمْ يَمْنَعْهُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ حَاجَةٌ تُجْحِفُ بِهِ أَوْ مَرَضٌ لاَ يُطِيقُ مِنْهُ اَلْحَجَّ أَوْ سُلْطَانٌ يَمْنَعُهُ مِنْهُ فَلْيَمُتْ يَهُودِيّاً أَوْ نَصْرَانِيّاً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2935 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Dharih al-Muharibi, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever dies without performing the Hajj of Islam, and there was nothing preventing him—such as a pressing need that depleted his resources, an illness that made him incapable of Hajj, or a tyrant preventing him from it—let him die as a Jew or a Christian."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Delaying the Performance of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2936 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
"Whoever has the means to perform Hajj but keeps postponing it without any valid excuse that Allah (swt) would accept, and death overtakes him, has neglected a fundamental law of Islam."
arabicText: 2936 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «مَنْ قَدَرَ عَلَى مَا يَحُجُّ بِهِ وَ جَعَلَ يَدْفَعُ ذَلِكَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ عَنْهُ شُغُلٌ يَعْذِرُهُ اَللَّهُ فِيهِ حَتَّى جَاءَ اَلْمَوْتُ فَقَدْ ضَيَّعَ شَرِيعَةً مِنْ شَرَائِعِ اَلْإِسْلاَمِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2936 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever has the means to perform Hajj but keeps postponing it without any valid excuse that Allah (swt) would accept, and death overtakes him, has neglected a fundamental law of Islam."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2937 - Sama'ah ibn Mehran narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Whoever performs Umrah in Shawwal with the intention of returning to their homeland without staying until Hajj, there is no harm in doing so. However, if they stay until Hajj, they are considered Mutamatti‘ (one performing Tamattu‘), as the months of Hajj are Shawwal, Dhu al-Qa'dah, and Dhu al-Hijjah. Whoever performs Umrah during these months and stays until Hajj, it is Tamattu‘. But if they return to their homeland and do not stay until Hajj, it is considered merely an Umrah.
If one performs Umrah in Month of Ramadan or before it and stays until Hajj, they are not Mutamatti‘ but rather a Mujawir (resident performing separate Umrah and Hajj). In this case, the Umrah is considered separate. If they wish to perform Tamattu‘ in the months of Hajj, they must exit the state of Ihram by traveling beyond Dhat ‘Irq or Asfan and then re-enter in Ihram for Umrah, intending Tamattu‘ leading to Hajj.
If one prefers to perform only Hajj without Tamattu‘, they should go to al-Ji’ranah and enter Ihram from there."
arabicText: 2937 - رَوَى سَمَاعَةُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «مَنْ حَجَّ مُعْتَمِراً فِي شَوَّالٍ وَ مِنْ نِيَّتِهِ أَنْ يَعْتَمِرَ وَ يَرْجِعَ إِلَى بِلاَدِهِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ وَ إِنْ هُوَ أَقَامَ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ فَهُوَ مُتَمَتِّعٌ لِأَنَّ أَشْهُرَ اَلْحَجِّ شَوَّالٌ وَ ذُو اَلْقَعْدَةِ وَ ذُو اَلْحِجَّةِ فَمَنِ اِعْتَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ وَ أَقَامَ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ فَهِيَ مُتْعَةٌ وَ مَنْ رَجَعَ إِلَى بِلاَدِهِ وَ لَمْ يُقِمْ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ فَهِيَ عُمْرَةٌ فَإِنِ اِعْتَمَرَ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ أَوْ قَبْلَهُ فَأَقَامَ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ فَلَيْسَ بِمُتَمَتِّعٍ وَ إِنَّمَا هُوَ مُجَاوِرٌ أَفْرَدَ اَلْعُمْرَةَ فَإِنْ هُوَ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يَتَمَتَّعَ فِي أَشْهُرِ اَلْحَجِّ «بِالْعُمْرَةِ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ» فَلْيَخْرُجْ مِنْهَا حَتَّى يُجَاوِزَ ذَاتَ عِرْقٍ أَوْ يُجَاوِزَ عُسْفَانَ فَيَدْخُلَ مُتَمَتِّعاً بِعُمْرَةٍ إِلَى اَلْحَجِّ فَإِنْ هُوَ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يُفْرِدَ اَلْحَجَّ فَلْيَخْرُجْ إِلَى اَلْجِعْرَانَةِ فَيُلَبِّيَ مِنْهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2937 - Sama'ah ibn Mehran narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever performs Umrah in Shawwal with the intention of returning to their homeland without staying until Hajj, there is no harm in doing so. However, if they stay until Hajj, they are considered Mutamatti‘ (one performing Tamattu‘), as the months of Hajj are Shawwal, Dhu al-Qa'dah, and Dhu al-Hijjah. Whoever performs Umrah during these months and stays until Hajj, it is Tamattu‘. But if they return to their homeland and do not stay until Hajj, it is considered merely an Umrah.
If one performs Umrah in Month of Ramadan or before it and stays until Hajj, they are not Mutamatti‘ but rather a Mujawir (resident performing separate Umrah and Hajj). In this case, the Umrah is considered separate. If they wish to perform Tamattu‘ in the months of Hajj, they must exit the state of Ihram by traveling beyond Dhat ‘Irq or Asfan and then re-enter in Ihram for Umrah, intending Tamattu‘ leading to Hajj.
If one prefers to perform only Hajj without Tamattu‘, they should go to al-Ji’ranah and enter Ihram from there."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2938 - Umar ibn Yazid narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Whoever performs an independent Umrah (Umrah Mufradah) may return to their family whenever they wish, unless they are still present when the people set out on the Day of Tarwiyah (8th of Dhu al-Hijjah)."
arabicText: 2938 - وَ رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «مَنِ اِعْتَمَرَ عُمْرَةً مُفْرَدَةً فَلَهُ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ إِلَى أَهْلِهِ مَتَى شَاءَ إِلاَّ أَنْ يُدْرِكَهُ خُرُوجُ اَلنَّاسِ يَوْمَ اَلتَّرْوِيَةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2938 - Umar ibn Yazid narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever performs an independent Umrah (Umrah Mufradah) may return to their family whenever they wish, unless they are still present when the people set out on the Day of Tarwiyah (8th of Dhu al-Hijjah)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2939 - In a narration from Abdul-Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
"Umrah performed during the first ten days (of Dhu al-Hijjah) is considered Tamattu‘."
arabicText: 2939 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْعُمْرَةُ فِي اَلْعَشْرِ مُتْعَةٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2939 - In a narration from Abdul-Rahman ibn Abi Abdullah, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Umrah performed during the first ten days (of Dhu al-Hijjah) is considered Tamattu‘."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2940 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who performed Hajj as Ifrad (Hajj without Umrah). Can he perform Umrah after completing Hajj?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, if the razor has touched his head (he has completed the rites of Hajj), then it is good."
arabicText: 2940 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَفْرَدَ اَلْحَجَّ هَلْ لَهُ أَنْ يَعْتَمِرَ بَعْدَ اَلْحَجِّ فَقَالَ «نَعَمْ إِذَا أَمْكَنَ اَلْمُوسَى مِنْ رَأْسِهِ فَحَسَنٌ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2940 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated:
Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man who performed Hajj as Ifrad (Hajj without Umrah). Can he perform Umrah after completing Hajj?
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, if the razor has touched his head (he has completed the rites of Hajj), then it is good."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2941 - Al-Mufaddal ibn Salih narrated from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Umrah is an obligation like Hajj. When one performs Tamattu‘, they have fulfilled the obligatory Umrah."
arabicText: 2941 - وَ رَوَى اَلْمُفَضَّلُ بْنُ صَالِحٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْعُمْرَةُ مَفْرُوضَةٌ مِثْلُ اَلْحَجِّ فَإِذَا أَدَّى اَلْمُتْعَةَ فَقَدْ أَدَّى اَلْعُمْرَةَ اَلْمَفْرُوضَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2941 - Al-Mufaddal ibn Salih narrated from Abu Basir, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Umrah is an obligation like Hajj. When one performs Tamattu‘, they have fulfilled the obligatory Umrah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2942 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Imam (as) about a servant who is out grazing animals and agrees to perform Umrah and then leave.
Imam (as) said: "If he performed Umrah in Dhu al-Qa'dah, it is good. But if it is in Dhu al-Hijjah, then it is not suitable except for Hajj."
arabicText: 2942 - وَ سَأَلَهُ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ : عَنِ اَلْمَمْلُوكِ يَكُونُ فِي اَلظَّهْرِ يَرْعَى وَ هُوَ يَرْضَى أَنْ يَعْتَمِرَ ثُمَّ يَخْرُجَ فَقَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ اِعْتَمَرَ فِي ذِي اَلْقَعْدَةِ فَحَسَنٌ وَ إِنْ كَانَ فِي ذِي اَلْحِجَّةِ فَلاَ يَصْلُحُ إِلاَّ اَلْحَجُّ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2942 - Abdullah ibn Sinan asked Imam (as) about a servant who is out grazing animals and agrees to perform Umrah and then leave.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he performed Umrah in Dhu al-Qa'dah, it is good. But if it is in Dhu al-Hijjah, then it is not suitable except for Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing ʿumrah During the Months of Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2943 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) performed three separate Umrahs, all of them in Dhu al-Qa'dah:
The Umrah of Hudaybiyyah: He entered the state of Ihram for it from Usfan.
The Umrah of Qadha': He entered the state of Ihram for it from Al-Juhfah.
The Umrah of Ji'ranah: This was after he returned from Ta’if following the Battle of Hunayn, and he entered the state of Ihram for it from Al-Ji'ranah.
arabicText: 2943 - وَ اِعْتَمَرَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ثَلاَثَ عُمَرٍ مُتَفَرِّقَاتٍ كُلُّهَا فِي ذِي اَلْقَعْدَةِ عُمْرَةً أَهَلَّ فِيهَا مِنْ عُسْفَانَ وَ هِيَ عُمْرَةُ اَلْحُدَيْبِيَةِ وَ عُمْرَةَ اَلْقَضَاءِ أَحْرَمَ فِيهَا مِنَ اَلْجُحْفَةِ وَ عُمْرَةً أَهَلَّ فِيهَا مِنَ اَلْجِعْرَانَةِ وَ هِيَ بَعْدَ أَنْ رَجَعَ مِنَ اَلطَّائِفِ مِنْ غَزْوَةِ حُنَيْنٍ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Declaring the Intention (ihlal) for a Nullified Umrah, Its Termination, and Its Rites
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2944 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If an Mu'tamir (one performing Umrah) enters Mecca without intending Tamattu‘, performs Tawaf of the House, prays two rak'ahs at the Maqam of Ibrahim (as), and performs Sa'i between Safa and Marwah, he may return to his family if he wishes."
arabicText: 2944 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا دَخَلَ اَلْمُعْتَمِرُ مَكَّةَ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَمَتُّعٍ وَ طَافَ بِالْبَيْتِ وَ صَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ عِنْدَ مَقَامِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ سَعَى بَيْنَ اَلصَّفَا وَ اَلْمَرْوَةِ فَلْيَلْحَقْ بِأَهْلِهِ إِنْ شَاءَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2944 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If an Mu'tamir (one performing Umrah) enters Mecca without intending Tamattu‘, performs Tawaf of the House, prays two rak'ahs at the Maqam of Ibrahim (as), and performs Sa'i between Safa and Marwah, he may return to his family if he wishes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
