chapter: Chapter on Declaring the Intention (ihlal) for a Nullified Umrah, Its Termination, and Its Rites
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2945 - It was narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
"Whoever brings a sacrificial animal during Umrah should slaughter it before shaving his head."
Imam (as) further said: "And whoever brings a sacrificial animal while performing Umrah should slaughter it at the designated slaughtering place (Manhar), which is between Safa and Marwah, at al-Hazwarah."
arabicText: 2945 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «مَنْ سَاقَ هَدْياً فِي عُمْرَةٍ فَلْيَنْحَرْ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَحْلِقَ رَأْسَهُ » قَالَ «وَ مَنْ سَاقَ هَدْياً وَ هُوَ مُعْتَمِرٌ نَحَرَ هَدْيَهُ عِنْدَ اَلْمَنْحَرِ وَ هُوَ بَيْنَ اَلصَّفَا وَ اَلْمَرْوَةِ وَ هِيَ اَلْحَزْوَرَةُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2945 - It was narrated from Imam (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever brings a sacrificial animal during Umrah should slaughter it before shaving his head."
Imam (as) further said: "And whoever brings a sacrificial animal while performing Umrah should slaughter it at the designated slaughtering place (Manhar), which is between Safa and Marwah, at al-Hazwarah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Declaring the Intention (ihlal) for a Nullified Umrah, Its Termination, and Its Rites
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2946 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Misma' ibn Abdul-Malik, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who performs an independent Umrah (Umrah Mufradah), then performs the Tawaf of obligation around the Ka'bah, but has marital relations with his wife before performing Sa'i between Safa and Marwah.
Imam (as) said: "He has invalidated his Umrah, and he must offer a camel (badnah) as a penalty. He should remain in Mecca until the month in which he performed the Umrah has passed. Then he must go to the Miqat specified by the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) for the people of his region, enter into Ihram from there, and perform a new Umrah."
arabicText: 2946 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ مِسْمَعِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اَلْمَلِكِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَعْتَمِرُ عُمْرَةً مُفْرَدَةً ثُمَّ يَطُوفُ بِالْبَيْتِ طَوَافَ اَلْفَرِيضَةِ ثُمَّ يَغْشَى اِمْرَأَتَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَسْعَى بَيْنَ اَلصَّفَا وَ اَلْمَرْوَةِ قَالَ «قَدْ أَفْسَدَ عُمْرَتَهُ وَ عَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ وَ يُقِيمُ بِمَكَّةَ حَتَّى يَخْرُجَ اَلشَّهْرُ اَلَّذِي اِعْتَمَرَ فِيهِ ثُمَّ يَخْرُجُ إِلَى اَلْوَقْتِ اَلَّذِي وَقَّتَهُ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ لِأَهْلِهِ فَيُحْرِمُ مِنْهُ وَ يَعْتَمِرُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2946 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Misma' ibn Abdul-Malik, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who performs an independent Umrah (Umrah Mufradah), then performs the Tawaf of obligation around the Ka'bah, but has marital relations with his wife before performing Sa'i between Safa and Marwah.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He has invalidated his Umrah, and he must offer a camel (badnah) as a penalty. He should remain in Mecca until the month in which he performed the Umrah has passed. Then he must go to the Miqat specified by the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) for the people of his region, enter into Ihram from there, and perform a new Umrah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Declaring the Intention (ihlal) for a Nullified Umrah, Its Termination, and Its Rites
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2947 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Burayd al-‘Ijli, from Abu Ja'far (as):
"He (a person who invalidates their Umrah) must go out to one of the Miqats, enter Ihram from there, and perform a new Umrah."
arabicText: 2947 - وَ قَدْ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ اَلْعِجْلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ يَخْرُجُ إِلَى بَعْضِ اَلْمَوَاقِيتِ فَيُحْرِمُ مِنْهُ وَ يَعْتَمِرُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2947 - Ali ibn Ri'ab narrated from Burayd al-‘Ijli, from Abu Ja'far (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "He (a person who invalidates their Umrah) must go out to one of the Miqats, enter Ihram from there, and perform a new Umrah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Declaring the Intention (ihlal) for a Nullified Umrah, Its Termination, and Its Rites
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2948 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Salim ibn al-Fudhayl, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "We have entered Mecca for Umrah. Should we trim (taqsir) or shave (halq)?"
Imam (as) said: "Shave, for the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) invoked mercy for those who shave their heads three times and for those who trim their hair only once."
arabicText: 2948 - وَ رَوَى صَفْوَانُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ سَالِمِ بْنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ دَخَلْنَا بِعُمْرَةٍ فَنُقَصِّرُ أَوْ نَحْلِقُ فَقَالَ «اِحْلِقْ فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ تَرَحَّمَ عَلَى اَلْمُحَلِّقِينَ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ وَ عَلَى اَلْمُقَصِّرِينَ مَرَّةً.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2948 - Safwan ibn Yahya narrated from Salim ibn al-Fudhayl, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "We have entered Mecca for Umrah. Should we trim (taqsir) or shave (halq)?"
Imam (as) said: "Shave, for the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) invoked mercy for those who shave their heads three times and for those who trim their hair only once."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Umrah in the Month of Ramadan, Rajab, and Other Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2949 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he was asked:
"Which Umrah is better, an Umrah in the month of Rajab or an Umrah in the Month of Ramadan?"
Imam (as) said: "No, an Umrah in the month of Rajab is better."
arabicText: 2949 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ أَيُّ اَلْعُمْرَةِ أَفْضَلُ عُمْرَةٌ فِي رَجَبٍ أَوْ عُمْرَةٌ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَلْ عُمْرَةٌ فِي شَهْرِ رَجَبٍ أَفْضَلُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2949 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he was asked:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Which Umrah is better, an Umrah in the month of Rajab or an Umrah in the Month of Ramadan?"
Imam (as) said: "No, an Umrah in the month of Rajab is better."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Umrah in the Month of Ramadan, Rajab, and Other Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2950 - It was narrated from Abdul-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who enters Ihram in one month and exits Ihram in another month.
Imam (as) said: "He will be rewarded according to his intention."
And Imam (as) also said: "He will be rewarded for the better of the two months."
arabicText: 2950 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَبْدُ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ اَلْحَجَّاجِ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَحْرَمَ فِي شَهْرٍ وَ أَحَلَّ فِي آخَرَ قَالَ «يُكْتَبُ لَهُ فِي اَلَّذِي نَوَى » وَ قَالَ «يُكْتَبُ لَهُ فِي أَفْضَلِهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2950 - It was narrated from Abdul-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a man who enters Ihram in one month and exits Ihram in another month.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) said: "He will be rewarded according to his intention."
And Imam (as) also said: "He will be rewarded for the better of the two months."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Umrah in the Month of Ramadan, Rajab, and Other Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2951 - In a narration from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
"If you enter Ihram with one day and night remaining in the month of Rajab, your Umrah will be considered a Rajabi Umrah."
arabicText: 2951 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا أَحْرَمْتَ وَ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ رَجَبٍ يَوْمٌ وَ لَيْلَةٌ فَعُمْرَتُكَ رَجَبِيَّةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2951 - In a narration from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you enter Ihram with one day and night remaining in the month of Rajab, your Umrah will be considered a Rajabi Umrah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2952 - Umar ibn Yazid narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Whoever wishes to leave Mecca to perform Umrah should enter Ihram from Al-Ji'ranah, Al-Hudaybiyah, or similar locations. And whoever leaves Mecca intending Umrah and then enters in the state of Ihram should not stop reciting the Talbiyah until they see the Ka'bah."
arabicText: 2952 - رَوَى عُمَرُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «مَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ مِنْ مَكَّةَ لِيَعْتَمِرَ أَحْرَمَ مِنَ اَلْجِعْرَانَةِ وَ اَلْحُدَيْبِيَةِ وَ مَا أَشْبَهَهُمَا وَ مَنْ خَرَجَ مِنْ مَكَّةَ يُرِيدُ اَلْعُمْرَةَ ثُمَّ دَخَلَ مُعْتَمِراً لَمْ يَقْطَعِ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ حَتَّى يَنْظُرَ إِلَى اَلْكَعْبَةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2952 - Umar ibn Yazid narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever wishes to leave Mecca to perform Umrah should enter Ihram from Al-Ji'ranah, Al-Hudaybiyah, or similar locations. And whoever leaves Mecca intending Umrah and then enters in the state of Ihram should not stop reciting the Talbiyah until they see the Ka'bah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2953 - It was narrated:
"The Talbiyah should be discontinued when one sees the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram)."
arabicText: 2953 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّهُ يَقْطَعُ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ إِذَا نَظَرَ إِلَى اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلْحَرَامِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2953 - It was narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Talbiyah should be discontinued when one sees the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2954 - It was narrated:
"The Talbiyah should be discontinued when one enters the boundary of the Sacred Precinct (Haram)."
arabicText: 2954 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّهُ يَقْطَعُ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ إِذَا دَخَلَ أَوَّلَ اَلْحَرَمِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2954 - It was narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Talbiyah should be discontinued when one enters the boundary of the Sacred Precinct (Haram)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2955 - In a narration from Al-Fudhayl, he said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "I entered Mecca for Umrah; where should I stop the Talbiyah?"
Imam (as) said: "At the height of the Aqabah of the Madinites."
I asked: "Where is the Aqabah of the Madinites?"
Imam (as) replied: "At the location of the Qassarun (the dyers' area)."
arabicText: 2955 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قُلْتُ دَخَلْتُ بِعُمْرَةٍ فَأَيْنَ أَقْطَعُ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ فَقَالَ «بِحِيَالِ اَلْعَقَبَةِ عَقَبَةِ اَلْمَدَنِيِّينَ » قُلْتُ أَيْنَ عَقَبَةُ اَلْمَدَنِيِّينَ قَالَ «بِحِيَالِ اَلْقَصَّارِينَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2955 - In a narration from Al-Fudhayl, he said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as): "I entered Mecca for Umrah; where should I stop the Talbiyah?"
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"At the height of the Aqabah of the Madinites."
I asked: "Where is the Aqabah of the Madinites?"
Imam (as) replied: "At the location of the Qassarun (the dyers' area)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2956 - It was narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man performing an independent Umrah Mufradah.
Imam (as) said: "When you see Dhu Tuwa, stop the Talbiyah."
arabicText: 2956 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَعْتَمِرُ عُمْرَةً مُفْرَدَةً فَقَالَ «إِذَا رَأَيْتَ ذَا طُوًى فَاقْطَعِ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2956 - It was narrated from Yunus ibn Ya'qub, who said:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man performing an independent Umrah Mufradah.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "When you see Dhu Tuwa, stop the Talbiyah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2957 - In a narration from Murazim, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
"The one performing Umrah Mufradah should stop the Talbiyah when the camels place their hooves within the Haram."
arabicText: 2957 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ مُرَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «يَقْطَعُ صَاحِبُ اَلْعُمْرَةِ اَلْمُفْرَدَةِ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ إِذَا وَضَعَتِ اَلْإِبِلُ أَخْفَافَهَا فِي اَلْحَرَمِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2957 - In a narration from Murazim, from Abu Abdullah (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The one performing Umrah Mufradah should stop the Talbiyah when the camels place their hooves within the Haram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Miqats for ʿumrah From Makkah and the Termination of the Talbiyah by the Performer of ʿumrah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2958 - It was narrated:
"The Talbiyah should be discontinued when one sees the houses of Mecca."
arabicText: 2958 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّهُ يَقْطَعُ اَلتَّلْبِيَةَ إِذَا نَظَرَ إِلَى بُيُوتِ مَكَّةَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2958 - It was narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Talbiyah should be discontinued when one sees the houses of Mecca."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Months of Hajj, the Months of Pilgrimage, and the Sacred Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2959 - Zurara narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "Hajj is [during] well-known months" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:197).
Imam (as) said: "Shawwal, Dhu al-Qa'dah, and Dhu al-Hijjah. No one is permitted to enter Ihram for Hajj outside of these months."
arabicText:
2959 - رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «۝ اَلْحَجُّ أَشْهُرٌ مَعْلُومٰاتٌ ۝»
قَالَ « شَوَّالٌ وَ ذُو اَلْقَعْدَةِ وَ ذُو اَلْحِجَّةِ لَيْسَ لِأَحَدٍ أَنْ يُحْرِمَ بِالْحَجِّ فِيمَا سِوَاهُنَّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2959 - Zurara narrated from Abu Ja'far (as) regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "Hajj is [during] well-known months" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:197).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Shawwal, Dhu al-Qa'dah, and Dhu al-Hijjah. No one is permitted to enter Ihram for Hajj outside of these months."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Months of Hajj, the Months of Pilgrimage, and the Sacred Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2960 - In another narration:
"And a month designated specifically for Umrah is Rajab."
arabicText: 2960 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةٍ أُخْرَى : «وَ شَهْرٌ مُفْرَدٌ لِعُمْرَةٍ رَجَبٌ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Months of Hajj, the Months of Pilgrimage, and the Sacred Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2961 - Imam (as) said:
"Allah (swt), the Exalted, has not created on the earth a spot more beloved to Him than the Ka'bah, nor more honored by Him. For its sake, Allah (swt), the Exalted, sanctified the four sacred months in His Book 'on the day He created the heavens and the earth' (Surah At-Tawbah 9:36).
Three of these months are consecutive for Hajj, and one is designated specifically for Umrah, which is Rajab."
arabicText: 2961 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «مَا خَلَقَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي اَلْأَرْضِ بُقْعَةً أَحَبَّ إِلَيْهِ مِنَ اَلْكَعْبَةِ وَ لاَ أَكْرَمَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْهَا وَ لَهَا حَرَّمَ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ، اَلْأَشْهُرَ اَلْحُرُمَ اَلْأَرْبَعَةَ فِي كِتَابِهِ «۝ يَوْمَ خَلَقَ اَلسَّمٰاوٰاتِ وَ اَلْأَرْضَ ۝» ثَلاَثَةٌ مِنْهَا مُتَوَالِيَةٌ لِلْحَجِّ وَ شَهْرٌ مُفْرَدٌ لِلْعُمْرَةِ رَجَبٌ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Months of Hajj, the Months of Pilgrimage, and the Sacred Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2962 - Imam (as) said regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "So travel freely throughout the land for four months" (Quran 9:2):
"These are twenty days of Dhu al-Hijjah, the month of Muharram, Safar, the month of Rabi' al-Awwal, and ten days of Rabi' al-Thani. The ten days of the beginning of Dhu al-Hijjah are not counted among the four months."
arabicText:
2962 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: «۝ فَسِيحُوا فِي اَلْأَرْضِ أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ ۝»
قَالَ «عِشْرِينَ مِنْ ذِي اَلْحِجَّةِ وَ اَلْمُحَرَّمَ وَ صَفَرَ وَ شَهْرَ رَبِيعٍ اَلْأَوَّلِ وَ عَشَرَةَ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَبِيعٍ اَلْآخِرِ وَ لاَ يُحْسَبُ فِي اَلْأَرْبَعَةِ اَلْأَشْهُرِ، عَشَرَةُ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ أَوَّلِ ذِي اَلْحِجَّةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2962 - Imam (as) said regarding the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "So travel freely throughout the land for four months" (Quran 9:2):
thaqalaynMatn: "These are twenty days of Dhu al-Hijjah, the month of Muharram, Safar, the month of Rabi' al-Awwal, and ten days of Rabi' al-Thani. The ten days of the beginning of Dhu al-Hijjah are not counted among the four months."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Months of Hajj, the Months of Pilgrimage, and the Sacred Months
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2963 - Abu Ja'far al-Ahwal narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who enters Ihram for Hajj outside of the months of Hajj.
Imam (as) said: "He should make it an Umrah."
arabicText: 2963 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ اَلْأَحْوَلُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ فَرَضَ اَلْحَجَّ فِي غَيْرِ أَشْهُرِ اَلْحَجِّ قَالَ «يَجْعَلُهَا عُمْرَةً ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2963 - Abu Ja'far al-Ahwal narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who enters Ihram for Hajj outside of the months of Hajj.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He should make it an Umrah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Umrah Every Month and Its Minimum Interval
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2964 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"The year has twelve months, and an Umrah can be performed in each month."
arabicText: 2964 - رَوَى إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «اَلسَّنَةُ اِثْنَا عَشَرَ شَهْراً يُعْتَمَرُ لِكُلِّ شَهْرٍ عُمْرَةٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2964 - Ishaq ibn Ammar narrated that Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The year has twelve months, and an Umrah can be performed in each month."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Umrah Every Month and Its Minimum Interval
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2965 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Abu al-Hasan Musa (as), who said:
"There is an Umrah for every month."
I asked him: "Can it be less than that?"
Imam (as) said: "There is an Umrah for every ten days."
arabicText: 2965 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لِكُلِّ شَهْرٍ عُمْرَةٌ» قَالَ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أَ يَكُونُ أَقَلَّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ قَالَ «لِكُلِّ عَشَرَةِ أَيَّامٍ عُمْرَةٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2965 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Abu al-Hasan Musa (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is an Umrah for every month."
I asked him: "Can it be less than that?"
Imam (as) said: "There is an Umrah for every ten days."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Performing Umrah Every Month and Its Minimum Interval
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2966 - Aban narrated from Abu al-Jarud, from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about performing Umrah after Hajj in Dhu al-Hijjah.
Imam (as) said: "It is good."
arabicText: 2966 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْجَارُودِ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْعُمْرَةِ بَعْدَ اَلْحَجِّ فِي ذِي اَلْحِجَّةِ قَالَ «حَسَنٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2966 - Aban narrated from Abu al-Jarud, from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about performing Umrah after Hajj in Dhu al-Hijjah.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "It is good."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What a Person Should Say When Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2967 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Al-Halabi, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a man performing Hajj on behalf of his brother, his father, or another person. Should he say anything specific?
Imam (as) said: "Yes, after entering into Ihram, he should say: 'O Allah (swt), whatever hardship, difficulty, trial, or dishevelment I experience during this journey, grant its reward to [the person on whose behalf the Hajj is performed], and reward me for fulfilling it on their behalf.'"
arabicText: 2967 - رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ اَلْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَقْضِي عَنْ أَخِيهِ أَوْ عَنْ أَبِيهِ أَوْ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مِنَ اَلنَّاسِ اَلْحَجَّ هَلْ يَنْبَغِي لَهُ أَنْ يَتَكَلَّمَ بِشَيْءٍ قَالَ «نَعَمْ يَقُولُ عِنْدَ إِحْرَامِهِ بَعْدَ مَا يُحْرِمُ اَللَّهُمَّ مَا أَصَابَنِي فِي سَفَرِي هَذَا مِنْ نَصَبٍ أَوْ شِدَّةٍ أَوْ بَلاَءٍ أَوْ شَعَثٍ فَأْجُرْ فُلاَناً فِيهِ وَ أْجُرْنِي فِي قَضَائِي عَنْهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2967 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Al-Halabi, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
I asked him about a man performing Hajj on behalf of his brother, his father, or another person. Should he say anything specific?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "Yes, after entering into Ihram, he should say: 'O Allah (swt), whatever hardship, difficulty, trial, or dishevelment I experience during this journey, grant its reward to [the person on whose behalf the Hajj is performed], and reward me for fulfilling it on their behalf.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What a Person Should Say When Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2968 - In a narration from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, Abu Abdullah (as) said:
"If you wish to perform Tawaf around the Ka'bah on behalf of one of your brothers, go to the Black Stone and say: 'In the name of Allah (swt), O Allah (swt), accept this from [the name of the person].'"
arabicText: 2968 - وَفِي رِوَايَةِ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ السَّلَامُ : إِذَا أَرَدْتَ أَنْ تَطُوفَ بِالْبَيْتِ عَنْ أَحَدٍ مِنْ إِخْوَانِكَ، فَائْتِ الْحَجَرَ الْأَسْوَدَ وَقُلْ: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنْ فُلَانٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2968 - In a narration from Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar, Abu Abdullah (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you wish to perform Tawaf around the Ka'bah on behalf of one of your brothers, go to the Black Stone and say: 'In the name of Allah (swt), O Allah (swt), accept this from [the name of the person].'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What a Person Should Say When Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2969 - It was narrated from al-Bazanti that a man asked Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as) about a person performing Hajj on behalf of another. Should he mention that person's name explicitly?
Imam (as) replied: "Allah (swt), the Exalted, is not unaware of anything."
arabicText: 2969 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْبَزَنْطِيِّ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ اَلْأَوَّلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَحُجُّ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يُسَمِّيهِ بِاسْمِهِ قَالَ «اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لاَ تَخْفَى عَلَيْهِ خَافِيَةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2969 - It was narrated from al-Bazanti that a man asked Abu al-Hasan al-Awwal (as) about a person performing Hajj on behalf of another. Should he mention that person's name explicitly?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "Allah (swt), the Exalted, is not unaware of anything."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What a Person Should Say When Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2970 - It was narrated from Muthanna ibn Abdul-Salam, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a person performing Hajj on behalf of someone else. Should he mention that person’s name at every station?
Imam (as) said: "If he wishes, he may do so, and if he wishes, he may not. Allah (swt) knows that he has performed Hajj on their behalf. However, he should mention the person's name when offering the sacrifice (udhiyah) at the time of slaughter."
arabicText: 2970 - وَ رَوَى مُثَنَّى بْنُ عَبْدِ اَلسَّلاَمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَحُجُّ عَنِ اَلْإِنْسَانِ يَذْكُرُهُ فِي اَلْمَوَاطِنِ كُلِّهَا قَالَ «إِنْ شَاءَ فَعَلَ وَ إِنْ شَاءَ لَمْ يَفْعَلْ اَللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُ قَدْ حَجَّ عَنْهُ وَ لَكِنْ يَذْكُرُهُ عِنْدَ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ إِذَا هُوَ ذَبَحَهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2970 - It was narrated from Muthanna ibn Abdul-Salam, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding a person performing Hajj on behalf of someone else. Should he mention that person’s name at every station?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he wishes, he may do so, and if he wishes, he may not. Allah (swt) knows that he has performed Hajj on their behalf. However, he should mention the person's name when offering the sacrifice (udhiyah) at the time of slaughter."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Person Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another or Sharing a Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2971 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated: I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "My father has performed Hajj, my mother has performed Hajj, and my two brothers have also performed Hajj. I wish to include them in my Hajj, as I would love for them to be with me."
Imam (as) said: "Include them with you. Allah (swt), the Exalted, will grant them the reward of Hajj, and you will also have your Hajj, along with a reward for maintaining ties with them."
arabicText: 2971 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ أَبِي قَدْ حَجَّ وَ وَالِدَتِي قَدْ حَجَّتْ وَ إِنَّ أَخَوَيَّ قَدْ حَجَّا وَ قَدْ أَرَدْتُ أَنْ أُدْخِلَهُمْ فِي حَجَّتِي كَأَنِّي قَدْ أَحْبَبْتُ أَنْ يَكُونُوا مَعِي فَقَالَ «اِجْعَلْهُمْ مَعَكَ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ جَاعِلٌ لَهُمْ حَجّاً وَ لَكَ حَجّاً وَ لَكَ أَجْراً بِصِلَتِكَ إِيَّاهُمْ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2971 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated: I said to Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"My father has performed Hajj, my mother has performed Hajj, and my two brothers have also performed Hajj. I wish to include them in my Hajj, as I would love for them to be with me."
Imam (as) said: "Include them with you. Allah (swt), the Exalted, will grant them the reward of Hajj, and you will also have your Hajj, along with a reward for maintaining ties with them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Person Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another or Sharing a Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2972 - Imam (as) said:
"Prayer, fasting, Hajj, charity, and emancipation (of slaves) reach the deceased in their grave."
arabicText: 2972 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «يَدْخُلُ عَلَى اَلْمَيِّتِ فِي قَبْرِهِ اَلصَّلاَةُ وَ اَلصَّوْمُ وَ اَلْحَجُّ وَ اَلصَّدَقَةُ وَ اَلْعِتْقُ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on a Person Performing Hajj or Tawaf on Behalf of Another or Sharing a Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2973 - A man said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"May I be your ransom! I had intended to include my mother or some of my family in my Hajj this year, but I forgot."
Imam (as) replied: "Do it now; include them both."
arabicText: 2973 - وَ قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِلصَّادِقِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنِّي كُنْتُ نَوَيْتُ أَنْ أُشْرِكَ فِي حَجَّتِي اَلْعَامَ أُمِّي أَوْ بَعْضَ أَهْلِي فَنَسِيتُ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «اَلْآنَ فَأَشْرِكْهُمَا».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2973 - A man said to Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as):
"May I be your ransom! I had intended to include my mother or some of my family in my Hajj this year, but I forgot."
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do it now; include them both."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Departing Early to Mina Before the Day of Tarwiyah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2974 - It was narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
I said to Abu al-Hasan (as): "Can a person leave for Mina a day or two before the Day of Tarwiyah to avoid the crowd and congestion?"
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."
arabicText: 2974 - رُوِيَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَتَعَجَّلُ اَلرَّجُلُ قَبْلَ اَلتَّرْوِيَةِ بِيَوْمٍ أَوْ يَوْمَيْنِ مِنْ أَجْلِ اَلزِّحَامِ وَ ضِغَاطِ اَلنَّاسِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2974 - It was narrated from Ishaq ibn Ammar, who said:
I said to Abu al-Hasan (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"Can a person leave for Mina a day or two before the Day of Tarwiyah to avoid the crowd and congestion?"
Imam (as) said: "There is no harm in it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Departing Early to Mina Before the Day of Tarwiyah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2975 - In another narration, Imam (as) said:
"A person should not leave earlier than three days in advance."
arabicText: 2975 - وَ قَالَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : «لاَ يَتَعَجَّلُ بِأَكْثَرَ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2975 - In another narration, Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A person should not leave earlier than three days in advance."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Departing Early to Mina Before the Day of Tarwiyah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2976 - Jamil ibn Darraj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"It is incumbent upon the Imam to pray the Zuhr prayer in Mina, spend the night there, and remain until sunrise. Then, he should depart for Arafat."
arabicText: 2976 - وَ رَوَى جَمِيلُ بْنُ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «عَلَى اَلْإِمَامِ أَنْ يُصَلِّيَ اَلظُّهْرَ بِمِنًى ثُمَّ يَبِيتَ بِهَا وَ يُصْبِحَ حَتَّى تَطْلُعَ اَلشَّمْسُ ثُمَّ يَخْرُجَ إِلَى عَرَفَاتٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2976 - Jamil ibn Darraj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is incumbent upon the Imam to pray the Zuhr prayer in Mina, spend the night there, and remain until sunrise. Then, he should depart for Arafat."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Departing Early to Mina Before the Day of Tarwiyah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2977 - Muhammad ibn Muslim asked Abu Ja'far (as):
"Did the Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) pray the Zuhr prayer in Mina on the Day of Tarwiyah?"
Imam (as) said: "Yes, and also the Fajr prayer on the Day of Arafah."
arabicText: 2977 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : هَلْ صَلَّى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَلظُّهْرَ، بِمِنًى يَوْمَ اَلتَّرْوِيَةِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ وَ اَلْغَدَاةَ يَوْمَ عَرَفَةَ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Boundaries of Mina, Arafat, and Muzdalifah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2978 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar and Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"The boundary of Mina extends from Al-Aqabah to the Valley of Muhassir, and the boundary of Arafat extends from Al-Mazameen to the farthest point of the standing area (Mawqif)."
arabicText: 2978 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ وَ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «حَدُّ مِنًى مِنَ اَلْعَقَبَةِ إِلَى وَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ وَ حَدٌّ عَرَفَاتٍ مِنَ اَلْمَأْزِمَيْنِ إِلَى أَقْصَى اَلْمَوْقِفِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2978 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar and Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The boundary of Mina extends from Al-Aqabah to the Valley of Muhassir, and the boundary of Arafat extends from Al-Mazameen to the farthest point of the standing area (Mawqif)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Boundaries of Mina, Arafat, and Muzdalifah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2979 - Imam (as) said:
"The boundary of Arafat includes the Valley of 'Uranah, Thuwiyyah, Namirah, and Dhi al-Majaz, and extends behind the mountain to its rear."
arabicText: 2979 - وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «حَدُّ عَرَفَةَ مِنْ بَطْنِ عُرَنَةَ وَ ثَوِيَّةَ وَ نَمِرَةَ وَ ذِي اَلْمَجَازِ وَ خَلْفَ اَلْجَبَلِ مَوْقِفٌ إِلَى وَرَاءِ اَلْجَبَلِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2979 - Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The boundary of Arafat includes the Valley of 'Uranah, Thuwiyyah, Namirah, and Dhi al-Majaz, and extends behind the mountain to its rear."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Boundaries of Mina, Arafat, and Muzdalifah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2980 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) stood at Arafat on the left side of the mountain. People rushed to the place where the hooves of his camel had been, trying to stand beside it. He moved the camel away, but they repeated the same behavior.
He (sw) said: "O people, it is not the spot beneath the hooves of my camel that is the place of standing (Mawqif), but rather, all of this is a place of standing." He gestured with his hand and said: "All of Arafat is a place of standing. If only the area beneath the hooves of my camel were valid, it would not suffice for the people."
He (sw) did the same at Muzdalifah, stating that the whole area is a valid place of standing.
He advised: "If you see a gap, move forward and fill it with yourself and your mount, for Allah (swt) loves that these gaps are filled. Avoid standing on the ridges, and beware of Al-Araak, Namirah, the Valley of 'Uranah, Thuwiyyah, and Dhi al-Majaz, as these are not part of Arafat."
arabicText: 2980 - وَ وَقَفَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِعَرَفَةَ فِي مَيْسَرَةِ اَلْجَبَلِ فَجَعَلَ اَلنَّاسُ يَبْتَدِرُونَ أَخْفَافَ نَاقَتِهِ فَيَقِفُونَ إِلَى جَانِبِهَا فَنَحَّاهَا فَفَعَلُوا مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ «أَيُّهَا اَلنَّاسُ إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ مَوْضِعُ أَخْفَافِ نَاقَتِي بِالْمَوْقِفِ وَ لَكِنْ هَذَا كُلُّهُ مَوْقِفٌ» وَ أَشَارَ بِيَدِهِ وَ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ « عَرَفَةُ كُلُّهَا مَوْقِفٌ وَ لَوْ لَمْ يَكُنْ إِلاَّ مَا تَحْتَ خُفِّ نَاقَتِي لَمْ يَسَعِ اَلنَّاسَ ذَلِكَ» وَ فَعَلَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فِي اَلْمُزْدَلِفَةِ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ فَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ خَلَلاً فَتَقَدَّمْ فَسُدَّهُ بِنَفْسِكَ وَ رَاحِلَتِكَ فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَعَالَى يُحِبُّ أَنْ تُسَدَّ تِلْكَ اَلْخِلاَلُ وَ اِنْتَقِلْ عَنِ اَلْهِضَابِ وَ اِتَّقِ اَلْأَرَاكَ وَ نَمِرَةَ وَ هِيَ بَطْنُ عُرَنَةَ وَ ثَوِيَّةَ وَ ذَا اَلْمَجَازِ فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2980 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) stood at Arafat on the left side of the mountain. People rushed to the place where the hooves of his camel had been, trying to stand beside it. He moved the camel away, but they repeated the same behavior.
He (sw) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O people, it is not the spot beneath the hooves of my camel that is the place of standing (Mawqif), but rather, all of this is a place of standing." He gestured with his hand and said: "All of Arafat is a place of standing. If only the area beneath the hooves of my camel were valid, it would not suffice for the people."
He (sw) did the same at Muzdalifah, stating that the whole area is a valid place of standing.
He advised: "If you see a gap, move forward and fill it with yourself and your mount, for Allah (swt) loves that these gaps are filled. Avoid standing on the ridges, and beware of Al-Araak, Namirah, the Valley of 'Uranah, Thuwiyyah, and Dhi al-Majaz, as these are not part of Arafat."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Boundaries of Mina, Arafat, and Muzdalifah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2981 - In another narration, Imam (as) said:
"Those who stand under the Araak trees have no valid Hajj, as they are not within the designated standing area (Arafat)."
arabicText: 2981 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ قَالَ : «أَصْحَابُ اَلْأَرَاكِ لاَ حَجَّ لَهُمْ وَ هُمُ اَلَّذِينَ يَقِفُونَ تَحْتَ اَلْأَرَاكِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2981 - In another narration, Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Those who stand under the Araak trees have no valid Hajj, as they are not within the designated standing area (Arafat)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Boundaries of Mina, Arafat, and Muzdalifah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2982 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) stood at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah), and people rushed to the place where the hooves of his camel were.
He (sw) gestured with his hand while standing and said:
"I am standing here, but all of this is a valid place of standing (Mawqif)."
arabicText: 2982 - وَ وَقَفَ اَلنَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِجَمْعٍ فَجَعَلَ اَلنَّاسُ يَبْتَدِرُونَ أَخْفَافَ نَاقَتِهِ فَأَهْوَى بِيَدِهِ وَ هُوَ وَاقِفٌ فَقَالَ «إِنِّي وَقَفْتُ وَ كُلُّ هَذَا مَوْقِفٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2982 - The Prophet (peace be upon him and his family) stood at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah), and people rushed to the place where the hooves of his camel were.
He (sw) gestured with his hand while standing and said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I am standing here, but all of this is a valid place of standing (Mawqif)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Boundaries of Mina, Arafat, and Muzdalifah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2983 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"My father (as) used to stand at Al-Mash'ar al-Haram where he would spend the night."
arabicText: 2983 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقِفُ بِالْمَشْعَرِ اَلْحَرَامِ حَيْثُ يَبِيتُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2983 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "My father (as) used to stand at Al-Mash'ar al-Haram where he would spend the night."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Shortening the Prayer on the Way to Arafat
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2984 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "The people of Mecca pray the full (four-unit) prayer at Arafat."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to them, or alas for them! What journey is more arduous than this? It should not be performed in full (but shortened to two units)."
arabicText: 2984 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ إِنَّ أَهْلَ مَكَّةَ يُتِمُّونَ اَلصَّلاَةَ بِعَرَفَاتٍ فَقَالَ «وَيْلَهُمْ أَوْ وَيْحَهُمْ وَ أَيُّ سَفَرٍ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُ لاَ يُتَمُّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2984 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
"The people of Mecca pray the full (four-unit) prayer at Arafat."
Imam (as) said: "Woe to them, or alas for them! What journey is more arduous than this? It should not be performed in full (but shortened to two units)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Name of the Mountain Where People Stand at Arafah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2985 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked:
"What is the name of the mountain at Arafat where people stand?"
Imam (as) replied: "Al-Alal."
arabicText: 2985 - سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : مَا اِسْمُ جَبَلِ عَرَفَةَ اَلَّذِي يَقِفُ عَلَيْهِ اَلنَّاسُ فَقَالَ « أَلاَلٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.2985 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked:
"What is the name of the mountain at Arafat where people stand?"
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Al-Alal."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Dislike of Staying at Al-mash'ar After Leaving Arafah
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2986 - Aban narrated from Abdul-Rahman ibn A'yan, from Abu Ja'far (as):
He disliked staying at Al-Mash'ar after departing from it.
arabicText: 2986 - رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَعْيَنَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ كَرِهَ أَنْ يُقِيمَ عِنْدَ اَلْمَشْعَرِ بَعْدَ اَلْإِفَاضَةِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2986 - Aban narrated from Abdul-Rahman ibn A'yan, from Abu Ja'far (as):
thaqalaynMatn: He disliked staying at Al-Mash'ar after departing from it.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Ritual of Walking Through the Valley of Muhassir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2987 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"When you pass through the Valley of Muhassir—a significant valley between Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) and Mina, closer to Mina—hasten through it until you have crossed it.
The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) quickened his camel's pace in this valley and said:
'O Allah (swt), secure my covenant, accept my repentance, answer my supplication, and bless those I have left behind with goodness after me.'"
arabicText: 2987 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا مَرَرْتَ بِوَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ وَ هُوَ وَادٍ عَظِيمٌ بَيْنَ جَمْعٍ وَ مِنًى وَ هُوَ إِلَى مِنًى أَقْرَبُ فَاسْعَ فِيهِ حَتَّى تُجَاوِزَهُ فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ حَرَّكَ نَاقَتَهُ فِيهِ وَ قَالَ « اَللَّهُمَّ سَلِّمْ عَهْدِي وَ اِقْبَلْ تَوْبَتِي وَ أَجِبْ دَعْوَتِي وَ اُخْلُفْنِي بِخَيْرٍ فِيمَنْ تَرَكْتُ بَعْدِي.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2987 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"When you pass through the Valley of Muhassir—a significant valley between Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) and Mina, closer to Mina—hasten through it until you have crossed it.
The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace be upon him and his family) quickened his camel's pace in this valley and said:
'O Allah (swt), secure my covenant, accept my repentance, answer my supplication, and bless those I have left behind with goodness after me.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Ritual of Walking Through the Valley of Muhassir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2988 - Muhammad ibn Isma'il narrated from Abu al-Hasan (as), who said:
"The hastening in the Valley of Muhassir is a distance of one hundred steps."
arabicText: 2988 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْحَرَكَةُ فِي وَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ مِائَةُ خُطْوَةٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2988 - Muhammad ibn Isma'il narrated from Abu al-Hasan (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The hastening in the Valley of Muhassir is a distance of one hundred steps."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Ritual of Walking Through the Valley of Muhassir
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.2989 - In another narration, it is mentioned: "A distance of one hundred cubits."
arabicText: 2989 - وَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ : «مِائَةُ ذِرَاعٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2989 - In another narration, it is mentioned:
thaqalaynMatn: "A distance of one hundred cubits."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Miss Standing at Al-mash'ar
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2990 - In a narration from Ali ibn Ri'ab, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Whoever departs from Arafat with the people but does not stay with them at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) and deliberately or out of disregard proceeds directly to Mina, must offer a badnah (a camel as expiation)."
arabicText: 2990 -فِي رِوَايَةِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ أَنَّ اَلصَّادِقَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «مَنْ أَفَاضَ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ مَعَ اَلنَّاسِ فَلَمْ يَلْبَثْ مَعَهُمْ بِجَمْعٍ وَ مَضَى إِلَى مِنًى مُتَعَمِّداً أَوْ مُسْتَخِفّاً فَعَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2990 - In a narration from Ali ibn Ri'ab, Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever departs from Arafat with the people but does not stay with them at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) and deliberately or out of disregard proceeds directly to Mina, must offer a badnah (a camel as expiation)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Miss Standing at Al-mash'ar
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2991 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
I said to him: "A man departed from Arafat, passed by Al-Mash'ar (Muzdalifah), but did not stop there until he reached Mina, where he threw the pebbles at the Jamarah. He did not realize this mistake until the day had advanced."
Imam (as) said: "He should return to Al-Mash'ar, stand there, and then return to throw the pebbles at the Jamarah."
arabicText: 2991 - وَ رَوَى يُونُسُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ أَفَاضَ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ فَمَرَّ بِالْمَشْعَرِ فَلَمْ يَقِفْ حَتَّى اِنْتَهَى إِلَى مِنًى فَرَمَى اَلْجَمْرَةَ وَ لَمْ يَعْلَمْ حَتَّى اِرْتَفَعَ اَلنَّهَارُ قَالَ «يَرْجِعُ إِلَى اَلْمَشْعَرِ فَيَقِفُ ثُمَّ يَرْمِي اَلْجَمْرَةَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2991 - Yunus ibn Ya'qub narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to him: "A man departed from Arafat, passed by Al-Mash'ar (Muzdalifah), but did not stop there until he reached Mina, where he threw the pebbles at the Jamarah. He did not realize this mistake until the day had advanced."
Imam (as) said: "He should return to Al-Mash'ar, stand there, and then return to throw the pebbles at the Jamarah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Miss Standing at Al-mash'ar
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2992 - Muhammad ibn Hakim narrated:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A blind man and a weak woman are traveling with an Arab camel driver. After departing from Arafat, he takes them directly to Mina without stopping at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah)."
Imam (as) said: "Did they not pray there (at Jam‘)? If so, it suffices for them."
I asked: "What if they did not pray there?"
Imam (as) replied: "If they remembered Allah (swt), the Almighty, while there, then it suffices for them."
arabicText: 2992 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ حَكِيمٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْأَعْمَى وَ اَلْمَرْأَةُ اَلضَّعِيفَةُ يَكُونَانِ مَعَ اَلْجَمَّالِ اَلْأَعْرَابِيِّ فَإِذَا أَفَاضَ بِهِمْ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ مَرَّ بِهِمْ كَمَا هُمْ إِلَى مِنًى وَ لَمْ يَنْزِلْ بِهِمْ جَمْعاً فَقَالَ «أَ لَيْسَ قَدْ صَلَّوْا بِهَا فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَهُمْ» قُلْتُ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُصَلُّوا بِهَا قَالَ «ذَكَرُوا اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِيهَا فَإِنْ كَانُوا قَدْ ذَكَرُوا اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِيهَا فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَهُمْ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2992 - Muhammad ibn Hakim narrated:
thaqalaynMatn:
I said to Abu Abdullah (as): "A blind man and a weak woman are traveling with an Arab camel driver. After departing from Arafat, he takes them directly to Mina without stopping at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah)."
Imam (as) said: "Did they not pray there (at Jam‘)? If so, it suffices for them."
I asked: "What if they did not pray there?"
Imam (as) replied: "If they remembered Allah (swt), the Almighty, while there, then it suffices for them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Permitted to Depart Early From Muzdalifah Before Fajr
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2993 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
"There is no harm in allowing women to depart earlier when the night has passed. They should stand at Al-Mash'ar Al-Haram for a brief moment, then proceed to Mina to throw the pebbles at the Jamarah. After that, they should wait briefly, then shorten their hair, and proceed to Mecca to perform tawaf. However, if they wish to have the sacrifice performed on their behalf, they should appoint someone to perform it for them."
arabicText: 2993 - رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ : «لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تُقَدَّمَ اَلنِّسَاءُ إِذَا زَالَ اَللَّيْلُ فَيَقِفْنَ عِنْدَ اَلْمَشْعَرِ اَلْحَرَامِ سَاعَةً ثُمَّ يُنْطَلَقُ بِهِنَّ إِلَى مِنًى فَيَرْمِينَ اَلْجَمْرَةَ ثُمَّ يَصْبِرْنَ سَاعَةً ثُمَّ يُقَصِّرْنَ وَ يُنْطَلَقُ بِهِنَّ إِلَى مَكَّةَ فَيَطُفْنَ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُنَّ يُرِدْنَ أَنْ يُذْبَحَ عَنْهُنَّ فَإِنَّهُنَّ يُوَكِّلْنَ مَنْ يَذْبَحُ عَنْهُنَّ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2993 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I heard Abu Abdullah (as) say:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm in allowing women to depart earlier when the night has passed. They should stand at Al-Mash'ar Al-Haram for a brief moment, then proceed to Mina to throw the pebbles at the Jamarah. After that, they should wait briefly, then shorten their hair, and proceed to Mecca to perform tawaf. However, if they wish to have the sacrifice performed on their behalf, they should appoint someone to perform it for them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Permitted to Depart Early From Muzdalifah Before Fajr
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2994 - Ali ibn Ri’ab narrated from Misma‘, from Abu Ibrahim (as), regarding a man who stood with the people at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) and then departed before the people began to leave.
Imam (as) said: "If he was unaware, then there is nothing upon him. But if he departed before the break of dawn, then he must offer the sacrifice of a sheep."
arabicText: 2994 - وَ رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ رِئَابٍ عَنْ مِسْمَعٍ عَنْ أَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ وَقَفَ مَعَ اَلنَّاسِ بِجَمْعٍ ثُمَّ أَفَاضَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يُفِيضَ اَلنَّاسُ قَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ جَاهِلاً فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ كَانَ أَفَاضَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ اَلْفَجْرِ فَعَلَيْهِ دَمُ شَاةٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2994 - Ali ibn Ri’ab narrated from Misma‘, from Abu Ibrahim (as), regarding a man who stood with the people at Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) and then departed before the people began to leave.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he was unaware, then there is nothing upon him. But if he departed before the break of dawn, then he must offer the sacrifice of a sheep."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Miss the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2995 - Mu‘awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"Whoever reaches Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) has indeed attained the Hajj."
Imam (as) also said: "Any pilgrim performing Qiran (combining Hajj and Umrah), Ifrad (Hajj alone), or Tamattu‘ (Umrah followed by Hajj) who arrives after missing the Hajj should terminate their pilgrimage with an Umrah, and they are obligated to perform the Hajj in the following year."
Regarding a man who reaches the Imam while he is at Jam‘,
Imam (as) said: "If he believes he can reach Arafat and stand there briefly, and then return to Jam‘ before sunrise, he should go to Arafat. But if he believes he will not reach Arafat until after the people have left, then he should not proceed there, and his Hajj is complete."
arabicText: 2995 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «مَنْ أَدْرَكَ جَمْعاً فَقَدْ أَدْرَكَ اَلْحَجَّ » وَ قَالَ «أَيُّمَا قَارِنٍ أَوْ مُفْرِدٍ أَوْ مُتَمَتِّعٍ قَدِمَ وَ قَدْ فَاتَهُ اَلْحَجُّ فَلْيَحِلَّ بِعُمْرَةٍ وَ عَلَيْهِ اَلْحَجُّ مِنْ قَابِلٍ » قَالَ وَ قَالَ فِي رَجُلٍ أَدْرَكَ اَلْإِمَامَ وَ هُوَ بِجَمْعٍ فَقَالَ «إِنْ ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ يَأْتِي عَرَفَاتٍ فَيَقِفُ بِهَا قَلِيلاً ثُمَّ يُدْرِكُ جَمْعاً قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ اَلشَّمْسِ فَلْيَأْتِهَا فَإِنْ ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ لاَ يَأْتِيهَا حَتَّى يُفِيضُوا فَلاَ يَأْتِيهَا وَ قَدْ تَمَّ حَجُّهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2995 - Mu‘awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Whoever reaches Jam‘ (Muzdalifah) has indeed attained the Hajj."
Imam (as) also said: "Any pilgrim performing Qiran (combining Hajj and Umrah), Ifrad (Hajj alone), or Tamattu‘ (Umrah followed by Hajj) who arrives after missing the Hajj should terminate their pilgrimage with an Umrah, and they are obligated to perform the Hajj in the following year."
Regarding a man who reaches the Imam while he is at Jam‘,
Imam (as) said: "If he believes he can reach Arafat and stand there briefly, and then return to Jam‘ before sunrise, he should go to Arafat. But if he believes he will not reach Arafat until after the people have left, then he should not proceed there, and his Hajj is complete."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Miss the Hajj
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2996 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Dawud al-Raqqi, who said:
"I was with Abu Abdullah (as) at Mina when a man came and said, 'There are people who arrived, but the Hajj has already passed them.'
Abu Abdullah (as) replied: 'We ask Allah (swt) for well-being. I think that each of them should slaughter a sheep, exit from their state of Ihram, and they are obligated to perform the Hajj in the following year if they return to their homelands. However, if they stay until the days of Tashreeq pass while in Mecca, then leave to the Miqat of the people of Mecca, enter Ihram from there, and perform an Umrah, then the obligation of performing the Hajj in the following year is lifted from them.'"
arabicText: 2996 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ اَلرَّقِّيِّ قَالَ : كُنْتُ مَعَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِمِنًى إِذْ جَاءَ رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ إِنَّ قَوْماً قَدِمُوا وَ قَدْ فَاتَهُمُ اَلْحَجُّ فَقَالَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ «نَسْأَلُ اَللَّهَ اَلْعَافِيَةَ أَرَى أَنْ يُهَرِيقَ كُلُّ رَجُلٍ مِنْهُمْ شَاةً وَ يَحِلُّوا وَ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلْحَجُّ مِنْ قَابِلٍ إِنِ اِنْصَرَفُوا إِلَى بِلاَدِهِمْ وَ إِنْ أَقَامُوا حَتَّى تَمْضِيَ أَيَّامُ اَلتَّشْرِيقِ بِمَكَّةَ ثُمَّ خَرَجُوا إِلَى وَقْتِ أَهْلِ مَكَّةَ فَأَحْرَمُوا مِنْهُ وَ اِعْتَمَرُوا فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِمُ اَلْحَجُّ مِنْ قَابِلٍ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2996 - Ibn Mahbub narrated from Dawud al-Raqqi, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I was with Abu Abdullah (as) at Mina when a man came and said, 'There are people who arrived, but the Hajj has already passed them.'
Abu Abdullah (as) replied: 'We ask Allah (swt) for well-being. I think that each of them should slaughter a sheep, exit from their state of Ihram, and they are obligated to perform the Hajj in the following year if they return to their homelands. However, if they stay until the days of Tashreeq pass while in Mecca, then leave to the Miqat of the people of Mecca, enter Ihram from there, and perform an Umrah, then the obligation of performing the Hajj in the following year is lifted from them.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Taking Pebbles for Jamarat From Inside or Outside the Sacred Area
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2997 - Hanan ibn Sadeer narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"It is sufficient for you to take the pebbles for the Jamarat from anywhere within the boundaries of the Haram, except from the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram) and Masjid al-Khayf."
arabicText: 2997 - رَوَى حَنَانُ بْنُ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «يُجْزِيكَ أَنْ تَأْخُذَ حَصَى اَلْجِمَارِ مِنَ اَلْحَرَمِ كُلِّهِ إِلاَّ مِنَ اَلْمَسْجِدِ اَلْحَرَامِ وَ مَسْجِدِ اَلْخَيْفِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2997 - Hanan ibn Sadeer narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is sufficient for you to take the pebbles for the Jamarat from anywhere within the boundaries of the Haram, except from the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram) and Masjid al-Khayf."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Fear Throwing the Pebbles or Who Add or Reduce the Number
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2998 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
"I said to Abu Abdullah (as), 'I went to perform the stoning (Rami), and I found six pebbles in my hand.' He said, 'Take one from beneath your feet.'"
arabicText: 2998 - رَوَى عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ ذَهَبْتُ أَرْمِي فَإِذَا فِي يَدِي سِتُّ حَصَيَاتٍ فَقَالَ «خُذْ وَاحِدَةً مِنْ تَحْتِ رِجْلَيْكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2998 - Ali ibn Abi Hamzah narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I said to Abu Abdullah (as), 'I went to perform the stoning (Rami), and I found six pebbles in my hand.' He said, 'Take one from beneath your feet.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Fear Throwing the Pebbles or Who Add or Reduce the Number
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.2999 - And in another narration:
"Do not take the pebbles for stoning (Rami) from those that have already been used."
arabicText: 2999 - وَ فِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ : «وَ لاَ تَأْخُذْ مِنْ حَصَى اَلْجِمَارِ اَلَّذِي قَدْ رُمِيَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.2999 - And in another narration:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not take the pebbles for stoning (Rami) from those that have already been used."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Fear Throwing the Pebbles or Who Add or Reduce the Number
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3000 - Mu'awiya ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
Regarding a man who took 21 pebbles for stoning (Rami) and threw them, realizing afterward that he had one extra but could not determine which station he had missed: "He should return and throw one pebble at each station. If a pebble falls from someone's hand and they do not know which one it is, they should take one from under their feet and throw it."
Imam (as) also said: "If you throw a pebble and it lands in a litter (carrying device), you should replace it with another. However, if it hits a person or an animal and then lands on the target (the pile of pebbles), it is sufficient."
Regarding someone who threw only four pebbles at the first station but threw seven at the second and third: "He should return and throw three more at the first station, and the rest is complete. If he threw only three at the second station and completed the third, he should return and throw seven at the second. If he threw four at the second station, he must return and throw three more."
When asked about someone who performs the stoning in reverse order,
Imam (as) replied: "He must redo the stoning for the middle station and the Jamrat al-Aqaba in order."
arabicText: 3000 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَخَذَ إِحْدَى وَ عِشْرِينَ حَصَاةً فَرَمَى بِهَا وَ زَادَتْ وَاحِدَةٌ وَ لَمْ يَدْرِ أَيُّهُنَّ نَقَصَتْ قَالَ «فَلْيَرْجِعْ فَلْيَرْمِ كُلَّ وَاحِدَةٍ بِحَصَاةٍ وَ إِنْ سَقَطَتْ مِنْ رَجُلٍ حَصَاةٌ وَ لَمْ يَدْرِ أَيَّتُهُنَّ هِيَ فَلْيَأْخُذْ مِنْ تَحْتِ قَدَمَيْهِ حَصَاةً فَيَرْمِي بِهَا» قَالَ «فَإِنْ رَمَيْتَ بِحَصَاةٍ فَوَقَعَتْ فِي مَحْمِلٍ فَأَعِدْ مَكَانَهَا وَ إِنْ أَصَابَتْ إِنْسَاناً أَوْ جَمَلاً ثُمَّ وَقَعَتْ عَلَى اَلْجِمَارِ أَجْزَأَكَ » وَ قَالَ فِي رَجُلٍ رَمَى اَلْجِمَارَ فَرَمَى اَلْأُولَى بِأَرْبَعِ حَصَيَاتٍ ثُمَّ رَمَى اَلْأَخِيرَتَيْنِ بِسَبْعٍ سَبْعٍ قَالَ «يَعُودُ فَيَرْمِي اَلْأُولَى بِثَلاَثٍ وَ قَدْ فَرَغَ وَ إِنْ كَانَ رَمَى اَلْوُسْطَى بِثَلاَثٍ ثُمَّ رَمَى اَلْأُخْرَى فَلْيَرْمِ اَلْوُسْطَى بِسَبْعٍ وَ إِنْ كَانَ رَمَى اَلْوُسْطَى بِأَرْبَعٍ رَجَعَ فَرَمَى بِثَلاَثٍ» قَالَ قُلْتُ اَلرَّجُلُ يَرْمِي اَلْجِمَارَ مَنْكُوسَةً قَالَ «يُعِيدُهَا عَلَى اَلْوُسْطَى وَ جَمْرَةِ اَلْعَقَبَةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3000 - Mu'awiya ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
Regarding a man who took 21 pebbles for stoning (Rami) and threw them, realizing afterward that he had one extra but could not determine which station he had missed: "He should return and throw one pebble at each station. If a pebble falls from someone's hand and they do not know which one it is, they should take one from under their feet and throw it."
Imam (as) also said: "If you throw a pebble and it lands in a litter (carrying device), you should replace it with another. However, if it hits a person or an animal and then lands on the target (the pile of pebbles), it is sufficient."
Regarding someone who threw only four pebbles at the first station but threw seven at the second and third: "He should return and throw three more at the first station, and the rest is complete. If he threw only three at the second station and completed the third, he should return and throw seven at the second. If he threw four at the second station, he must return and throw three more."
When asked about someone who performs the stoning in reverse order,
Imam (as) replied: "He must redo the stoning for the middle station and the Jamrat al-Aqaba in order."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Fear Throwing the Pebbles or Who Add or Reduce the Number
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3001 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
"For one who is fearful, there is no harm in stoning the Jamarat at night, slaughtering the sacrifice at night, and performing the Tawaf of Ifadah at night."
arabicText: 3001 - وَ رَوَى مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «فِي اَلْخَائِفِ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَرْمِيَ اَلْجِمَارَ بِاللَّيْلِ وَ يُضَحِّيَ بِاللَّيْلِ وَ يُفِيضَ بِاللَّيْلِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3001 - Muhammad ibn Muslim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For one who is fearful, there is no harm in stoning the Jamarat at night, slaughtering the sacrifice at night, and performing the Tawaf of Ifadah at night."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Fear Throwing the Pebbles or Who Add or Reduce the Number
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3002 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who, out of ignorance, did not stone the Jamarat before departing to Mecca.
Imam (as) replied: "She should return and stone the Jamarat as she would have originally done. The same applies to a man in such a case."
arabicText: 3002 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ : عَنِ اِمْرَأَةٍ جَهِلَتْ أَنْ تَرْمِيَ اَلْجِمَارَ حَتَّى نَفَرَتْ إِلَى مَكَّةَ قَالَ «فَلْتَرْجِعْ فَتَرْمِي اَلْجِمَارَ كَمَا كَانَتْ تَرْمِي وَ اَلرَّجُلُ كَذَلِكَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3002 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a woman who, out of ignorance, did not stone the Jamarat before departing to Mecca.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "She should return and stone the Jamarat as she would have originally done. The same applies to a man in such a case."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on What is Said About Those Who Fear Throwing the Pebbles or Who Add or Reduce the Number
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3003 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Imam (as) regarding a man who left Muzdalifah (Jam') for Mina but encountered an issue and did not stone the Jamarat until the sun had set.
Imam (as) said: "He should perform the stoning twice the next morning: once early in the morning for the previous day and again at the time of noon for the current day."
arabicText: 3003 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَبْدُ اَللَّهِ بْنُ سِنَانٍ : فِي رَجُلٍ أَفَاضَ مِنْ جَمْعٍ حَتَّى اِنْتَهَى إِلَى مِنًى فَعَرَضَ لَهُ شَيْءٌ فَلَمْ يَرْمِ اَلْجَمْرَةَ حَتَّى غَابَتِ اَلشَّمْسُ قَالَ «يَرْمِي إِذَا أَصْبَحَ مَرَّتَيْنِ إِحْدَاهُمَا بُكْرَةً وَ هِيَ لِلْأَمْسِ وَ اَلْأُخْرَى عِنْدَ زَوَالِ اَلشَّمْسِ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3003 - Abdullah ibn Sinan narrated from Imam (as) regarding a man who left Muzdalifah (Jam') for Mina but encountered an issue and did not stone the Jamarat until the sun had set.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "He should perform the stoning twice the next morning: once early in the morning for the previous day and again at the time of noon for the current day."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Permitted to Throw Pebbles at Night
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3004 - Waheeb ibn Hafs narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about those who are permitted to stone the Jamarat at night.
Imam (as) said: "The wood-gatherer, the servant who has no control over his own affairs, the fearful, the debtor, and the sick person who cannot stone. He should be carried to the Jamarat, and if he is able to stone, he should do so; otherwise, someone should stone on his behalf while he is present."
arabicText: 3004 - رَوَى وُهَيْبُ بْنُ حَفْصٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنِ اَلَّذِي يَنْبَغِي لَهُ أَنْ يَرْمِيَ بِاللَّيْلِ مَنْ هُوَ قَالَ «اَلْحَاطِبَةُ وَ اَلْمَمْلُوكُ اَلَّذِي لاَ يَمْلِكُ مِنْ أَمْرِهِ شَيْئاً وَ اَلْخَائِفُ وَ اَلْمَدِينُ وَ اَلْمَرِيضُ اَلَّذِي لاَ يَسْتَطِيعُ أَنْ يَرْمِيَ يُحْمَلُ إِلَى اَلْجِمَارِ فَإِنْ قَدَرَ عَلَى أَنْ يَرْمِيَ وَ إِلاَّ فَارْمِ عَنْهُ وَ هُوَ حَاضِرٌ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3004 - Waheeb ibn Hafs narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about those who are permitted to stone the Jamarat at night.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The wood-gatherer, the servant who has no control over his own affairs, the fearful, the debtor, and the sick person who cannot stone. He should be carried to the Jamarat, and if he is able to stone, he should do so; otherwise, someone should stone on his behalf while he is present."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Throwing Pebbles on Behalf of the Sick and Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3005 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar and Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"The injured and those suffering from abdominal illnesses should have the Jamarat stoned on their behalf, and likewise for the children, the stoning should be done on their behalf."
arabicText: 3005 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ وَ عَبْدُ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ اَلْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْكَسِيرُ وَ اَلْمَبْطُونُ يُرْمَى عَنْهُمَا قَالَ وَ اَلصِّبْيَانُ يُرْمَى عَنْهُمْ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3005 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar and Abdur-Rahman ibn Al-Hajjaj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The injured and those suffering from abdominal illnesses should have the Jamarat stoned on their behalf, and likewise for the children, the stoning should be done on their behalf."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Throwing Pebbles on Behalf of the Sick and Children
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3006 - Ishaq ibn Ammar asked Abu Al-Hasan Musa (as) about a sick person: Can the stoning of the Jamarat be performed on his behalf?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, he should be carried to the Jamarat, and the stoning should be done on his behalf."
I said: "What if he is unable to be carried?"
Imam (as) replied: "He may remain in his residence, and the stoning should be performed on his behalf."
arabicText: 3006 - وَ سَأَلَ إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ أَبَا اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْمَرِيضِ يُرْمَى عَنْهُ اَلْجِمَارُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ يُحْمَلْ إِلَى اَلْجَمْرَةِ وَ يُرْمَى عَنْهُ» قُلْتُ لاَ يُطِيقُ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ «يُتْرَكُ فِي مَنْزِلِهِ وَ يُرْمَى عَنْهُ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Who Spend the Nights of Mina in Mecca
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3007 - Ibn Maskan narrated from Ja’far ibn Najiyah, from Abu Abdullah (as):
I asked him about someone who spends the nights of Mina in Mecca.
Imam (as) replied: "He must offer three sheep as a sacrifice."
arabicText: 3007 - رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ نَاجِيَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَمَّنْ بَاتَ لَيَالِيَ مِنًى بِمَكَّةَ فَقَالَ «عَلَيْهِ ثَلاَثَةٌ مِنَ اَلْغَنَمِ يَذْبَحُهُنَّ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3007 - Ibn Maskan narrated from Ja’far ibn Najiyah, from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked him about someone who spends the nights of Mina in Mecca.
Imam (as) replied: "He must offer three sheep as a sacrifice."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Who Spend the Nights of Mina in Mecca
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3008 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who visited the House (Kaaba) and remained engaged in his circumambulation, supplications, and Sa'i (ritual walking) until dawn broke.
Imam (as) replied: "There is nothing upon him; he was engaged in the obedience of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."
arabicText: 3008 - وَ سَأَلَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ : عَنْ رَجُلٍ زَارَ اَلْبَيْتَ فَلَمْ يَزَلْ فِي طَوَافِهِ وَ دُعَائِهِ وَ اَلسَّعْيِ وَ اَلدُّعَاءِ حَتَّى طَلَعَ اَلْفَجْرُ قَالَ «لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ كَانَ فِي طَاعَةِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3008 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who visited the House (Kaaba) and remained engaged in his circumambulation, supplications, and Sa'i (ritual walking) until dawn broke.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is nothing upon him; he was engaged in the obedience of Allah (swt), the Mighty and Majestic."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Who Spend the Nights of Mina in Mecca
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3009 - Jamil ibn Darraj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
"If you leave Mina before sunset, then do not let the morning come upon you except while you are still in Mina."
arabicText: 3009 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ جَمِيلُ بْنُ دَرَّاجٍ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «إِذَا خَرَجْتَ مِنْ مِنًى قَبْلَ غُرُوبِ اَلشَّمْسِ فَلاَ تُصْبِحْ إِلاَّ بِهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3009 - Jamil ibn Darraj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you leave Mina before sunset, then do not let the morning come upon you except while you are still in Mina."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Who Spend the Nights of Mina in Mecca
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3010 - Ja'far ibn Najiya narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
"If a man leaves Mina at the beginning of the night, then the night should not reach its midpoint except while he is still in Mina. However, if he leaves after midnight, then it is permissible for him to spend the morning elsewhere."
arabicText: 3010 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ جَعْفَرُ بْنُ نَاجِيَةَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «إِذَا خَرَجَ اَلرَّجُلُ مِنْ مِنًى أَوَّلَ اَللَّيْلِ فَلاَ يَنْتَصِفْ لَهُ اَللَّيْلُ إِلاَّ وَ هُوَ بِمِنًى وَ إِذَا خَرَجَ بَعْدَ نِصْفِ اَللَّيْلِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُصْبِحَ بِغَيْرِهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3010 - Ja'far ibn Najiya narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) that he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man leaves Mina at the beginning of the night, then the night should not reach its midpoint except while he is still in Mina. However, if he leaves after midnight, then it is permissible for him to spend the morning elsewhere."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Who Spend the Nights of Mina in Mecca
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3011 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
"Do not enter your homes in Mecca when you have visited, meaning the residents of Mecca."
arabicText: 3011 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ تَدْخُلُوا مَنَازِلَكُمْ بِمَكَّةَ إِذَا زُرْتُمْ يَعْنِي أَهْلَ مَكَّةَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3011 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "Do not enter your homes in Mecca when you have visited, meaning the residents of Mecca."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Those Who Spend the Nights of Mina in Mecca
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3012 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Hisham ibn Al-Hakam, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If a pilgrim visits from Mina, leaves Mecca, passes by the houses of Mecca, sleeps, and then wakes up before returning to Mina, there is no obligation upon him."
arabicText: 3012 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ اَلْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا زَارَ اَلْحَاجُّ مِنْ مِنًى فَخَرَجَ مِنْ مَكَّةَ فَجَازَ بُيُوتَ مَكَّةَ فَنَامَ ثُمَّ أَصْبَحَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ مِنًى فَلاَ شَيْءَ عَلَيْهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3012 - Ibn Abi Umayr narrated from Hisham ibn Al-Hakam, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a pilgrim visits from Mina, leaves Mecca, passes by the houses of Mecca, sleeps, and then wakes up before returning to Mina, there is no obligation upon him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Returning to Mecca After the Visit for Tawaf
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3013 - Jamil narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm if a man goes to Mecca, performs Tawaf during the days of Mina, and does not stay overnight there."
arabicText: 3013 - رَوَى جَمِيلٌ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَأْتِيَ اَلرَّجُلُ مَكَّةَ فَيَطُوفَ أَيَّامَ مِنًى وَ لاَ يَبِيتَ بِهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3013 - Jamil narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "There is no harm if a man goes to Mecca, performs Tawaf during the days of Mina, and does not stay overnight there."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Returning to Mecca After the Visit for Tawaf
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3014 - Laith Al-Muradi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who goes to Mecca during the days of Mina after completing the visitation of the House and performs Tawaf around the Kaaba voluntarily.
Imam (as) replied: "Staying in Mina is more beloved to me."
arabicText: 3014 - وَ سَأَلَهُ لَيْثٌ اَلْمُرَادِيُّ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَأْتِي مَكَّةَ أَيَّامَ مِنًى بَعْدَ فَرَاغِهِ مِنْ زِيَارَةِ اَلْبَيْتِ فَيَطُوفُ بِالْبَيْتِ تَطَوُّعاً فَقَالَ «اَلْمُقَامُ بِمِنًى أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3014 - Laith Al-Muradi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who goes to Mecca during the days of Mina after completing the visitation of the House and performs Tawaf around the Kaaba voluntarily.
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Staying in Mina is more beloved to me."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3015 - Muawiya ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"If you intend to leave on the second day (of Tashreeq), it is not permissible for you to depart until the sun has passed its zenith. However, if you delay until the last day of Tashreeq, which is the final day of departure, then there is no issue with leaving at any time, whether you throw the pebbles before or after the zenith."
arabicText: 3015 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا أَرَدْتَ أَنْ تَنْفِرَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ فَلَيْسَ لَكَ أَنْ تَنْفِرَ حَتَّى تَزُولَ اَلشَّمْسُ فَإِنْ تَأَخَّرْتَ إِلَى آخِرِ أَيَّامِ اَلتَّشْرِيقِ وَ هُوَ يَوْمُ اَلنَّفْرِ اَلْأَخِيرِ فَلاَ عَلَيْكَ أَيَّ سَاعَةٍ نَفَرْتَ وَ رَمَيْتَ قَبْلَ اَلزَّوَالِ أَوْ بَعْدَهُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3015 - Muawiya ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If you intend to leave on the second day (of Tashreeq), it is not permissible for you to depart until the sun has passed its zenith. However, if you delay until the last day of Tashreeq, which is the final day of departure, then there is no issue with leaving at any time, whether you throw the pebbles before or after the zenith."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3016 - He said, and I heard him say regarding the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted:
"Whoever hastens to leave in two days, there is no sin upon him, and whoever delays, there is no sin upon him—for the one who is conscious (of Allah (swt))." (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:203):
"It means that one should avoid hunting until the people of Mina depart on the final day of departure (nafr al-akhir)."
arabicText: 3016 - قَالَ وَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ: «۝ فَمَنْ تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ فَلاٰ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ وَ مَنْ تَأَخَّرَ فَلاٰ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ لِمَنِ اِتَّقىٰ ۝» فَقَالَ «يَتَّقِي اَلصَّيْدَ حَتَّى يَنْفِرَ أَهْلُ مِنًى فِي اَلنَّفْرِ اَلْأَخِيرِ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3016 - He said, and I heard him say regarding the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted:
"Whoever hastens to leave in two days, there is no sin upon him, and whoever delays, there is no sin upon him—for the one who is conscious (of Allah (swt))." (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:203):
thaqalaynMatn: "It means that one should avoid hunting until the people of Mina depart on the final day of departure (nafr al-akhir)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3017 - In a narration from Ibn Mahbub, from Abu Ja'far al-Ahwal, from Salam ibn al-Mustaneer, from Abu Ja'far (as), he said:
"For the one who avoids indecency (rafath), wrongdoing (fisq), argumentation (jidal), and whatever Allah (swt) has prohibited for him during his state of ihram."
arabicText: 3017 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اِبْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ اَلْأَحْوَلِ عَنْ سَلاَّمِ بْنِ اَلْمُسْتَنِيرِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «لِمَنِ اِتَّقَى اَلرَّفَثَ وَ اَلْفُسُوقَ وَ اَلْجِدَالَ وَ مَا حَرَّمَ اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ فِي إِحْرَامِهِ ».
