thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3017 - In a narration from Ibn Mahbub, from Abu Ja'far al-Ahwal, from Salam ibn al-Mustaneer, from Abu Ja'far (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For the one who avoids indecency (rafath), wrongdoing (fisq), argumentation (jidal), and whatever Allah (swt) has prohibited for him during his state of ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3018 - In a narration from Ali ibn Atiyyah, from his father, from Abu Ja'far (as), he said:
"For the one who fears Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious."
arabicText: 3018 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عَطِيَّةَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «لِمَنِ اِتَّقَى اَللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3018 - In a narration from Ali ibn Atiyyah, from his father, from Abu Ja'far (as), he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "For the one who fears Allah (swt), the Mighty and Glorious."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3019 - It is narrated:
"Indeed, he emerges from his sins as though it is the day his mother gave birth to him."
arabicText: 3019 - وَ رُوِيَ : «أَنَّهُ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ ذُنُوبِهِ كَهَيْئَةِ يَوْمَ وَلَدَتْهُ أُمُّهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3019 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Indeed, he emerges from his sins as though it is the day his mother gave birth to him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3020 - It is narrated:
"Whoever fulfills their commitment to Allah (swt), Allah (swt) fulfills His promise to them."
arabicText: 3020 - وَ رُوِيَ : «مَنْ وَفَى لِلَّهِ وَفَى اَللَّهُ لَهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3020 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "Whoever fulfills their commitment to Allah (swt), Allah (swt) fulfills His promise to them."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3021 - In a narration from Sulaiman ibn Dawood al-Minqari, from Sufyan ibn Uyaynah, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted:
"So whoever hastens [to leave] in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays - there is no sin upon him for one who fears [Allah (swt)]" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:203):
Imam (as) said: "This means: whoever dies [after completing Hajj], there is no sin upon him. And for whoever's term is delayed, there is no sin upon him as long as they avoid major sins."
arabicText: 3021 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ دَاوُدَ اَلْمِنْقَرِيِّ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ بْنِ عُيَيْنَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «فَمَنْ تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ فَلاٰ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ» «يَعْنِي مَنْ مَاتَ فَلاَ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ «وَ مَنْ تَأَخَّرَ» أَجَلُهُ «فَلاٰ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ لِمَنِ اِتَّقىٰ» اَلْكَبَائِرَ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3021 - In a narration from Sulaiman ibn Dawood al-Minqari, from Sufyan ibn Uyaynah, from Abu Abdullah (as), regarding the verse of Allah (swt), the Exalted:
"So whoever hastens [to leave] in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays - there is no sin upon him for one who fears [Allah (swt)]" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:203):
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "This means: whoever dies [after completing Hajj], there is no sin upon him. And for whoever's term is delayed, there is no sin upon him as long as they avoid major sins."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3022 - Abu Basir asked Imam Abu Abdullah (as) about a person leaving during the first departure (nafr al-awwal).
Imam (as) replied: "He may leave anytime between now and when the sun begins to turn yellow. However, if he does not depart until the time of sunset approaches, then he should not leave. Instead, he should stay the night in Mina, and when morning comes and the sun has risen, he may then depart whenever he wishes."
arabicText: 3022 - وَ سَأَلَهُ أَبُو بَصِيرٍ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَنْفِرُ فِي اَلنَّفْرِ اَلْأَوَّلِ قَالَ لَهُ «أَنْ يَنْفِرَ مَا بَيْنَهُ وَ بَيْنَ أَنْ تَصْفَرَّ اَلشَّمْسُ فَإِنْ هُوَ لَمْ يَنْفِرْ حَتَّى يَكُونَ عِنْدَ غُرُوبِهَا فَلاَ يَنْفِرْ وَ لْيَبِتْ بِمِنًى حَتَّى إِذَا أَصْبَحَ فَطَلَعَتِ اَلشَّمْسُ فَلْيَنْفِرْ مَتَى شَاءَ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3022 - Abu Basir asked Imam Abu Abdullah (as) about a person leaving during the first departure (nafr al-awwal).
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He may leave anytime between now and when the sun begins to turn yellow. However, if he does not depart until the time of sunset approaches, then he should not leave. Instead, he should stay the night in Mina, and when morning comes and the sun has risen, he may then depart whenever he wishes."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3023 - Al-Halabi narrated that Imam Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man departing during the first departure (nafr al-awwal) before the sun declines.
Imam (as) replied: "No, but he may send off his belongings if he wishes, yet he himself should not leave until the sun has declined."
It is also narrated: "Whoever does so is among those who 'hasten in two days.'"
arabicText:
3023 - وَ رَوَى اَلْحَلَبِيُّ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَنْفِرُ فِي اَلنَّفْرِ اَلْأَوَّلِ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَزُولَ اَلشَّمْسُ فَقَالَ «لاَ وَ لَكِنْ يُخْرِجُ ثَقَلَهُ إِنْ شَاءَ وَ لاَ يَخْرُجُ هُوَ حَتَّى تَزُولَ اَلشَّمْسُ».
وَ رُوِيَ «أَنَّ مَنْ فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ فَهُوَ مِمَّنْ «تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ» »
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3023 - Al-Halabi narrated that Imam Abu Abdullah (as) was asked about a man departing during the first departure (nafr al-awwal) before the sun declines.
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) replied: "No, but he may send off his belongings if he wishes, yet he himself should not leave until the sun has declined."
It is also narrated: "Whoever does so is among those who 'hasten in two days.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3024 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Imam Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"It is appropriate for one who 'hastens in two days' to refrain from hunting until the third day has passed."
arabicText: 3024 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : «يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ «تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ» أَنْ يُمْسِكَ عَنِ اَلصَّيْدِ حَتَّى يَنْقَضِيَ اَلْيَوْمُ اَلثَّالِثُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3024 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Imam Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is appropriate for one who 'hastens in two days' to refrain from hunting until the third day has passed."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3025 - Jamil ibn Darrāj narrated from Imam Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"There is no harm if a man departs during the first departure (al-Nafr al-Awwal) and then stays in Mecca."
Imam (as) also said, "My father (as) used to say: 'Whoever wishes may throw the pebbles (at the Jamarat) during the height of the day and then depart.'"
The narrator asked: "Until when can the Jamarat be thrown?"
The Imam (as) replied: "From the height of the day until sunset. And whoever hunts (game) has no right to depart during the first departure (al-Nafr al-Awwal)."
arabicText: 3025 - وَ رَوَى عَنْهُ جَمِيلُ بْنُ دَرَّاجٍ أَنَّهُ قَالَ : «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَنْفِرَ اَلرَّجُلُ فِي اَلنَّفْرِ اَلْأَوَّلِ ثُمَّ يُقِيمَ بِمَكَّةَ » وَ قَالَ «كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَقُولُ «مَنْ شَاءَ رَمَى اَلْجِمَارَ اِرْتِفَاعَ اَلنَّهَارِ ثُمَّ يَنْفِرُ» » قَالَ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ إِلَى مَتَى يَكُونُ رَمْيُ اَلْجِمَارِ فَقَالَ «مِنِ اِرْتِفَاعِ اَلنَّهَارِ إِلَى غُرُوبِ اَلشَّمْسِ وَ مَنْ أَصَابَ اَلصَّيْدَ فَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَنْ يَنْفِرَ فِي اَلنَّفْرِ اَلْأَوَّلِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3025 - Jamil ibn Darrāj narrated from Imam Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"There is no harm if a man departs during the first departure (al-Nafr al-Awwal) and then stays in Mecca."
Imam (as) also said, "My father (as) used to say: 'Whoever wishes may throw the pebbles (at the Jamarat) during the height of the day and then depart.'"
The narrator asked: "Until when can the Jamarat be thrown?"
The Imam (as) replied: "From the height of the day until sunset. And whoever hunts (game) has no right to depart during the first departure (al-Nafr al-Awwal)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the First and Final Departure From Mina
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3026 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the verse of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Whoever hastens in two days, there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays, there is no sin upon him." (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:203)
Imam (as) replied: "It does not mean that it is merely a choice—whether one chooses to do this or that. Rather, it means that the person returns forgiven, with no sin upon him and no blame remaining for him."
arabicText: 3026 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «۝ فَمَنْ تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ فَلاٰ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ وَ مَنْ تَأَخَّرَ فَلاٰ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ ۝» قَالَ «لَيْسَ هُوَ عَلَى أَنَّ ذَلِكَ وَاسِعٌ إِنْ شَاءَ صَنَعَ ذَا وَ إِنْ شَاءَ صَنَعَ ذَا لَكِنَّهُ يَرْجِعُ مَغْفُوراً لَهُ لاَ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ وَ لاَ ذَنْبَ لَهُ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3026 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the verse of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Whoever hastens in two days, there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays, there is no sin upon him." (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:203)
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "It does not mean that it is merely a choice—whether one chooses to do this or that. Rather, it means that the person returns forgiven, with no sin upon him and no blame remaining for him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Staying at Al-Hasba
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3027 - Aban narrated from Abu Maryam, from Abu Abdullah (as), that he was asked about al-Hasba (staying at al-Abtah after completing the rites of Hajj).
Imam (as) replied: "My father (as) would stop briefly at al-Abtah, then enter the houses without sleeping there."
I asked him: "What about someone who hastened in two days—is it required for him to stay at al-Abtah?"
Imam (as) replied: "No."
arabicText: 3027 - رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ اَلْحَصْبَةِ فَقَالَ «كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَنْزِلُ اَلْأَبْطَحَ قَلِيلاً ثُمَّ يَدْخُلُ اَلْبُيُوتَ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ يَنَامَ بِالْأَبْطَحِ » فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أَ رَأَيْتَ مَنْ «تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ » عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُحَصِّبَ قَالَ «لاَ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3027 - Aban narrated from Abu Maryam, from Abu Abdullah (as), that he was asked about al-Hasba (staying at al-Abtah after completing the rites of Hajj).
thaqalaynMatn:
Imam (as) replied: "My father (as) would stop briefly at al-Abtah, then enter the houses without sleeping there."
I asked him: "What about someone who hastened in two days—is it required for him to stay at al-Abtah?"
Imam (as) replied: "No."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Staying at Al-Hasba
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3028 – Imam (as) said: "My father (as) would stop briefly at al-Hasba and then depart, and it is a place below Khabt and Hirman."
arabicText: 3028 - وَ قَالَ : «كَانَ أَبِي عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَنْزِلُ اَلْحَصْبَةَ قَلِيلاً ثُمَّ يَرْتَحِلُ وَ هُوَ دُونَ خَبْطٍ وَ حِرْمَانٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3028 – Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "My father (as) would stop briefly at al-Hasba and then depart, and it is a place below Khabt and Hirman."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3029 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"It is recommended for a man and a woman not to leave Mecca until they purchase dates with a dirham and give them in charity for what they might have done during their state of ihram and for what occurred in the sacred precincts of Allah (swt), the Almighty."
arabicText: 3029 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «يُسْتَحَبُّ لِلرَّجُلِ وَ اَلْمَرْأَةِ أَنْ لاَ يَخْرُجَا مِنْ مَكَّةَ حَتَّى يَشْتَرِيَا بِدِرْهَمٍ تَمْراً فَيَتَصَدَّقَا بِهِ لِمَا كَانَ مِنْهُمَا فِي إِحْرَامِهِمَا وَ لِمَا كَانَ فِي حَرَمِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3029 - Mu'awiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It is recommended for a man and a woman not to leave Mecca until they purchase dates with a dirham and give them in charity for what they might have done during their state of ihram and for what occurred in the sacred precincts of Allah (swt), the Almighty."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3030 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said: "It refers to what happens to a person during the state of ihram. When he enters Mecca, performs the tawaf, and speaks good words, that becomes an expiation for what occurred during his ihram."
arabicText: 3030 - وَ رَوَى أَبُو بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ» قَالَ «مَا يَكُونُ مِنَ اَلرَّجُلِ فِي حَالِ إِحْرَامِهِ فَإِذَا دَخَلَ مَكَّةَ وَ طَافَ وَ تَكَلَّمَ بِكَلاَمٍ طَيِّبٍ كَانَ ذَلِكَ كَفَّارَةً لِذَلِكَ اَلَّذِي كَانَ مِنْهُ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3030 - Abu Basir narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It refers to what happens to a person during the state of ihram. When he enters Mecca, performs the tawaf, and speaks good words, that becomes an expiation for what occurred during his ihram."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3031 - Dharih al-Muharibi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said: "The prescribed duties refer to meeting the Imam."
arabicText: 3031 - وَ رَوَى ذَرِيحٌ اَلْمُحَارِبِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ» قَالَ «اَلتَّفَثُ لِقَاءُ اَلْإِمَامِ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3031 - Dharih al-Muharibi narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The prescribed duties refer to meeting the Imam."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3032 - Rabi‘ narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abu Ja‘far (as), regarding the saying of Allah (swt), the Almighty: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties" (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29).
Imam (as) said: "It refers to trimming the mustache and cutting the nails."
arabicText: 3032 - وَ رَوَى رِبْعِيٌّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي قَوْلِهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ» قَالَ «قَصُّ اَلشَّارِبِ وَ اَلْأَظْفَارِ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3033 - In a narration by al-Nadr from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as):
"The tafath refers to shaving (the head) and what pertains to the skin of a person."
arabicText: 3033 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلنَّضْرِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «أَنَّ اَلتَّفَثَ هُوَ اَلْحَلْقُ وَ مَا فِي جِلْدِ اَلْإِنْسَانِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3033 - In a narration by al-Nadr from Abdullah ibn Sinan, from Abu Abdullah (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "The tafath refers to shaving (the head) and what pertains to the skin of a person."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3034 - In a narration by Zurara from Humran, from Abu Ja'far (as):
"The tafath refers to a man's avoidance of perfumes. Once he has completed his rites, perfume becomes permissible for him."
arabicText: 3034 - وَ رَوَى زُرَارَةُ عَنْ حُمْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «أَنَّ اَلتَّفَثَ حُفُوفُ اَلرَّجُلِ مِنَ اَلطِّيبِ فَإِذَا قَضَى نُسُكَهُ حَلَّ لَهُ اَلطِّيبُ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3034 - In a narration by Zurara from Humran, from Abu Ja'far (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "The tafath refers to a man's avoidance of perfumes. Once he has completed his rites, perfume becomes permissible for him."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3035 - In a narration by Al-Bazanti from Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as):
"The tafath is the clipping of the nails, the removal of dirt, and the removal of the Ihram (pilgrim's garment) from oneself."
arabicText: 3035 - وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ اَلْبَزَنْطِيِّ عَنِ اَلرِّضَا عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلتَّفَثُ تَقْلِيمُ اَلْأَظْفَارِ وَ طَرْحُ اَلْوَسَخِ وَ طَرْحُ اَلْإِحْرَامِ عَنْهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3035 - In a narration by Al-Bazanti from Abu Al-Hasan Imam Ali ibn Musa Ar-Ridha (as):
thaqalaynMatn: "The tafath is the clipping of the nails, the removal of dirt, and the removal of the Ihram (pilgrim's garment) from oneself."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Fulfilling the Acts of Grooming (qada' Al-tafath)
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3036 - In a narration from Abdullah ibn Sinan:
"I came to Abu Abdullah (as) and asked, 'May I be your ransom, what is the meaning of Allah’s (swt) saying: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties ('tafath')..."?' (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29)
Imam (as) replied: 'It refers to trimming the mustache, cutting the nails, and similar actions.'
I then said: 'May I be your ransom, but Zarih al-Muharibi narrated to me from you that you said:
"Let them complete their prescribed duties ('tafath')" means meeting the Imam, and "fulfill their vows" refers to fulfilling the rituals.'
Imam (as) said: Zarih has spoken the truth, and so have you. Verily, the Qur'an has an apparent meaning and a hidden meaning. And not everyone can bear what Zarih can bear.'"
arabicText: 3036 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ : أَتَيْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جَعَلَنِيَ اَللَّهُ فِدَاكَ مَا مَعْنَى قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «۝ ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ ۝» قَالَ «أَخْذُ اَلشَّارِبِ وَ قَصُّ اَلْأَظْفَارِ وَ مَا أَشْبَهَ ذَلِكَ» قَالَ قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ فَإِنَّ ذَرِيحاً اَلْمُحَارِبِيَّ حَدَّثَنِي عَنْكَ أَنَّكَ قُلْتَ « «لْيَقْضُوا تَفَثَهُمْ» لِقَاءُ اَلْإِمَامِ «وَ لْيُوفُوا نُذُورَهُمْ» تِلْكَ اَلْمَنَاسِكُ» قَالَ «صَدَقَ ذَرِيحٌ وَ صَدَقْتَ إِنَّ لِلْقُرْآنِ ظَاهِراً وَ بَاطِناً وَ مَنْ يَحْتَمِلُ مَا يَحْتَمِلُ ذَرِيحٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3036 - In a narration from Abdullah ibn Sinan:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I came to Abu Abdullah (as) and asked, 'May I be your ransom, what is the meaning of Allah’s (swt) saying: "Then let them complete their prescribed duties ('tafath')..."?' (Surah Al-Hajj 22:29)
Imam (as) replied: 'It refers to trimming the mustache, cutting the nails, and similar actions.'
I then said: 'May I be your ransom, but Zarih al-Muharibi narrated to me from you that you said:
"Let them complete their prescribed duties ('tafath')" means meeting the Imam, and "fulfill their vows" refers to fulfilling the rituals.'
Imam (as) said: Zarih has spoken the truth, and so have you. Verily, the Qur'an has an apparent meaning and a hidden meaning. And not everyone can bear what Zarih can bear.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Days of Sacrifice
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3037 - In a narration from Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the days of sacrifice (Adha) in Mina.
Imam (as) replied: 'Four days.'
I then asked him about the days of sacrifice in other towns.
Imam (as) said: 'Three days.'
Imam (as) further stated: 'If a man returns to his family two days after the Adha, he may offer the sacrifice on the third day upon his return.'"
arabicText: 3037 - رَوَى عَمَّارُ بْنُ مُوسَى اَلسَّابَاطِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْأَضْحَى بِمِنًى قَالَ «أَرْبَعَةُ أَيَّامٍ» وَ عَنِ اَلْأَضْحَى فِي سَائِرِ اَلْبُلْدَانِ قَالَ «ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ» وَ قَالَ «لَوْ أَنَّ رَجُلاً قَدِمَ إِلَى أَهْلِهِ بَعْدَ اَلْأَضْحَى بِيَوْمَيْنِ ضَحَّى اَلْيَوْمَ اَلثَّالِثَ اَلَّذِي يَقْدَمُ فِيهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3037 - In a narration from Ammar ibn Musa al-Sabati:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the days of sacrifice (Adha) in Mina.
Imam (as) replied: 'Four days.'
I then asked him about the days of sacrifice in other towns.
Imam (as) said: 'Three days.'
Imam (as) further stated: 'If a man returns to his family two days after the Adha, he may offer the sacrifice on the third day upon his return.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Days of Sacrifice
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3038 - In a narration from Kulayb al-Asadi:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the sacrifice (nahr).
Imam (as) said: 'As for Mina, it is for three days. As for other towns, it is only one day.'"
arabicText: 3038 - وَ رَوَى كُلَيْبٌ اَلْأَسَدِيُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلنَّحْرِ فَقَالَ «أَمَّا بِمِنًى فَثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَ أَمَّا فِي اَلْبُلْدَانِ فَيَوْمٌ وَاحِدٌ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3038 - In a narration from Kulayb al-Asadi:
thaqalaynMatn:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the sacrifice (nahr).
Imam (as) said: 'As for Mina, it is for three days. As for other towns, it is only one day.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Days of Sacrifice
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3039 - Narrated by Saif ibn Amira from Mansur ibn Hazim, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
"I heard him say: 'The sacrifice (nahr) in Mina is for three days. Whoever wishes to fast must not fast until the three days have passed. The sacrifice in other towns is only one day, so whoever wishes to fast may begin from the next day.'"
arabicText: 3039 - مَا رَوَاهُ سَيْفُ بْنُ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ : «اَلنَّحْرُ بِمِنًى ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ فَمَنْ أَرَادَ اَلصَّوْمَ لَمْ يَصُمْ حَتَّى تَمْضِيَ اَلثَّلاَثَةُ اَلْأَيَّامِ وَ اَلنَّحْرُ بِالْأَمْصَارِ يَوْمٌ فَمَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَصُومَ صَامَ مِنَ اَلْغَدِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3039 - Narrated by Saif ibn Amira from Mansur ibn Hazim, from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "I heard him say: 'The sacrifice (nahr) in Mina is for three days. Whoever wishes to fast must not fast until the three days have passed. The sacrifice in other towns is only one day, so whoever wishes to fast may begin from the next day.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Days of Sacrifice
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3040 - It is narrated:
"The Eid al-Adha (sacrifice) lasts for three days, and the first day is the most virtuous."
arabicText: 3040 - وَ رُوِي : «أَنَّ اَلْأَضْحَى ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَ أَفْضَلُهَا أَوَّلُهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3040 - It is narrated:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Eid al-Adha (sacrifice) lasts for three days, and the first day is the most virtuous."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Greater and Lesser Pilgrimages
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3041 - It is narrated from Mu'awiya ibn Ammar who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the Day of the Greater Pilgrimage (Yawm al-Hajj al-Akbar). He said, 'It is the Day of Sacrifice (Yawm al-Nahr), and the Lesser Pilgrimage (al-Asghar) is the Umrah.'"
arabicText: 3041 - رُوِيَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ يَوْمَ اَلْحَجِّ اَلْأَكْبَرِ فَقَالَ «هُوَ يَوْمُ اَلنَّحْرِ وَ اَلْأَصْغَرُ هُوَ اَلْعُمْرَةُ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3041 - It is narrated from Mu'awiya ibn Ammar who said:
"I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about the Day of the Greater Pilgrimage (Yawm al-Hajj al-Akbar). He said,
thaqalaynMatn: 'It is the Day of Sacrifice (Yawm al-Nahr), and the Lesser Pilgrimage (al-Asghar) is the Umrah.'"

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on the Greater and Lesser Pilgrimages
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3042 - It is narrated from Sulaiman ibn Dawood al-Minqari, from Fudhayl ibn Iyadh, from Abu Abdullah (as), in the conclusion of a narration where he said:
"It was called the Greater Pilgrimage (Hajj al-Akbar) because it was the year in which both Muslims and polytheists performed Hajj, and after that year, the polytheists no longer performed Hajj."
arabicText: 3042 - وفي رواية سليمان بن داود المنقري، عن فضيل بن عياض ، عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في آخر حديث يقول فيه: " إنما سمي الحج الأكبر لأنها كانت سنة حج فيها المسلمون والمشركون ولم يحج المشركون بعد تلك السنة ".
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3042 - It is narrated from Sulaiman ibn Dawood al-Minqari, from Fudhayl ibn Iyadh, from Abu Abdullah (as), in the conclusion of a narration where he said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It was called the Greater Pilgrimage (Hajj al-Akbar) because it was the year in which both Muslims and polytheists performed Hajj, and after that year, the polytheists no longer performed Hajj."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3043 - It is narrated from Suwayd al-Qallāʾ, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Imam Abu Jaʿfar (as), who said:
"The sacrifice (udhiyya) is obligatory upon anyone who can afford it, whether young or old, and it is also a sunnah."
arabicText: 3043 - رَوَى سُوَيْدٌ اَلْقَلاَّءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْأُضْحِيَّةُ وَاجِبَةٌ عَلَى مَنْ وَجَدَ مِنْ صَغِيرٍ أَوْ كَبِيرٍ وَ هِيَ سُنَّةٌ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3043 - It is narrated from Suwayd al-Qallāʾ, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Imam Abu Jaʿfar (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The sacrifice (udhiyya) is obligatory upon anyone who can afford it, whether young or old, and it is also a sunnah."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3044 - It is narrated from Al-ʿAlāʾ ibn al-Fuḍayl, from Abu ʿAbdillah (as), that a man asked him about the sacrifice (udhiyya).
Imam (as) replied: "It is obligatory upon every Muslim except for one who cannot afford it."
The questioner then asked: "What do you say regarding the dependents?"
Imam (as) said: "If you wish, you may perform it for them, and if you wish, you may not. However, as for you, do not neglect it."
arabicText: 3044 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ اَلْعَلاَءِ بْنِ اَلْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : أَنَّ رَجُلاً سَأَلَهُ عَنِ اَلْأَضْحَى فَقَالَ «هُوَ وَاجِبٌ عَلَى كُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ إِلاَّ مَنْ لَمْ يَجِدْ» فَقَالَ لَهُ اَلسَّائِلُ فَمَا تَرَى فِي اَلْعِيَالِ قَالَ «إِنْ شِئْتَ فَعَلْتَ وَ إِنْ شِئْتَ لَمْ تَفْعَلْ وَ أَمَّا أَنْتَ فَلاَ تَدَعْهُ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3044 - It is narrated from Al-ʿAlāʾ ibn al-Fuḍayl, from Abu ʿAbdillah (as), that
thaqalaynMatn:
a man asked him about the sacrifice (udhiyya).
Imam (as) replied: "It is obligatory upon every Muslim except for one who cannot afford it."
The questioner then asked: "What do you say regarding the dependents?"
Imam (as) said: "If you wish, you may perform it for them, and if you wish, you may not. However, as for you, do not neglect it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3045 - It is narrated that Umm Salama (may Allah (swt) be pleased with her) came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) and said:
"O Messenger of Allah (swt), the time for sacrifice (Udhiyya) has come, and I do not have the means to afford the sacrificial animal. Should I take a loan and offer the sacrifice?"
Imam (as) replied: "Take the loan, for it is a debt that will be repaid."
arabicText: 3045 - وَ جَاءَتْ أُمُّ سَلَمَةَ رَضِيَ اَللَّهُ عَنْهَا إِلَى اَلنَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فَقَالَتْ : يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ يَحْضُرُ اَلْأَضْحَى وَ لَيْسَ عِنْدِي ثَمَنُ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ فَأَسْتَقْرِضُ وَ أُضَحِّي قَالَ «فَاسْتَقْرِضِي فَإِنَّهُ دَيْنٌ مَقْضِيٌّ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3045 - It is narrated that Umm Salama (may Allah (swt) be pleased with her) came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) and said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"O Messenger of Allah (swt), the time for sacrifice (Udhiyya) has come, and I do not have the means to afford the sacrificial animal. Should I take a loan and offer the sacrifice?"
Imam (as) replied: "Take the loan, for it is a debt that will be repaid."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3046 - The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) offered a sacrifice of two rams. He slaughtered one with his own hand and said:
"O Allah (swt), this is on behalf of me and on behalf of those from my household who could not offer a sacrifice."
Then he slaughtered the other and said:
"O Allah (swt), this is on behalf of me and on behalf of those in my nation who could not offer a sacrifice."
Similarly, Amir al-Mu'minin (as) would offer a sacrifice on behalf of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) every year. He would slaughter a ram and say:
"In the name of Allah (swt), 'I have set my face firmly towards Him who created the heavens and the earth, inclining towards truth, and I am not of those who associate partners with Allah (swt). Truly, my prayer, my sacrifice, my life, and my death are all for Allah (swt), the Lord (azj) of all the worlds. O Allah (swt), this is from You and for You.'"
Then he would say:
"O Allah (swt), this is on behalf of Your Prophet."
Imam (as) would then slaughter the ram and afterward sacrifice another ram for himself.
arabicText: 3046 - وَ ضَحَّى رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ بِكَبْشَيْنِ ذَبَحَ وَاحِداً بِيَدِهِ فَقَالَ « اَللَّهُمَّ هَذَا عَنِّي وَ عَمَّنْ لَمْ يُضَحِّ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتِي » وَ ذَبَحَ اَلْآخَرَ وَ قَالَ -: « اَللَّهُمَّ هَذَا عَنِّي وَ عَنْ مَنْ لَمْ يُضَحِّ مِنْ أُمَّتِي » وَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ اَلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يُضَحِّي عَنْ رَسُولِ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ كُلَّ سَنَةٍ بِكَبْشٍ فَيَذْبَحُهُ وَ يَقُولُ: « بِسْمِ اَللَّهِ «وَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي فَطَرَ اَلسَّمٰاوٰاتِ وَ اَلْأَرْضَ حَنِيفاً» مُسْلِماً «وَ مٰا أَنَا مِنَ اَلْمُشْرِكِينَ » «إِنَّ صَلاٰتِي وَ نُسُكِي وَ مَحْيٰايَ وَ مَمٰاتِي لِلّٰهِ رَبِّ اَلْعٰالَمِينَ» اَللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَ لَكَ » ثُمَّ يَقُولُ « اَللَّهُمَّ هَذَا عَنْ نَبِيِّكَ » ثُمَّ يَذْبَحُهُ وَ يَذْبَحُ كَبْشاً آخَرَ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3047 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) commanded us regarding sacrifices that we examine the eyes and ears of the animal and avoid one that is defective in the ears, such as being torn, slit, cut from the front, or cut from the back."
arabicText: 3047 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «أَمَرَنَا رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ فِي اَلْأَضَاحِيِّ أَنْ نَسْتَشْرِفَ اَلْعَيْنَ وَ اَلْأُذُنَ وَ نَهَانَا عَنِ اَلْخَرْقَاءِ وَ اَلشَّرْقَاءِ وَ اَلْمُقَابَلَةِ وَ اَلْمُدَابَرَةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3047 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) commanded us regarding sacrifices that we examine the eyes and ears of the animal and avoid one that is defective in the ears, such as being torn, slit, cut from the front, or cut from the back."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3048 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
"A lame animal with a clear limp, a one-eyed animal with evident blindness, an extremely thin animal, a mangy animal, a maimed animal, or one with a broken horn should not be offered as a sacrifice."
arabicText: 3048 - وَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اَللَّهِ صَلَّى اَللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ : «لاَ يُضَحَّى بِعَرْجَاءَ بَيِّنٍ عَرَجُهَا وَ لاَ بِالْعَوْرَاءِ بَيِّنٍ عَوَرُهَا وَ لاَ بِالْعَجْفَاءِ وَ لاَ بِالْجَرْبَاءِ وَ لاَ بِالْجَدْعَاءِ وَ لاَ بِالْعَضْبَاءِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3048 - The Messenger of Allah (swt) (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A lame animal with a clear limp, a one-eyed animal with evident blindness, an extremely thin animal, a mangy animal, a maimed animal, or one with a broken horn should not be offered as a sacrifice."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3049 - It is narrated from Dawud Al-Raqqi who said:
One of the Kharijites asked me about the verse from the Book of Allah (swt), the Exalted,
"Eight pairs: of sheep two, and of goats two... and of camels two, and of oxen two" (Surah Al-An‘am: 143–144).
He asked: "What has Allah (swt) permitted from these, and what has He forbidden?"
I did not have an answer at that time, so I went to Abu Abdullah (as) while I was on pilgrimage and informed him of the matter.
Imam (as) said: "Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has permitted in the sacrifice at Mina the domesticated sheep and goats, and He has forbidden the wild (mountainous) species of them. As for His saying, 'And of camels two, and of oxen two,' Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has permitted the Arabian camels for sacrifice at Mina, but He has forbidden the imported Bactrian camels. He has permitted domesticated cattle to be sacrificed, but He has forbidden the wild species of them."
So I returned to the man and informed him of this response, to which he replied:
"This is something carried by the camels from the Hijaz."
arabicText: 3049 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ دَاوُدَ اَلرَّقِّيِّ قَالَ : سَأَلَنِي بَعْضُ اَلْخَوَارِجِ عَنْ هَذِهِ اَلْآيَةِ مِنْ كِتَابِ اَللَّهِ تَعَالَى «۝ ثَمٰانِيَةَ أَزْوٰاجٍ مِنَ اَلضَّأْنِ اِثْنَيْنِ وَ مِنَ اَلْمَعْزِ اِثْنَيْنِ ۝» إِلَى قَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى: «وَ مِنَ اَلْإِبِلِ اِثْنَيْنِ وَ مِنَ اَلْبَقَرِ اِثْنَيْنِ» مَا اَلَّذِي أَحَلَّ اَللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ وَ مَا اَلَّذِي حَرَّمَ فَلَمْ يَكُنْ عِنْدِي فِيهِ شَيْءٌ فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ وَ أَنَا حَاجٌّ فَأَخْبَرْتُهُ بِمَا كَانَ فَقَالَ «إِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى أَحَلَّ فِي اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ بِمِنًى اَلضَّأْنَ وَ اَلْمَعْزَ اَلْأَهْلِيَّةَ وَ حَرَّمَ أَنْ يُضَحَّى فِيهِ بِالْجَبَلِيَّةِ وَ أَمَّا قَوْلُهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «وَ مِنَ اَلْإِبِلِ اِثْنَيْنِ وَ مِنَ اَلْبَقَرِ اِثْنَيْنِ» فَإِنَّ اَللَّهَ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى أَحَلَّ فِي اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ بِمِنًى اَلْإِبِلَ اَلْعِرَابَ وَ حَرَّمَ فِيهَا اَلْبَخَاتِيَّ وَ أَحَلَّ اَلْبَقَرَ اَلْأَهْلِيَّةَ أَنْ يُضَحَّى بِهَا وَ حَرَّمَ اَلْجَبَلِيَّةَ» فَانْصَرَفْتُ إِلَى اَلرَّجُلِ وَ أَخْبَرْتُهُ بِهَذَا اَلْجَوَابِ فَقَالَ هَذَا شَيْءٌ حَمَلَتْهُ اَلْإِبِلُ مِنَ اَلْحِجَازِ.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3049 - It is narrated from Dawud Al-Raqqi who said:
One of the Kharijites asked me about the verse from the Book of Allah (swt), the Exalted,
"Eight pairs: of sheep two, and of goats two... and of camels two, and of oxen two" (Surah Al-An‘am: 143–144).
He asked: "What has Allah (swt) permitted from these, and what has He forbidden?"
I did not have an answer at that time, so I went to Abu Abdullah (as) while I was on pilgrimage and informed him of the matter.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn:
"Indeed, Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has permitted in the sacrifice at Mina the domesticated sheep and goats, and He has forbidden the wild (mountainous) species of them. As for His saying, 'And of camels two, and of oxen two,' Allah (swt), the Blessed and Exalted, has permitted the Arabian camels for sacrifice at Mina, but He has forbidden the imported Bactrian camels. He has permitted domesticated cattle to be sacrificed, but He has forbidden the wild species of them."
So I returned to the man and informed him of this response, to which he replied:
"This is something carried by the camels from the Hijaz."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3050 - It is narrated by Aban from Zurara from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
"A ram suffices for a man and his household; he may offer it as a sacrifice on their behalf."
arabicText: 3050 - وَ رَوَى أَبَانٌ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْكَبْشُ يُجْزِي عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ وَ عَنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ يُضَحِّي بِهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3050 - It is narrated by Aban from Zurara from Abu Ja'far (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A ram suffices for a man and his household; he may offer it as a sacrifice on their behalf."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3051 - Yunus ibn Ya’qub asked Abu Abdullah (as) about sacrificing a cow.
Imam (as) said: "It suffices for seven individuals."
arabicText: 3051 - وَ سَأَلَ يُونُسُ بْنُ يَعْقُوبَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْبَقَرَةِ يُضَحَّى بِهَا فَقَالَ «تُجْزِي عَنْ سَبْعَةِ نَفَرٍ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3051 - Yunus ibn Ya’qub asked Abu Abdullah (as) about sacrificing a cow.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "It suffices for seven individuals."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3052 - Wuhayb ibn Hafs narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
"A cow or a camel suffices for seven individuals, whether they are from one household or from different ones."
arabicText: 3052 - وَ رَوَى وُهَيْبُ بْنُ حَفْصٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «اَلْبَقَرَةُ وَ اَلْبَدَنَةُ تُجْزِيَانِ عَنْ سَبْعَةِ نَفَرٍ إِذَا كَانُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ أَوْ مِنْ غَيْرِهِمْ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3052 - Wuhayb ibn Hafs narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A cow or a camel suffices for seven individuals, whether they are from one household or from different ones."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3053 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "Then when they are down on their sides (after being sacrificed), eat from them and feed the contented one and the beggar." (Surah Al-Hajj 22:36)
Imam (as) replied: "The 'contented one' is the one who accepts whatever you give him, and the 'beggar' is the one who approaches you asking."
arabicText: 3053 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ قَوْلِ اَللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ «فَإِذٰا وَجَبَتْ جُنُوبُهٰا فَكُلُوا مِنْهٰا وَ أَطْعِمُوا اَلْقٰانِعَ وَ اَلْمُعْتَرَّ» قَالَ «اَلْقَانِعُ هُوَ اَلَّذِي يَقْنَعُ بِمَا تُعْطِيهِ وَ اَلْمُعْتَرُّ اَلَّذِي يَعْتَرِيكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3053 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the words of Allah (swt), the Exalted: "Then when they are down on their sides (after being sacrificed), eat from them and feed the contented one and the beggar." (Surah Al-Hajj 22:36)
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "The 'contented one' is the one who accepts whatever you give him, and the 'beggar' is the one who approaches you asking."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3054 - It is narrated that Imam Ali ibn al-Husayn (as) and Imam Abu Ja'far (Al-Baqir) (as) used to distribute their sacrificial meat in three parts:
One-third was given to their neighbors.
One-third was given to the needy and beggars.
One-third was kept for the members of their household.
arabicText: 3054 - : وَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ اَلْحُسَيْنِ وَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ يَتَصَدَّقَانِ بِثُلُثٍ عَلَى جِيرَانِهِمْ وَ بِثُلُثٍ عَلَى اَلسُّؤَّالِ وَ بِثُلُثٍ يُمْسِكَانِهِ لِأَهْلِ اَلْبَيْتِ.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3055 - It is narrated that Imam Abu Abdullah (as) disliked giving the meat of sacrificial animals to polytheists.
arabicText: 3055 - وَ كَرِهَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ أَنْ يُطْعَمَ اَلْمُشْرِكُ مِنْ لُحُومِ اَلْأَضَاحِيِّ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3055 - It is narrated that
thaqalaynMatn: Imam Abu Abdullah (as) disliked giving the meat of sacrificial animals to polytheists.

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3056 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "We used to forbid people from taking the meat of sacrificial animals out of Mina after three days due to the scarcity of meat and the large number of people. But today, the meat has become abundant, and the people have decreased, so there is no harm in taking it out."
arabicText: 3056 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «كُنَّا نَنْهَى اَلنَّاسَ عَنْ إِخْرَاجِ لُحُومِ اَلْأَضَاحِيِّ مِنْ مِنًى بَعْدَ ثَلاَثٍ لِقِلَّةِ اَللَّحْمِ وَ كَثْرَةِ اَلنَّاسِ فَأَمَّا اَلْيَوْمَ فَقَدْ كَثُرَ اَللَّحْمُ وَ قَلَّ اَلنَّاسُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِإِخْرَاجِهِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3056 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "We used to forbid people from taking the meat of sacrificial animals out of Mina after three days due to the scarcity of meat and the large number of people. But today, the meat has become abundant, and the people have decreased, so there is no harm in taking it out."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3057 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) was asked about the atonement for hunting: can the individual eat from its meat?
Imam (as) replied: "He eats from his sacrificial offering and gives the atonement in charity."
arabicText: 3057 - وَ سُئِلَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ فِدَاءِ اَلصَّيْدِ يَأْكُلُ صَاحِبُهُ مِنْ لَحْمِهِ فَقَالَ «يَأْكُلُ مِنْ أُضْحِيَّتِهِ وَ يَتَصَدَّقُ بِالْفِدَاءِ ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3058 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said: "A sacrificial animal should only be purchased during the ten days (of Dhul-Hijjah)."
arabicText: 3058 - وَ قَالَ اَلصَّادِقُ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ يُضَحَّى إِلاَّ بِمَا يُشْتَرَى فِي اَلْعَشْرِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3058 - Imam Jafar ibn Muhammad Al-Sadiq (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A sacrificial animal should only be purchased during the ten days (of Dhul-Hijjah)."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3059 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who purchases a sacrificial animal that is one-eyed, but he only realizes it after buying it. Does it suffice for him?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, unless it is for a hady (sacrificial offering for Hajj), for it is not permissible for it to be deficient."
arabicText: 3059 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلرَّجُلِ يَشْتَرِي اَلضَّحِيَّةَ عَوْرَاءَ فَلاَ يَعْلَمُ إِلاَّ بَعْدَ شِرَائِهَا هَلْ تُجْزِي عَنْهُ قَالَ «نَعَمْ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ هَدْياً فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَجُوزُ أَنْ يَكُونَ نَاقِصاً».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3059 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a man who purchases a sacrificial animal that is one-eyed, but he only realizes it after buying it. Does it suffice for him?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, unless it is for a hady (sacrificial offering for Hajj), for it is not permissible for it to be deficient."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3060 - Abu Ja'far (as) was asked about an old animal whose front teeth have fallen out. Is it permissible for sacrifice?
Imam (as) replied: "There is no harm in sacrificing it."
arabicText: 3060 - وَ سُئِلَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنْ هَرِمَةٍ قَدْ سَقَطَتْ ثَنَايَاهَا هَلْ تُجْزِي فِي اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يُضَحَّى بِهَا ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3061 – Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said: "A sacrifice is not performed on behalf of one who is in the womb."
arabicText: 3061 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ يُضَحَّى عَمَّنْ فِي اَلْبَطْنِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3061 – Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "A sacrifice is not performed on behalf of one who is in the womb."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3062 - Jameel narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a sacrificial animal whose horn is broken.
Imam (as) said: "If the inner horn is intact, it suffices."
arabicText: 3062 - وَ رَوَى جَمِيلٌ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ يُكْسَرُ قَرْنُهَا قَالَ «إِذَا كَانَ اَلْقَرْنُ اَلدَّاخِلُ صَحِيحاً فَهِيَ تُجْزِي ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3062 - Jameel narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a sacrificial animal whose horn is broken.
Imam (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the inner horn is intact, it suffices."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3063 - It is narrated from Abdullah ibn Umar: "We were in Mecca, and the prices of sacrificial animals increased. We bought for one dinar, then for two dinars, and then it reached seven dinars, and after that, we could not find any—neither for a little nor a lot. Hisham al-Mukari wrote to Abu al-Hasan (as) about this, and Imam (as) replied:
'Consider the first price, the second, and the third, add them together, and then give in charity an amount equivalent to one-third of it.'"
arabicText: 3063 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ : كُنَّا بِمَكَّةَ فَأَصَابَنَا غَلاَءٌ فِي اَلْأَضَاحِيِّ فَاشْتَرَيْنَا بِدِينَارٍ ثُمَّ بِدِينَارَيْنِ ثُمَّ بَلَغَتْ سَبْعَةً ثُمَّ لَمْ نَجِدْ بِقَلِيلٍ وَ لاَ كَثِيرٍ فَوَقَّعَ هِشَامٌ اَلْمُكَارِي إِلَى أَبِي اَلْحَسَنِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ بِذَلِكَ فَوَقَّعَ إِلَيْهِ «اُنْظُرُوا اَلثَّمَنَ اَلْأَوَّلَ وَ اَلثَّانِيَ وَ اَلثَّالِثَ فَاجْمَعُوهُ ثُمَّ تَصَدَّقُوا بِمِثْلِ ثُلُثِهِ».

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3064 - Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
"No sacrifice is to be made with any of the domesticated birds."
arabicText: 3064 - وَ قَالَ أَبُو اَلْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : «لاَ يُضَحَّى بِشَيْءٍ مِنَ اَلدَّوَاجِنِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3064 - Abu al-Hasan Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "No sacrifice is to be made with any of the domesticated birds."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3065 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a sacrificial animal: if the one slaughtering it mistakenly mentions a name other than its owner, does it suffice for the owner of the sacrifice?
Imam (as) replied: "Yes, it is for the one who intended it."
arabicText: 3065 - وَ سَأَلَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ جَعْفَرٍ أَخَاهُ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ يُخْطِئُ اَلَّذِي يَذْبَحُهَا فَيُسَمِّي غَيْرَ صَاحِبِهَا أَ تُجْزِي عَنْ صَاحِبِ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ قَالَ «نَعَمْ إِنَّمَا لَهُ مَا نَوَى.
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3065 - Ali ibn Ja'far asked his brother Imam Musa ibn Jafar Al-Kadhim (as) about a sacrificial animal: if the one slaughtering it mistakenly mentions a name other than its owner, does it suffice for the owner of the sacrifice?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "Yes, it is for the one who intended it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3066 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
"If a man purchases a sacrificial camel that is emaciated, it does not suffice for him. But if he purchases it while it is fat and then finds it to be emaciated, it suffices for him. The same applies to the hady of a Mutamatti' (performing Hajj Tamattu')."
arabicText: 3066 - وَ قَالَ عَلِيٌّ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : «إِذَا اِشْتَرَى اَلرَّجُلُ اَلْبَدَنَةَ عَجْفَاءَ فَلاَ تُجْزِي عَنْهُ وَ إِنِ اِشْتَرَاهَا سَمِينَةً فَوَجَدَهَا عَجْفَاءَ أَجْزَأَتْ عَنْهُ وَ فِي هَدْيِ اَلْمُتَمَتِّعِ مِثْلُ ذَلِكَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3066 - Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (as) said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man purchases a sacrificial camel that is emaciated, it does not suffice for him. But if he purchases it while it is fat and then finds it to be emaciated, it suffices for him. The same applies to the hady of a Mutamatti' (performing Hajj Tamattu')."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3067 - Muhammad al-Halabi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a group of people—does a cow suffice for them?
Imam (as) replied: "As for the hady (sacrificial offering for Hajj), no. But as for the sacrifice (Udhiyah), yes. And the hady suffices in place of the sacrifice."
arabicText: 3067 - وَ سَأَلَ مُحَمَّدٌ اَلْحَلَبِيُّ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : عَنِ اَلنَّفَرِ تُجْزِيهِمُ اَلْبَقَرَةُ فَقَالَ «أَمَّا فِي اَلْهَدْيِ فَلاَ وَ أَمَّا فِي اَلْأَضْحَى فَنَعَمْ وَ يُجْزِي اَلْهَدْيُ عَنِ اَلْأُضْحِيَّةِ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3067 - Muhammad al-Halabi asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a group of people—does a cow suffice for them?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "As for the hady (sacrificial offering for Hajj), no. But as for the sacrifice (Udhiyah), yes. And the hady suffices in place of the sacrifice."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Offerings
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3068 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Abdul Karim ibn Amr from Saeed ibn Yasar, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about someone who buys a sheep but does not announce it (as a sacrifice).
Imam (as) replied: "There is no harm whether he announces it or does not announce it."
arabicText: 3068 - وَ رَوَى اَلْبَزَنْطِيُّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلْكَرِيمِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَمَّنِ اِشْتَرَى شَاةً وَ لَمْ يُعَرِّفْ بِهَا فَقَالَ «لاَ بَأْسَ عَرَّفَ بِهَا، أَوْ لَمْ يُعَرِّفْ بِهَا ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3068 - Al-Bazanti narrated from Abdul Karim ibn Amr from Saeed ibn Yasar, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about someone who buys a sheep but does not announce it (as a sacrifice).
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "There is no harm whether he announces it or does not announce it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3069 - Muawiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who brought a sacrificial camel that gave birth.
Imam (as) said: "He should slaughter it and its offspring. If the hady (sacrificial animal) was guaranteed but perished, he should purchase another in its place and another in place of its offspring."
arabicText: 3069 - رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي رَجُلٍ سَاقَ بَدَنَةً فَنُتِجَتْ قَالَ «يَنْحَرُهَا وَ يَنْحَرُ وَلَدَهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَ اَلْهَدْيُ مَضْمُوناً فَهَلَكَ اِشْتَرَى مَكَانَهَا وَ مَكَانَ وَلَدِهَا».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3069 - Muawiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man who brought a sacrificial camel that gave birth.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He should slaughter it and its offspring. If the hady (sacrificial animal) was guaranteed but perished, he should purchase another in its place and another in place of its offspring."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3070 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man whose hady (sacrificial animal) goes missing, and another man finds it and slaughters it.
Imam (as) said: "If he slaughtered it in Mina, it suffices for its owner who lost it. But if he slaughtered it outside of Mina, it does not suffice for its owner."
arabicText: 3070 - وَ رَوَى مَنْصُورُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ : فِي اَلرَّجُلِ يَضِلُّ هَدْيُهُ فَيَجِدُهُ رَجُلٌ آخَرُ فَيَنْحَرُهُ فَقَالَ «إِنْ كَانَ نَحَرَهُ بِمِنًى فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَ عَنْ صَاحِبِهِ اَلَّذِي ضَلَّ عَنْهُ وَ إِنْ كَانَ نَحَرَهُ فِي غَيْرِ مِنًى لَمْ يُجْزِ عَنْ صَاحِبِهِ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3070 - Mansur ibn Hazim narrated from Abu Abdullah (as) regarding a man whose hady (sacrificial animal) goes missing, and another man finds it and slaughters it.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "If he slaughtered it in Mina, it suffices for its owner who lost it. But if he slaughtered it outside of Mina, it does not suffice for its owner."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3071 - Abdul Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "If the hady (sacrificial animal) was announced and then got lost afterward, it suffices."
arabicText: 3071 - وَ رَوَى عَبْدُ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ اَلْحَجَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا عُرِّفَ بِالْهَدْيِ ثُمَّ ضَلَّ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَ ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3071 - Abdul Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If the hady (sacrificial animal) was announced and then got lost afterward, it suffices."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3072 - It is narrated from Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari, who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "A man brought a hady (sacrificial animal), and it perished in a place where he could not find anyone to give it in charity, nor would anyone know that it is a hady."
Imam (as) replied: "He should slaughter it and place a written note on it so that whoever passes by it knows that it is charity."
arabicText: 3072 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ حَفْصِ بْنِ اَلْبَخْتَرِيِّ قَالَ : قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ رَجُلٌ سَاقَ اَلْهَدْيَ فَعَطِبَ فِي مَوْضِعٍ لاَ يَقْدِرُ عَلَى مَنْ يَتَصَدَّقُ بِهِ عَلَيْهِ وَ لاَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُ هَدْيٌ فَقَالَ «يَنْحَرُهُ وَ يَكْتُبُ كِتَاباً يَضَعُهُ عَلَيْهِ لِيَعْلَمَ مَنْ مَرَّ بِهِ أَنَّهُ صَدَقَةٌ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3072 - It is narrated from Hafs ibn al-Bakhtari, who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (as), "A man brought a hady (sacrificial animal), and it perished in a place where he could not find anyone to give it in charity, nor would anyone know that it is a hady."
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "He should slaughter it and place a written note on it so that whoever passes by it knows that it is charity."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3073 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who brought a sacrificial camel, and it broke down before reaching its designated place or was overtaken by death or destruction.
Imam (as) said: "He should slaughter it if he is able and smear its shoe, which was used to mark it, with its blood so that whoever passes by it knows it has been slaughtered. They may eat from its meat if they wish. If the hady (sacrificial offering) is guaranteed, then he must replace it by purchasing another in its place if it breaks down or perishes. A guaranteed offering is one that is obligatory upon him due to a vow or other obligations. But if it is not guaranteed, and it is merely something he undertook voluntarily, then he is not obligated to replace it unless he wishes to do so voluntarily."
arabicText: 3073 - وَ رَوَى اَلْقَاسِمُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ سَاقَ بَدَنَةً فَانْكَسَرَتْ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَبْلُغَ مَحِلَّهَا أَوْ عَرَضَ لَهَا مَوْتٌ أَوْ هَلاَكٌ قَالَ «يُذَكِّيهَا إِنْ قَدَرَ عَلَى ذَلِكَ وَ يَلْطَخُ نَعْلَهَا اَلَّتِي قُلِّدَتْ بِهَا حَتَّى يَعْلَمَ مَنْ مَرَّ بِهَا أَنَّهَا قَدْ ذُكِّيَتْ فَيَأْكُلَ مِنْ لَحْمِهَا إِنْ أَرَادَ فَإِنْ كَانَ اَلْهَدْيُ مَضْمُوناً فَإِنَّ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُعِيدَهُ يَبْتَاعُ مَكَانَ اَلْهَدْيِ إِذَا اِنْكَسَرَ أَوْ هَلَكَ وَ اَلْمَضْمُونُ اَلْوَاجِبُ عَلَيْهِ فِي نَذْرٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ مَضْمُوناً وَ إِنَّمَا هُوَ شَيْءٌ تَطَوَّعَ بِهِ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَبْتَاعَ مَكَانَهُ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَشَاءَ أَنْ يَتَطَوَّعَ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3073 - Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad narrated from Ali ibn Abi Hamzah, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who brought a sacrificial camel, and it broke down before reaching its designated place or was overtaken by death or destruction.
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) said: "He should slaughter it if he is able and smear its shoe, which was used to mark it, with its blood so that whoever passes by it knows it has been slaughtered. They may eat from its meat if they wish. If the hady (sacrificial offering) is guaranteed, then he must replace it by purchasing another in its place if it breaks down or perishes. A guaranteed offering is one that is obligatory upon him due to a vow or other obligations. But if it is not guaranteed, and it is merely something he undertook voluntarily, then he is not obligated to replace it unless he wishes to do so voluntarily."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3074 - It is narrated from Abdul Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, who said: I asked Abu Ibrahim (as) about a man who purchased a hady (sacrificial offering) for his Tamattu' Hajj, brought it to his home, tied it up, and then it got loose and perished. Does it suffice for him, or must he replace it?
Imam (as) replied: "It does not suffice for him unless he is unable to replace it."
arabicText: 3074 - وَ رُوِيَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اَلرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ اَلْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِشْتَرَى هَدْياً لِمُتْعَتِهِ فَأَتَى بِهِ مَنْزِلَهُ فَرَبَطَهُ ثُمَّ اِنْحَلَّ فَهَلَكَ هَلْ يُجْزِيهِ أَوْ يُعِيدُ قَالَ «لاَ يُجْزِيهِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ لاَ قُوَّةَ بِهِ عَلَيْهِ
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3074 - It is narrated from Abdul Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, who said: I asked Abu Ibrahim (as) about a man who purchased a hady (sacrificial offering) for his Tamattu' Hajj, brought it to his home, tied it up, and then it got loose and perished. Does it suffice for him, or must he replace it?
thaqalaynMatn: Imam (as) replied: "It does not suffice for him unless he is unable to replace it."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3075 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who purchased a ram, and it perished.
Imam (as) said: "He should purchase another in its place."
I said: "What if he purchases another in its place and then finds the first one?"
Imam (as) replied: "If both are alive, he should slaughter the first one and sell the other, or if he wishes, he may slaughter it as well. If he has already slaughtered the second one, then he should slaughter the first one along with it."
arabicText: 3075 - وَ رَوَى اِبْنُ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ اِشْتَرَى كَبْشاً فَهَلَكَ مِنْهُ قَالَ «يَشْتَرِي مَكَانَهُ آخَرَ» قُلْتُ فَإِنِ اِشْتَرَى مَكَانَهُ ثُمَّ وَجَدَ اَلْأَوَّلَ قَالَ «إِنْ كَانَا جَمِيعاً قَائِمَيْنِ فَلْيَذْبَحِ اَلْأَوَّلَ وَ لْيَبِعِ اَلْآخَرَ وَ إِنْ شَاءَ ذَبَحَهُ وَ إِنْ كَانَ قَدْ ذَبَحَ اَلْآخَرَ فَلْيَذْبَحِ اَلْأَوَّلَ مَعَهُ.
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3075 - Ibn Muskan narrated from Abu Basir, who said:
thaqalaynMatn:
I asked Abu Abdullah (as) about a man who purchased a ram, and it perished.
Imam (as) said: "He should purchase another in its place."
I said: "What if he purchases another in its place and then finds the first one?"
Imam (as) replied: "If both are alive, he should slaughter the first one and sell the other, or if he wishes, he may slaughter it as well. If he has already slaughtered the second one, then he should slaughter the first one along with it."

author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText: Hadith.3076 - Muawiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said: "If a man comes across a lost sacrificial camel, he should slaughter it and announce that it is a sacrificial animal."
arabicText: 3076 - وَ رَوَى مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اَللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : «إِذَا أَصَابَ اَلرَّجُلُ بَدَنَةً ضَالَّةً فَلْيَنْحَرْهَا وَ يُعْلِمُ أَنَّهَا بَدَنَةٌ».
thaqalaynSanad: Hadith.3076 - Muawiyah ibn Ammar narrated from Abu Abdullah (as), who said:
thaqalaynMatn: "If a man comes across a lost sacrificial camel, he should slaughter it and announce that it is a sacrificial animal."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
chapter: Chapter on Sacrificial Animals That Become Injured or Perish Before Reaching Their Designated Place and What is Permitted to Eat From Them
author: Shaykh Muḥammad b. ʿAlī al-Ṣaduq
englishText:
Hadith.3077 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about a hady (obligatory sacrificial animal) that suffers a fracture or injury—can it be sold, and if sold, what should be done with its price?
Imam (as) replied: "If he sells it, he should give its price in charity and offer another sacrificial animal."
arabicText: 3077 - وَ رَوَى اَلْعَلاَءُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَيْهِمَا اَلسَّلاَمُ قَالَ : سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ اَلْهَدْيِ اَلْوَاجِبِ إِنْ أَصَابَهُ كَسْرٌ أَوْ عَطَبٌ أَ يَبِيعُهُ وَ إِنْ بَاعَهُ مَا يَصْنَعُ بِثَمَنِهِ قَالَ «إِنْ بَاعَهُ فَلْيَتَصَدَّقْ بِثَمَنِهِ وَ يُهْدِي هَدْياً آخَرَ».
thaqalaynSanad:
Hadith.3077 - Al-Ala narrated from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from one of the Imams (as), who said:
I asked him about a hady (obligatory sacrificial animal) that suffers a fracture or injury—can it be sold, and if sold, what should be done with its price?
Imam (as) replied:
thaqalaynMatn: "If he sells it, he should give its price in charity and offer another sacrificial animal."

category: Book of Pilgrimage and Its Virtues
